loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 3 children. 

Roger provides habal-habal or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Roger has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 51-year-old resident of Pandahan, SND, Lanao del Norte. Edna provides for her 3 children's needs from the little amount of PHP 13,800 she gains monthly from her vulcanizing shop business.  She has run this business for 7 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband.  

Edna has been a member of GDMPC since this year.  She has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance for PHP 15,000 to purchase materials needed to provide service. Edna wants to make expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: buy materials for her vulcanizing business

loans.name: Jose Damian

texts.es:
José, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, para realizar la compra de los materiales que estará utilizando en las nuevas siembras de maíz y frijol, comprandose el abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, esto es necesario para prevenir la maleza y las plagas, al mismo tiempo fortalecer la producción de maíz y frijol.

Con el préstamo anterior logró comprarse los materiales necesarios para el cultivo, del cual recibió una buena producción que le ha permitido los alimentos a su familia y cubrir los gastos necesarios como el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose decided to take out a new loan to purchase the materials he will be using in his new crops of corn and beans.  Buying fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides is necessary to prevent maladies and plagues and at the same time to strengthen production of the corn and beans.  

With the previous loan he was able to purchase the necessary materials for his crop which returned strong results and has provided his family with nutrition and money to cover necessary costs like school for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and insecticides

loans.name: Herberth Ovidio

texts.es:
Herbert, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder aumentar el negocio invirtiendo en la compra de productos frescos como el pescado, el camarón, las conchas, que son necesarias para mantener el negocio de mariscos surtido y asimismo ofrecer a sus clientes una calidad mejor.

Como el préstamo anterior logró mejorar el movimiento del negocio, ya que ha obtenido una mejor clientela, en su familia considera que sus condiciones están mejorando, seguirá luchando por obtener mejores ventas y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Herberth is requesting a new loan in order to increase his business by investing in the purchase of fresh products such as fish, shrimp, and conches that are necessary to maintain his business of assorted seafoods. In this way, he will offer a higher quality to his customers. 

The previous loan succeeded in improving business activity, since he has obtained a better clientele. His family believes that their conditions are improving, and he will keep fighting to get better sales and continue to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fish, shrimp, and conches.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish, conches, and various sizes of shrimp.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites, she previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites hopes to give her children a good quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance, spare parts, and accessories

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean is from San Carlos, Tukuran. She is 39 years old. Mary Jean is married and has two children. To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a motorcycle transport business. She been in her business for 5 years and earns 7,000 a month for these activities. In 2009, Mary Jean joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance

loans.name: Narcisa Del Pilar

texts.es: Narcisa hace 12 años abrió su pequeña tienda en su domicilio el cual está en Vergeles norte de Guayaquil. A sus 55 años vive sola ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad y es divorciada, empezó el negocio porque quería tener un medio de ganar dinero pero sin salir de su casa, así fue cómo surgió la idea la cual hizo realidad con la ayuda de sus hijos. Después de varios años y gracias a otro crédito a podido agrandar su negocio. Trabaja en su tienda todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche como ahí mismo vive no tiene ningún problema con el horario, en su tienda vende productos de primera necesidad como es arroz, azúcar, granos, enlatados, artículos de limpieza, snacks,  etc. También se ayuda con el alquiler ya que tiene un departamento sin utilizar el cual arrienda. Su mayor temor son las enfermedades ya que no puede atender cuando eso pasa, espera obtener el crédito para poder comprar mercadería sobre todo confetis y lácteos. Le gustaría poder aumentar sus ventas y que su negocio crezca así a futuro poder arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Narcisa opened her small store 12 years ago in her house, which is in Vergeles, north of Guayaquil. At 55 years old she lives alone, as her children are older and she is divorced. She began the business because she wanted to have a means of earning money, but without leaving her house. So it was that the idea came to her and became reality with the help of her children. After some years, and thanks to another loan, she has been able to expand her business. 

She works in her store every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. Because she lives right there, she doesn’t have any problem with the schedule. In her store, she sells essentials such as rice, sugar, grains, canned goods, cleaning products, snacks, etc. The business also helps with the rent, since she has a space without having to lease. Her greatest fear is becoming ill, because she cannot work when this happens. 

She hopes to obtain a loan in order to be able to purchase goods – most of all, sweets and dairy products. She would like to be able to increase her sales and for her business to grow, so that in the future, she can remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, grains, canned goods, cleaning products, and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Segundo Sebastian

texts.es: Segundo vive en Vergeles norte de la ciudad, a sus 52 años se encuentra soltero y sus hijos son mayores e independientes. Lleva 2 años con la venta de frutas en especial la venta de frutas, también realiza fletes ya que la camioneta donde distribuye el producto es suya. Su trabajo empieza desde muy temprano y lo realiza con una persona, entre los productos que oferta está el coco, piña, plátano, naranjas, sandia, cuando termina sus productos retorna con su familia. Empezó este negocio porque a su edad no podía conseguir empleo en una empresa, además es rentable. Con el préstamo que solicita comprara frutas para vender y también para hacerle algunas reparaciones a su camioneta, espera subir sus ventas y disminuir los gastos. Espera a futuro poder terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Segundo lives in Vergeles, north of the city. He is 52 years old and single, and his children are grown up and independent. He has been selling fruit for the past two years, and he also rents out his truck, which he also uses for distribution. His work starts very early and he works with another person, and among the products he offers are coconuts, pineapples, bananas, oranges and watermelon. When he is done selling the products he returns to his family. He started this business because at his age he wasn't able to find work at a company, plus it's lucrative. With the loan that he is requesting, he plans to purchase fruits to sell and also make some repairs to his truck. He hopes to increase his sales and lower his expenses. He hopes in the future to finish building his home.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts, pineapples, bananas, oranges and watermelons, and to repair his truck.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
Marta, se encuentra solicitando un prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de platillos, en los cuales se utilizan por ejemplo el aceite, maiz, gas, yuca y condimentos, estos productos permitiran que Marta continue brindando un buen servicio a los clientes. 

Con el prestamo anterior, manifiesta que su experiencia ha sido positiva, manteniendose en las ventas a sus clientes y con ingresos estables que le ayudan a cubrir sus necesidades, considera que Kiva a traves de estos prestamos le ha ayudado mucho.
texts.en: Marta is requesting a loan to invest in materials to make her meals, such as oil, corn, propane, yucca and condiments. This products will allow her to continue providing a good service to her customers. She says that her experience with her previous loan has been positive, with her maintaining her sales and having stable income to cover necessities. She thinks that through these loans Kiva has helped her a lot.

loans.use: To purchase oil, corn, propane, yucca and condiments.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 1 Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Ni Made and the other members of the Karanjung Lestari 1 group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Made hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Ni Made will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months to be used for fattening.  With her profits, she will help support her family of two by supplementing their income. Her husband can’t work because of a heart attack.  Ultimately, Ni Made hopes that increased income will enable her to pay for her husband's medicine and also for their future needs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Vidal Claudio

texts.es:
Vidal vive en la ciudad de chincha, Chincha es nombrado por la  cultura de los Chinchas, célebre por sus avanzados conocimientos de la agricultura y sus proezas marítimas. Hoy en día Chincha es una increíble mezcla de culturas, con una gran población afro-peruana, debido a los restos de un pasado indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto a otras ciudades cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañada en el año 2001 y 2007, fechas en las que ocurrieron terremotos de fuerte dimensión, pero ha soportado como siempre lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia, como buen peruano le gusta mucho nuestra comida y uno de los platillos que más le agrada es la riquísima Carapulcra, por motivos económicos Vidal solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de educación secundarias pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesor.

Vidal trabaja como lustrador de zapatos, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 7 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque le gusta realizarlo con esmero y es muy conocido.

Vidal está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva por darle su gran apoyo por segunda vez ya que gracias a ello el podrá apoyar a un familiar que se encuentra grave de salud, ya que podrá llevarla al hospital de otra ciudad y podrá pagar los medicamentos y consultas medicas; con lo cual su familiar podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida y poder seguir luchando para cumplir su sueño:” Ser Profesor”.
texts.en: Vidal lives in the city of Chinca, which is named for the group of the same name that was celebrated for its agricultural advancements and maritime prowess. Today, Chincha has an incredible mixture of cultures, including a high Afro-Peruvian population, due to the remnants of its indigenous past and the influences of the Spanish empire. The city, along with others nearby on the Pacific coast, was damaged by strong earthquakes in 2001 and 2007, but it has endured, as it has for much of its history. As good Peruvians, the people really like their food, and one of the most popular dishes is the delicious Carapulcra, a traditional stew. Because of a lack of resources, Vidal was only able to study through his junior year of high school, but he would have liked to have studied to be a teacher. He works as a shoe-shiner about seven hours a day and can tend up to 30 customers per day. He believes his work is going well because he does it with care and is very well known. Vidal is very thankful for the Kiva lenders for their big support for the second time, because thanks to that he has been able to support a relative who is very ill. He will be able to take her to a hospital in another city and pay for the consultations and medicines, with which his relative will be able to have a better quality of life and he can continue fighting to fulfill his dream of becoming a teacher.

loans.use: pay for medical treatments and medicines.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya is an energetic farmer living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She devotes most of her time working at the rice fields, particularly growing rice to sell for profit. Her spouse is also involved in the same type of business to secure their family financially. They have many years of experience in this project and usually yield a better harvest each season. Ya is now 46 years old and has five children – two married children and three school-aged children. Ya anticipates providing her children with a higher education, so she is pursuing her farming business to promote them.

The truth is, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to purchase a cow for the maintenance of the rice field. Also, with the remaining funds, she will purchase fertilizers for good growth of her crops. She hopes to develop her current business and make it more achieving in years to come.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion, 48, is married, has five children and is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran. 

To make a living, Concepcion iruns a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Concepcion has been in business for 10 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month from her store.

Concepcion is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2008, Concepcion joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Made is 51 years old and lives in Mengwi, Denpasar Bali. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband works as a driver. Though Ni Made often helps her husband in his work, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Ni Made is the head of the Karanjung Lestari 2 group, which is made up of eight neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s first loan with MUK.  With the 3.5M IDR that Ni Made receives, she will purchase one sow for pig breeding. She hopes that the sow will have many piglets, which she will then be able to raise and sell. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to start another business selling fresh fish.

loans.use: to purchase one sow.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is married with one child. She is 25 years old. She is engaged in the hog-raising business. Diana is a hardworking person, and she ensures that she does everything she can to provide for the needs of her family. To this end, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets and feed for her business. She hopes that her hog-raising business will be better than before so she can pay off the loan ahead of time and buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old, is married and has two children. Juanita has owned and operated a transportation service for five years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other tools for maintenance of the farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 
Raquel dreams to be able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she utilized to purchase agricultural supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other tools for the maintenance of her garden. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 
Josefina dreams to expand her store and help her children through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her farm

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
She is a lovely mother blessed with five children; one of them below the age of 15. They make a happy home with her husband. This family of seven is living in a three room apartment house in the Mile 4 neighborhood of Nkwen area in Bamenda, North-West Region of Cameroon. She has faced a lot of challenges in her life such as inadequate capital to start up a business, the poor health situation of family members, and lack of means to provide basic needs for the family. 

She intends to buy a motorbike and also operate a callbox business. This loan will help the community by providing easy and cheap transportation for the population, as bikes are very accessible to neighbourhoods. The callbox will ease communication needs of community members. The business (especially that of the callbox) will succeed because of her location, the demand for mobile phone products and her experience in running the business. The profits will be used to improve her life and that of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase call center accessories and a motorcycle

loans.name: Florence Bih

texts.en:
Florence is happily married and blessed with two children.  The family lives in a three-room house in the Ndamukong neighborhood of Nkwen, Bamenda, North West Region. She has faced many difficulties in her life including the death of her younger sister, lack of adequate financing to carry out her business activities, the death of her father and frequent health problems with her children. Joining the GHAPE program has brought her joy as she now believes in herself and can move forward with her life.

Florence will use her loan to buy feed for sale or retail and to buy secondhand dresses to sell. The loan will allow her to help the community by providing feed on short notice to poultry and pig farmers and low cost clothing to poor community members.  She will use the proceeds from her business to pay her children’s school fees and improve their healthcare. She plans to increase her family’s well-being and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase second hand dresses.

loans.name: Evodia Achick

texts.en:
Evodia Achick is married with six children; the family lives in a four bedroom apartment house at the NITOP 2 quarters of Bamenda North west region of Cameroon. She has faced enormous problems in her life including the death of her mother and sister, her husband not providing for the educational and health needs of their family, insufficient capital to conduct business and poverty within their family. For these reasons, Evodia Achick joined GHAPE and plans to use her loan to purchase wood for fuel, palm oil, rice, beans, sugar, flour, baking powder and other spices.  

Thru her business, Evodia Achick helps the community by providing fast food services for the busy, working urban dwellers. Because of the location of her business, her customers do not need to travel so far for food. She thinks this business will succeed because of its location, the high demand from the growing urban population and her experience in the business. With the business profit this loan will allow for, she will be able to provide for better clothing, health, education and a greater standard of living for her family. She will also be able to improve their housing conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, palm oil and other items.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en:
Pascaline is happily married and the family is blessed with six lovely children, four of them below the age of 15 years. She and the entire family are living in a two-room apartment house. They are living at New Lay Out, Nkwen, Bamenda, Northwest region of Cameroon.

Lots of challenges have been encountered by this lady such as the lack of adequate finances to start up a business and low income within the family, making it difficult to even take care of some basic needs such as education and health bills. Again, she lost her sister who was lending her a helping hand. She also had a motorbike accident and the disappearance of her brother to date. But her situation changed when she joined GHAPE.

She intends to use this loan in preparing her poultry farm, buying feed for the fowls, buying crates of day-old chicks, feeding trays, fowl vaccines, and drinkers (waterers). 

Her loan activity will help the community because it will improve on their nutritional needs, as protein will be on their tables at low and affordable prices. The fowl droppings will be use by women as manure for their farms. 

The venture will be successful because of the high demand for fowl products, that is, chicken and fowl droppings. The profits will be used to cater to her children’s education fees and hospital bills. She also will use the profits to acquire a parcel of land and to plough back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, and vaccines, and to repair her fence.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Rashid. He is married, and has 2 children, aged 8 and 5. In 2001, Rashid established his false hair and jewellery business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-empowered and this is his sole source of income. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 850,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Rashid has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy bracelets, necklaces, diamond earrings and gold plated bracelets. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 580,000. 

In the future, Rashid plans to establish a branch in Bo, to own a house and to buy both a commercial and a private vehicle. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: False hair and jewellery.

loans.name: Sica Delphine

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, Delphine Sica est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont deux sont scolarisés dans une école de la place. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 06 ans et 01 an. Elle a une boulangerie où elle fabrique du pain destiné à la vente depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle large et variée est composée des semi grossistes et des détaillants. En vue de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Delphine Sica envisage de fournir des soins médicaux adéquats pour ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Delphine Sica is 28 years old, married and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom go to a local school. The eldest child and the youngest child are 6 and 1 years old, respectively. She owns a bakery, where she has been making and selling bread for several years, and she gets her supplies at one of Benin's market. Her large and varied clientèle is made up of semi-wholesalers and retailers.

In order to strengthen her business and satisfy her customer demand, Delphine Sica has requested and received a micro loan from Finadev. This loan will enable her to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's school expenses. Delphine Sica plans to provide her children with adequate health care and to meet her own needs.

loans.use: 2 bags of powdered sugar, 1 bag of salt, 3 boxes of yeast and 8 bags of wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies such as sacks of rice, eggs, oils, Bijao leaves, etc.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
Mauricio, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues considera necesaria la inversión de más cerdos en el negocio, su intención es adquirirlos cuando estan pequeños, su compra sera en un aproximado de cinco, ya que es la oportunidad de ampliar la granja, su objetivo es mantenerse siempre trabajando y darle continuidad al negocio.

El defecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, pues ha logrado mejorar sus niveles de venta, generando para su familia una mejor condición económica, ya que ha cubierto todos los gastos más necesarios.
texts.en:
Mauricio is asking for a new loan because he wants to buy more pigs for his business. His aim is to buy them when they are small. He wants to buy around five, as this will give him the opportunity to expand his farm. His goal is to keep working and keep the business going.  

The impact of the last loan was positive as it allowed him to increase his sales,  improving his family's economic situation as he covered all of his essential expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric to make slipcovers.

loans.name: Ep Afya Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chakupewa est enseignante (monitrice) dans une école primaire Afya Bora, qui bénéficie des crédits de l’IMF Hekima. Elle est aussi ménagère. Elle est âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 4 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un soudeur. Son crédit sera affecté dans l’achat de fourniture et matériels scolaires pour ses enfants durant cette rentrée scolaire de septembre notamment  (25 cahiers, stylos, sacs au dos, cartable, boite géométrique, etc.). Le reste d’argent de crédit sera affecte dans le projet d’habitat (30 planches, clous, sables, ciment, etc.). Il sied de signaler que cette cliente  vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans le programme de Hekima. Cette cliente est très ambitieuse dans ses rêves, ainsi, dans le futur, elle ambitionne créer sa propre école moderne privée. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son programme de microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
The customer, Chakupewa, is a teacher (instructor) in the primary school Afya Bora, which benefits from loans from the IMF Hekima. She is also a housewife. She is 30 years old, married and the mother of 4 young children. Her husband is a welder.

Her loan will be used to buy her children school supplies and equipment for the start of the new school year in September; 25 notebook, pens, rucksacks, school bags, math sets, etc. The rest of the money from the loan will be used in her home construction project (to buy 30 planks, nails, sand, cement, etc.).

This customer has already been through 2 loan cycles with Hekima. She has ambitious dreams and therefore, in the future, plans to created her own modern private school. To finish off, she would like to thank Hekima for its micro financing program for teachers.

loans.use: to buy 25 notebook, pens, rucksacks, school bags, math sets, etc.

loans.name: Patricia Lourdes

texts.es: Patricia desde muy joven empezó a ofrecer los servicios de corte y confección por que le gustaba, poco a poco con el pasar los años fue obteniendo más clientes por lo pudo comprar sus maquinas de trabajo. El negocio lo realiza sola sin ningún horario establecido ya que  más que un trabajo es un hobby por lo que se siente satisfecha consigo misma sobre todo porque de esa manera ayuda en la economía de su hogar. Su esposo es taxista y sus hijos se encuentran estudiando en el colegio del barrio. EL crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de una bordadora que necesita para su taller ya que los bordados son más caros si los envía a otro proveedor y con esto también ampliaría sus ventas. Patricia sueña con tener un local grande donde pueda hacer costuras de todo tipo y así brindarle a su familia estabilidad.
texts.en:
Patricia started sewing for a living when she was very young because she enjoyed it.  Little by little, over the years she has attracted more and more customers and has been able to buy sewing machines for work.  She works alone and has no fixed work schedule, since it is more like a hobby for her than work.  She feels very self-satisfied because, more than anything else, she can help out with the home economy.  Her husband is a taxi driver and her children go to the neighborhood school.

The loan she is requesting is to buy an emboidery machine for her workshop because it is more expensive to outsource the embroidery work, and this will help her increase sales.  Patricia dreams of having a large shop where she can make all kinds of products and give her family stability.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Ecole Afya Group

texts.fr: Le client Nahirimba est un enseignant (moniteur) dans une école primaire Afya , qui bénéficie des crédits de l’IMF Hekima. Il est aussi serviteur de Dieu, évangéliste dans une église locale pentecôtiste. Il est âgé de 50 ans, marié et père 10  enfants, parmi les quels il ya de responsables de leurs propres foyers. Son épouse est vendeuse de denrées alimentaire dans un petit marché. Son crédit sera affecté dans le projet d’habitat (achat 50 planches, clous, sables, ciment, etc.). Il sied de signaler que ce client  vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans le programme de Hekima. Ainsi, dans le futur, il ambitionne construire confortablement. Au finish, il remercie Hekima pour son programme de microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
The customer, Nahirimba, is a teacher (instructor) in the Afya primary school, which benefits from loans from the IMF Hekima. He is also a Servant of God, an evangelist in a local Pentecostal church. He is 50 years old, married and the father of 10 children, some of whom are responsible for their own households. His wife sells food products at a small market.

His loan will be used for a home construction project (to buy 50 planks, nails, sand, cement, etc.). This customer has completed 2 loan cycles in the Hekima program. He therefore hopes to be able to construct his home comfortably in future. Finally, he would like to thank Hekima for its micro financing program for teachers.

loans.use: to buy 50 planks, nails, sand, cement, etc.

loans.name: Jessica Guadalupe

texts.es: Jessica es una joven emprendedora que vive en Fortín sector recientemente poblado por lo que solo cuenta con agua y luz, y las casas en su mayoría son de madera, caña o cemento.  Es aquí donde empezó su tienda hace dos años porque le gusta mucho el negocio y poder obtener su propio dinero ya que sus padres no contaban con los recursos necesarios. Como es muy joven y soltera vive con sus padres y ellos le ayudan con la tienda cuando sale a comprar los productos. En su tienda vende productos de necesidad básica como arroz, azúcar, granos, fideos, etc. Espera obtener el crédito ya que piensa comprar productos de confitería para aumentar sus ventas ya que les gustaría arreglar la vivienda de sus padres.
texts.en: Jessica is a young entrepreneur who lives in Fortín, a recently established village that only has running water and electricity.  Most of the houses are made of wood, cane or concrete.  Here she set up a store two years ago and very much enjoys the business and being able to make her own money, since her parents did not have enough resources. Being very young and single, she lives with her parents and they help with the store when she has to go out to buy products.  In her store she sells essential items such as rice, sugar, grains, noodles, etc.  She hopes to receive the loan because she wants to buy confectionery products to increase sales so she can fix up her parent's dwelling.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, grain, noodles.

loans.name: Yénoukounmè Célestine

texts.fr: Âgée de 44 ans, Yénoukounmè Célestine vit au Bénin et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Yénoukounmè Célestine ne vit plus avec son mari et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Yénoukounmè Célestine vit avec ses enfants et assure seule les différents besoins des enfants. Pour pouvoir y arriver, Yénoukounmè Célestine vend des boissons et divers articles (savons, etc) dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Yénoukounmè Célestine vend des fruits et des tomates, activités qu’elle exerce depuis cinq ans et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. La clientèle de Yénoukounmè Célestine devient de plus en plus grandissante. Afin de perfectionner son activité et d’être plus compétitive sur le marché, Yénoukounmè Célestine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Yénoukounmè Célestine s'approvisionne au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Yénoukounmè Célestine sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Yenoukounme Celestine is 44 years old, she lives in Benin and stopped attending school at secondary level. Yenoukounme Celestine no longer lives with her husband and she has two dependent children who attend school. Yenoukounme Celestine lives with her children and assumes their various needs alone. In order to manage this, Yenoukounme Celestine sells drinks and various articles (soap, etc.) at a market in Benin. Parallel to this activity, Yenoukounme Celestine sells fruit and tomatoes, this is a business that she has been doing for five years and brings in a size-able income. Yenoukounme Celestine's clientele is growing. In order to improve her business and become more competitive, she wishes to increase her stock. Yenoukounme Celestine buys her products in Togo. Seeking to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and her income, Yenoukounme Celestine requests a second loan from ALIDé. She repaid the previous loan correctly.

loans.use: To buy drinks and various articles (tomatoes, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Norbert

texts.fr: Norbert est un jeune de 38 ans fiancé père d'un enfant de 2 ans. Il a aussi 3 autres personnes à sa charge. Il a ouvert une alimentation pres de son domicile dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gere depuis 3 ans deja. Son petit commerce fonctionne grace à son acceuiel chaleureux, à sa longue experience dans ce domaine et la clientele qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Sa clientèle devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Il sollicite ce credit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce en  achetant en gros  sa marchandise (sacs de riz, sac de sel, palettes d'eau minerale,cartons de sucres, des friandise,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Norbertis a young man, 38 years old, who is engaged to be married. He is a father with two children and also has three other persons to support. He opened a grocery store near his home in a district in the capital. He has been running it for three years already. His small business is going well, thanks to his warm welcomes, long experience in this domain, and a customer base he acquired over time. His customers are becoming numerous, so he can no longer satisfy them due to his meager capital, which compels him to buy retail. 

He is requesting this loan to bolster his small business fund in order to buy wholesale (rice, salt, mineral water, boxes of sugar, sweets,…) and to increase is profit margin.

He will reinvest part of his profits into his business to meet the needs of his sector. The other part will enable him to meet his day-to-day needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities in bulk (boxes of sugar, soap, pasta; sacks of rice, salt...)

loans.name: Victoria  Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es una mujer incansable en transmitir el pan de la enseñanza ya que como vocación la trae en la sangre, Actualmente se  desempeña como maestra de secundaria en el Instituto Rubén Darío de la misma localidad, atendiendo 1 turnos diurno y impartiendo clases los fines de semana en la localidad donde vive, además su esposo es maestro de secundaria , su núcleo familiar se compone por 2 persona ella, su esposo y  1hijo, el que estudia en el  colegio de la misma localidad, Actualmente sigue estudiando la carrera universitaria de la especialidad de Matemáticas y Computación el que lleva su primer año, debido a eso tomo la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para ayudarse a los costos ya que de su salario familiar no le da para cubrir los gastos familiares y los estudios para la superación  profesional. Ya que el crédito lo utilizaría para el pago de aranceles universitarios en las carreras de matemáticas y computación

  .
texts.en:
Victoria is a tireless woman who transmits the importance of education because she has the vocation in her blood.  Currently, she is a teacher at a secondary institute called Rubén Darío in the city where she lives.  She has a day shift and also teaches on the weekends.  Her husband is a secondary teacher.  Her family is comprised of her, her husband and a son who studies at the local school.

She is currently in her first year of university studies of Math and Computers, and decided to visit Ceprodel to request a loan to help pay for education costs, since the family income does not cover household expenses and university studies.  She will use the loan to pay for college tuition and expenses for her math and computer degree.
  .

loans.use: To pay tuition and expenses related to a Math and Computer university degree.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan a 31 ans, elle possède depuis 6 ans une boutique d'alimentation générale à Lomé. Elle engage aujourd'hui son premier prêt chez WAGES. Elle désire augmenter son stock en alimentation générale afin d'intensifier son activité. Elle compte réinvestir ses profits futurs dans son activité pour la faire davantage évoluer. Elle aimerait pouvoir ouvrir une nouvelle boutique et surtout avoir une condition qui lui permettra de se marier et d'avoir des enfants.
texts.en: Massan, age 31, has been running a general food shop in Lomé for the past six years. She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to increase her stock of merchandise and bolster her activity. She plans to reinvest her profits in the continuous development of her business. She would like to open another store, and she would especially like to marry and start a family.

loans.use: to buy general food products for her store.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de pupusas, comprandose el gas, el maíz, condimentos, harina, aceite, entre otros materiales para tener un mejor inventario para realizar las ventas cada día.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo de la inversión, ya que su negocio ha sido más productivo y ha tenido más capacidad para atender a los clientes, en su familia todo está bien considera que sus condiciones están siendo más estables a través del crecimiento del negocio y la perseverancia con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sonia is asking for a new loan to be able to invest in buying materials to make pupusas. She will natural gas, corn, condiments, flour, oil and more to have a better inventory to do her sales every day.

With the previous loan, she was able to have a positive effect with the investment. Her business has been more productive and has had a greater capacity to serve more customers. In her family, every thing is fine, considering that their conditions are more stable through the growth of the business and perserverance with the loans.

loans.use: to buy natural gas, corn, condiments, flour and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a thermal protection device and bands for a mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old, residing at Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  Erlinda is married and has two children.  To earn a living, Erlinda owns and operates a general store.  She has been in this business for 7 years, and from it she earns PHP 4,800 a month.

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.  In 2011, Erlinda joined GDMPC.  In the future, Erlinda wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is from the village of Alinam.  She is twenty-seven years old, married, and has one child.  Marie Rose owns and operates a direct selling business, which sells clothing and shoe products in the local community.  Marie Rose has been engaged in her business for over three years. 

As of now, Marie Rose is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items such as shoes, lotion and clothing to expand her product offering.  She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as shoes, lotion and clothing to expand her product offering

loans.name: Ianrocel

texts.en:
Ianrocel, 34 years old, is a single entrepreneur of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, and is earning income from his business of buying and selling rice. It has been almost three years now and he earns 20,000 a month. 

To improve business, he wants to borrow the amount of 30,000 from GDMPC microcredit, which he just joined recently to obtain more sacks of rice to sell. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia has been operating her retail store for three years, and she is glad because her business is improving and growing. She is able to earn about PHP 300 a day and uses her profit to pay for her family's electric bills and daily needs. 

Leticia is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to allow her to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads, and other items for her retail shop business. She hopes to obtain this loan so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries, such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, eggs, cooking oil, baked breads, and other items for her retail shop business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia. She previously accessed a loan of 12,000 PHP that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on displayed and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lucia fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.*

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay, a 48-year-old married woman and mother of five children, two of whom are already married, lives in the Baray district with her family and works as a local farmer there. She, together with her spouse, grows rice and red corn on their existing farmland to yield income for the family. Lay has been in this business for over 10 years and normally she can earn in the vicinity of 30,000 KHR per day.

To start growing red corn for the upcoming season, Lay needs additional capital for the purchase of farm supplies. She is therefore requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to pay for seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide spraying. Recognized as an honest and VIP client, Lay has received five previous loans from HKL. She hopes that this investment will help in developing her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide spraying.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en: Robinson is 38 years old, married, and has two children. He operates a photography studio in a conducive environment with reliable customers. He has been in the business for two years. Previously, he was employed. He dreams of having a successful business in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy photography papers and photo frames.

loans.use: To buy photography papers and photo frames

loans.name: Hellen Achola

texts.en:
Hellen is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of five and 13. All of them go to school.

Hellen runs a hotel, and has been in business for six years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. She is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase meat, rice, and many other things. In addition to this business, Hellen has no other source of income.

In five years Hellen would like to expand her business and open other branches. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Hellen says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like meat, sugar, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replenish stock  as well as buy additional equipment for use in the business, for example more cutlery,

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a farmer in his Murang’a rural home in Central Kenya. He lives with his family of three children, two of whom are still in school. He has 21 years in active farming and currently sells his produce which includes maize, tea, coffee and beans to the local market. He runs a cereals retail business besides farming.

Richard has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water pump and a water tank both at 30,000 KES each. He says this will help in irrigating his farm and generate more income specifically from banana farming. He plans to boost his horticultural farming and educate his last two children as well.

Richards says lack of capital and undeveloped local markets are the main challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 35 years old, married, and blessed with five children. He runs a general goods retail shop business in Eldama Ravine town and this has been his source of income for the last five years where he gets an average monthly profit of KES. 8,000. 

He has borrowed a second loan of KES. 40,000 after successfully paying the previous  loan. He intends to use the loan to purchase more items for resale in his general store. These items include bar soaps, washing powder, faces towels among other items he will also  be using part of the loan  for transportation of the goods from the wholesale shops to his store. 

He anticipates to get profits which he will use to expand his business as well as save some amount for the future. Benson hopes to improve his living standards as well as expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the retail shop

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 67 years old and married to Susan. They are blessed with three children. He has been earning a living from buying and selling second hand furniture, with a monthly income of 13,800 KES.

He has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET  LTD which he plans to use to purchase more stock of tables and chairs. With the anticipated profit he plans to open another branch. His future hopes are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of second hand tables, cupboards, and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy maize flour, sugar, cereals and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen  is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a bicycle where he  provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a viable business area  and his primary customers are local residents who require transport. He describes his biggest business challenge to be impassible roads especially during the rainy season. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bicycle spare parts. His business goal is to diversify his business into taxi transportation services  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha lives in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is engaged. She owns a boutique which she has been operating for ten years now. She started the business through her own small savings.

Furaha learned about Milango through friends.  She has the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of her business. The challenges she is facing are taxes, customers not paying on time and seasonal weather.

Furaha is applying for a loan of 43,200 Kenyan shillings to buy dresses and skirts for the boutique. Her extra income from the loan will be added to savings to pay school fees for her children. Her future plans are to expand the business and start a transport business.

loans.use: Buy dresses and skirts to resell

loans.name: Rabecca

texts.en:
Rabecca lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married. She owns a clothing shop that she has been operating for five years. She learned about Milango through friends and has the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is lack of funds.

Rabecca is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothes for her business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the business operation and expand it. She hopes to expand to the wholesale level.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim received considerable income after the repair of his three-wheeler vehicle. He has also earned some income from the battery charging shop. 

He wants to grow his business by applying for a 73,100 KES loan to add a stock of retail material to his shop, such as mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy stock of retail material, such as mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal

loans.name: Jesus Gerardo

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se puede apreciar atractivos turísticos como la laguna de “Huacachina, la cual se ubica en medio de maravillosas dunas, en las cuales se practican deportes de aventura como el samboarding, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial se cultiva la uva, esparrago, pallares, frejoles, entre otros. Jesus es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque con el fruto de su trabajo puedo solventar los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo poder sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 6 años, sobre todo con el cariño y comprensión de su esposa; el trabaja como empleado en una zapatería de la ciudad donde vive; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque es muy amable y pacientes con los clientes y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Jesus está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda el podrá realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda como tarrajeo de paredes, colocar puertas y ventanas a su vivienda, de esta manera el podrá ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y seguir trabajando muy duro para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda y darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Jesús is 41 years old. He lives in Ica which is a city characterized by its warm and pleasant climate. Because of this, one can appreciate the attractive sights such as the lagoon “Huacachina” which is situated between beautiful dunes. In these dunes one can also practice adventure sports such as sand boarding. Apart from that, agriculture is also developing, especially the cultivation of grapes, asparagus, Lima and kidney beans amongst others.    

Jesús is a very hard-working man. This is above all because with his work’s earnings he can cover the household expenses. And most of all to allow his small son of six years to get ahead, especially with the love and understanding of his wife. 

He works in a shoe shop in the city where he lives. He thinks he is doing well in his job because he is responsible and most of all because he is very kind and patient with his customers. He really wants to move forward. 

Jesús is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva because thanks to their great help he will be able to carry out some home improvements such as plastering the walls and putting in doors and windows. This way, he will be able to offer a better quality of life to his family and continue to work very hard such that one day he can make his biggest dream come true: “finish building his home and provide a good education to his son.”

loans.use: to improve his house (plastering of walls, putting in doors and windows).

loans.name: Moffat

texts.en:
Moffat lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. For the past 2 years, Moffat has owned and operated a retail shop for selling coconuts, a business she started through her personal savings. She also sells goats, mats and brooms.

Moffat learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Moffat's main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. 

Moffat is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy mats, coconuts, brooms and a machine for grinding the coconuts. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay off the loan. Moffat's future plan is to expand and have a container where she will sell at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy mats, coconuts, brooms and a machine for grinding the coconuts.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in the Kongowea area of the Coast province, Kenya. He is single. He owns a retail shop, a business he has been operating for eight years. Apart from this, he owns a rental house from where he gets his salary.
Moses learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges he is facing are price fluctuation, inflation and market seasonality.
Moses is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to add stock of retail items like cups, plates, flasks, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his family's standard of living. His plan for the future is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock of items like cups, plates, flasks, etc.

loans.name: Dzendere

texts.en: Dzendere is grateful to both Yehu and Kiva for their support. With the last loan, she was able to improve her living standards. She is taking out another loan of Ksh 80,000 to start a new business. Her goal is to own several businesses. She intends to use the loan to purchase a motorcycle. This will make her able to increase her income.The anticipated profits from the taxi business will be used to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mungu Tubariki Group

texts.en:
Sakina, who is in her late 30s, is married and has three children who go to school. She has had a hotel business for four years. She works  from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sakina's 17th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy liters of cooking oil, chairs and a sack of rice and to pay school fees and household expenses. Sakina has repaid all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her business stock (a sack of rice, cooking oil, maize flour and some kilos of sugar). Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Sakina will share this loan with her group “Mungu Tubariki” which consists of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Magu Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her late 30s, is single and has one child who attends school. She has had a beauty salon business for six years. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Josephine's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to add more salon equipment and to pay school fees and household expenses. She has repaid all her loans successfully. Josephine wants a loan to buy some missing salon equipment and to pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to open a designing business.

Josephine will share this loan with her group “Magu” which consists of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Boresha Group

texts.en:
Ally is in his late 40s and is married with two children who are going to school. He has been running a kiosk selling juice, sodas, water, and fruits.  He is really hardworking.  He works from 6 a.m. to midnight, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Ally's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start building his kiosk room, bought a freezer and has paid back the loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to finish building his kiosk room and restock the missing items in his kiosk. Ally's dream is to one day be able to open another big kiosk in a different area.

Ally will share this loan with his loan group "Boresha" which totals 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to finish building his kiosk  room.

loans.name: Milton Jaime

texts.es: Milton empezó su venta de pollos hace 9 años, primero vendía de poquito ya que no tenía mucho conocimiento de la crianza de estos animalitos, y para reducir sus pérdidas por alguna enfermedad. Al poco tiempo se dio cuenta que mejoraban sus ingresos por lo que se arriesgo aprendiendo un poco de alimentación y cuidado, luego compro una cantidad más grande para aumentar la producción, ahora tiene en su domicilio un lugar acondicionado para la crianza. La venta la realiza solo recorriendo diversos sectores de la ciudad principalmente por el Guasmo ya que por ahí vive y lo conoce lo que reduce el riesgo de asaltos con lo que perdería su mercadería. Está felizmente unido y su esposa es ama de casa. Con el préstamo que está solicitando comprara pollo para la crianza, balanceado y material para adecuaciones. Espera a futuro poder abrir una distribuidora de pollos grande al por mayor.
texts.en:
Milton began his chicken-selling business nine years ago. At first business was slow as he didn't know much about raising chickens and how to reduce losses from disease. After a short time he realized his income was getting better so he decided to learn more about feeding and caring for the poultry. Then he bought more chickens to increase production. 

He sells the chickens in various parts of the town, but mainly in El Guasmo as that's where he lives. He knows the area well so he can reduce the risk of attacks from which he might lose his chickens. 

He is happily married and his wife looks after the home. With the loan Milton plans to buy more chickens, quality feed, and material for repairs. In the future he hopes to open a large warehouse and sell chickens wholesale.

loans.use: Buy chickens, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Joel Ruben

texts.es:
Joel es un hombre de25 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación;  con mucho empeño culmino sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres no puedo estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas que tanto deseaba, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de sus padres, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo Joel trabaja como Obrero en una empresa de su ciudad, él se desempeña realizando funciones de control de calidad y labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Joel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder tarrajear, pintar y poner piso a su casa; de esta manera Joel contará con un ambiente adecuado y seguro donde pueda desarrollarse adecuadamente, así el seguirá esforzándose y trabajando para que junto con su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Joel is 24 years old, single and lives in the city of Pisco. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic man who has a very strong desire to improve. With a lot of determination he completed his secondary studies. Because he had to work to support his parents, unfortunately, he could not study what he wanted most: business studies. But he still dreams of doing that someday. 

In his free time he likes to do sports and on some occasions he cooks a delicious Arroz con Pato (rice with duck) to share with his family. 

Thanks to the support of his parents, his great determination and his enthusiasm, Joel is now a worker in a company in his city. He carries out quality control checks and works around 10 hours a day. He thinks he is doing well because of his good performance and the kind way he treats his fellows. 

Joel is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they are offering he can carry out some home improvements. He wishes to plaster, paint and put in a floor in his house. This way Joel will have an adequate and safe surrounding where he can develop himself adequately. Like that, he will continue to strain himself and to work such that he can move ahead together with his family.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to his home.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda, age 46, is married with five children. She resides in Tukuran. 

Brenda operates a fishing business to earn a living. She's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

This year, Brenda joined GDMPC. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a widow with six children. She is 47 years old and lives in Tukuran. 

Elsa operates a fishing business to earn a living. She's been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 9,950 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Recently, Brenda joined GDMPC. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Olivia

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de meriendas como tamales, enchiladas, empanadas, vive con sus familiares y sus padres, solamente su hija depende económicamente de sus ingresos, el negocio de Ana lo aprendió por su madre y trabajan de manera ambulante, no tiene un horario establecido para salir a las ventas y cuenta con una experiencia en el negocio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para realizar la venta, por ejemplo elotes, maíz, yuca, plátanos, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para continuar realizando sus ventas.

Su objetivo es a futuro poder con su esfuerzo en el negocio generar las utilidades para poder comprar su propia casa y mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana sells snacks such as tamales, enchiladas, and empanadas. She lives with her parents and other family members. She has a daughter whom she supports financially.

Ana learned her business from her mother and they sell their wares in the streets of the town. She doesn't have a fixed work schedule and now has experience in this line of work.

She is seeking a loan to buy ingredients such as corn, maize, yucca, and plantain bananas, all of which are needed for her business. Ana's goal for the future is to work hard so she can generate enough profit to buy her own house and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn, maize, yucca, and plantain bananas

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing-sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing-sales business.

NWTF is re-listing Almira's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child who attends school. He is a money lender, a business he has been operating for two years. Apart from this, he is employed and earns a salary from his job. 

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The challenge he is facing is customers not paying on time, hence bringing about bad debts.

Alpha is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to increase float (electronic credits that serve as virtual currency in the mobile money industry). The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family and educate his child. 

His plan for the future is to open another money lending shop.

loans.use: To increase float (electronic monetary credits).

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod is an industrious person who is married and has three children. He lives in a big house that is perfect for animal husbandry. This is why he has been busy with animal husbandry for more than three years. Little by little, with the passing of time, each year he has developed his business. 

Thanks to the animals' good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers. 

Dilshod earns additional income from taxi driving. His children have become older and want a better quality of life. His wife helps him with the business. She is a seamstress who sews very wonderful dresses. They want to develop the business and from the profits buy all the things they need. However, their income is not enough for this. 

Dilshod is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store. Imelda is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Esta Group

texts.fr: La cliente Faida est conseillère du groupe d’affaire Esta, entrepreneur de talent, âgée de 34 ans, divorcée et mère de 5 jeunes enfants. La cliente est vendeuses de produits de maquillage de dames et sociétaire d'un salon de coiffure. Elle expose ses articles dans un salon de coiffure. En plus de cette activité, elle tresse et coiffer également les dames. Elle commença cette activité avec le crédit de Hekima. De ce fait, elle vient de réaliser 4 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit. Le défi majeur de son activité est la petitesse de son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  20 pièces de mèches. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et soutenir la scolarité de ses enfants. Ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour songer aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Faida, is the advisor of the business group Esta. She is a talented entrepreneur, 34 years old, divorced, and the mother of five young children. She is a vendor of makeup for women and is an associate of a hair salon. She displays her products in a hair salon. In addition to this business, she makes braids and also styles hair for women. She started this business with a Hekima loan. In that regard, she just completed four cycles in this micro-loan program. 

The major challenge of her business is low capital. This new loan must serve to supply her with 20 hair extensions. In the future, she wishes to buy a plot of land and cover her children's school fees. So she thanks Hekima for thinking about small entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy 20 hair extensions for resale

loans.name: Nagnimatou

texts.fr: Nagnimatou, âgée 32 ans, est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés dans une école de la ville. Spécialisée dans la vente des boîtes de conserve, des savons, des biscuites et des produits alimentaires depuis quelques années. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de combler les attentes de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de contribuer à l'éducation de ses clients. Nagnimatou souhaiterait aider son mari à construire des chambres à louer dans leur maison afin de pouvoir mieux supporter les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Nagnimatou, aged 32, is married and the mother of four children, who are attending a school in the city. Specialized in selling canned foods, soaps, cookies, and other grocery items for a few years, she stocks up from one of the markets in Benin.

Concerned about bolstering her sales and fulfilling the expectations of her customers, she requested and obtained financing from Finadev with the aim of growing her extra revenues and helping with her children's education. Nagnimatou would like to help her husband to build rooms to rent out in their house, so as to support her family.

loans.use: to buy 8 boxes of milk, 6 boxes of sugar, and 15 boxes of macaroni

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mamy est conseillère du groupe d’affaire Esther rénové. Entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de  30 ans, mariée et mère de 5 jeunes enfants. Son mari est travailleur d’une entreprise de gardiennage. La cliente est vendeuse des articles divers. Elle commença cette activité avec son fonds propre. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit de Hekima. Le défi majeur pour cette cliente, est qu’elle a été dernièrement victime d’un incendie de sa maison, ce qui a négativement influencé ses affaires. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  25 kg de farines de manioc, de maïs, épices, etc.  Dans l’avenir, elle projette améliorer sa maison, encours de construction et agrandir son activité. Ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour songer aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Mamy, is the advisor of the renewed business group Esther. She is an energetic entrepreneur, 30 years old, married, and the mother of five young children. Her husband is a worker at a security company. Mamy is a vendor of a variety of goods. She started this business with her own funds. Later on, she benefited from a Hekima loan. 

The major challenge for this client is that she was recently a victim of a fire in her house. This negatively impacted her business. This new loan must serve to supply her with 25 kg of cassava flour, corn, spices, etc. In the future, she plans to improve her house now being built and to expand her business. So she thanks Hekima for thinking about small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 25 kg of cassava flour, corn, spices, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. 

NWTF is relisting Josefina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

NWTF is re-listing Juditha's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. He runs a transport business to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for ten years. Besides that, he does farming to supplement his income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business.  He dreams of expanding his business and buying a truck in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe is 53 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. He does poultry farming to earn a living. He has engaged in this business since the year 2000. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management.
