He dreams of expanding his business and becoming an established poultry farmer in the future. He needs a loan of 10,000 KES to buy more chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is 24 years old. He is not married yet and has no children. He is very hardworking and clever and tries to find new ways for income and profit to provide his parents with high quality living conditions.  It’s for this reason that 4 years ago he began his own business with driving. Thanks to the good service, he has managed to gain many customers.  

The faster developing of modern life makes Naimjon to be more progressive, and that’s why he wants to buy a new car to attract more clients. In this way he can develop his business further, but nowadays his income is not enough for buying a car, so he is asking for a loan to buy a new car. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a new car.

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: Agée de 24 ans, Blandine vit sous le toit de son mari et mère d'un enfant âgé de 08 ans et scolarisé. Elle fabrique du savon à base de la soude depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'augmenter son pouvoir d'achat et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, Blandine a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev en vue de renforcer son activité et d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire. Ce surplus lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Elle envisage changer la toiture de ses parents avant la prochaine saison pluvieuse.
texts.en:
Blandine, aged 24, lives with her husband and is the mother of an 8-year-old child, who is in school. Blandine has been producing soap made from soda for a few years and gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Concerned about increasing her purchasing power and responding favorably to customer demands, Blandine requested and obtained financial support from Finadev with the aim of bolstering her business and growing her extra income. This surplus will enable her to help cover her children's schooling costs and to support herself. She envisions replacing her parents' roof ahead of the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy a barrel of soda to make soap

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a hardworking 30-year-old married business lady. She sells rice to make a living. She has been operating this business for two years. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to add to her stock of rice. She has also learned how to manage her business since she has been trained in business management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy rice for resale.

loans.use: To buy rice.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is 42 years old and married with 1 child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of grocery items for resale. She has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Lilibeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Yahaira Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Yahaira es una mujer dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, actualmente labora en el ministerio de educación de la localidad, desde hace 5 años, es casada con 1 hijo el que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones básicas para su desarrollo, actualmente se desempeña en el área  como responsable de Estadísticas.  
Una de las necesidades que la señora  Yahaira  atraviesa hoy en día es de Tramitar su Titulo como Licenciada  de Maestra de  Educación Primaria, producto del gran esfuerzo realizado para alcanzar tan deseado sueño, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar la tramitación de su titulo el que le beneficiara aun mas en su centro laboral, por el nivel académico que presentaría, lo que de paso le vendría mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Yahaira is a woman dedicated to her work and her family. For five years now she has been working in the ministry of education in her town. She is married with one child for whom she has to provide the basic development conditions. She is currently working as responsible in the area of statistics. 

One of the difficulties Yahaira is presently going through are the necessary bureaucratic steps and paperwork to have her degree in primary education officially certified. The realization of her big dream is the result of a lot of effort she put into it. Because of the need mentioned, she decided to visit CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to carry out the official certification of her degree. This will help her even more in her work place because of the academic level it represents. In turn, her living conditions will also improve.

loans.use: to pay for her degree in primary education to be officially certified.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 68 years old and has three children. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 14 years and has employed one person. Besides that, she does farming and owns rental houses. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business and opening another outlet in a different location in the future. She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy maize, beans, green grams, rice and sugar for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, green grams, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia conformada con su esposa y cuatro hijos, solamente él trabaja en el hogar, se dedica a la venta de panes con pollo, éste lo aprendido por unos amigos con quienes trabajaba anteriormente, hoy día tienen negocio propio, sin un horario establecido para atender a sus clientes.

Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de los panes como lo es embutidos, pollo, vegetales, carne, pan,  aceite, que son necesarios para que pueda continuar en la produccion de la venta, este crédito le permitirá surtir el inventario.

El objetivo de Jose es crecer en el negocio, tener otras zonas de acceso donde pueda incrementar sus clientes, ya que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his family, made up of his wife and four children. He is the only one in the home that works. He works selling bread rolls with chicken. He learned this from some friends that he worked with previously. Today they have their own business, without established hours of operation to tend to customers.

He is applying for a loan to invest it in ingredients for making the breads, like sausages, chicken, vegetables, meat, bread, and oil, which are necessary to be able to continue production of the product. This credit will allow him to stock his inventory.

Jose's goal is to grow his business and have other access areas where he can increase his customer base, since that will allow him to increase his income and live better with his family.

loans.use: to buy sausage, chicken, vegetables, meat, bread, and oil.

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es: Dilma tiene 29 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Dios Proveerá, es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es albañil. Es una familia unida y trabajadora, ellos residen en la comunidad de San Nicolás, de la cuidad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Dilma se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, lo inicio desde hace 16 años y el oficio lo aprendió de su mama ya que ella se dedicaba al mismo rubro, el negocio lo tiene en su casa, lo abre desde las 7:00 am y lo cierra a las 6:00 pm, la ventaja que tiene es que cuenta con numerosa clientela y no tiene mucha competencia. Dilma solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de dos fardos de ropa usada que el ayudaran para poder surtir su negocio de prendas y estilos diferentes que estén a la moda y así poder llamar la atención de sus clientes. El único problema que enfrenta es cuando no tiene dinero comprar fardos de ropa y poder surtir su negocio, se ve en muchas dificultades por lo tanto ella busca el apoyo de FAMA para hacer crecer su negocio. Dilma ha sido cliente de FAMA durante 15 ciclos y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Dilma is 29 years old, and is a member of the solidarity group, "Dios Proveerá" (God will provide). She is married, has three children, and her husband is a mason. They are a very tight knit, hardworking family, and they live in the community of San Nicolás, which is in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho. Dilma makes a living selling used clothing, and began running her small business 16 years ago. She learned the trade from her mother, and presently runs her business out of her home, beginning at 7:00 every morning and working until 6:00 every evening. The advantage of her business is that she has a large customer base and not much competition in her area.

Dilma is requesting this loan in order to purchase packages of used clothing to further stock her business. She hopes, with this investment, to offer a wider range of styles and options to her customers. The only problem she faces is that she does not have enough money to buy the packages of clothing on her own, and she has therefore sought support from FAMA to grow her business. Dilma has been a client of FAMA for 15 business cycles, and has a great history of prompt loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase packages of used clothing.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 26 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for one year. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. He has also learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and buying a motorcycle in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy maize flour, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Mical

texts.en: Mical is 38 years old, married, and has six children who are in school. She does tailoring for a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Through Faulu Kenya, she has become financially knowledgeable through the trainings she attended. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 38 years old, married, and has five children who are in school. He does farming to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for ten years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved on his savings skills because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming an established farmer in the future. He has requested a loan of 10,000 KES to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is taking out a loan to invest in her spare parts selling business. She narrates that the last loan enabled her to increase her monthly income through the sale of clothes, and that has made her able to own another business. Asia dreams of expanding her business and opening new businesses even as she offers a quality life for her children. She is taking out this loan to purchase spare parts for her second business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her second business.

loans.name: Hennie

texts.en: Hennie is a 53-year-old resident of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. For 10 years as an aid to the income gained from her husband, Hennie has provided her child's needs from the little amount of 10,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business. She's been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP at GDMPC micro finance to buy feeding supplies. Hennie wants to make expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en: Ma. Liza is 47 years old. She is married to Rodante. Her goal is to improve her hog-raising business to support her family. She has been in this business for almost 7 years earning profits of 7,000 PHP per month that she uses for their basic necessities. Despite the hardships and difficulties of life, she has the strong determination to uplift their status of living and give her family a better life. Right now, she is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business. She believes that this loan will contribute a lot to make the business grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is a widow and has 12 children. Pacita is 57 years old, residing at Mansabay, Bajo,Lopez Jaena. Pacita owns and operates a general store. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Pacita joined GDMPC. In the future, Pacita wants to build a house and to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Lorna is a very active member of Yehu who has shown great interest to progress in life. She took out a loan which enabled her to improve her living standards and her monthly income. Demand for more varieties of fresh produce has increased so she is taking out another loan in the amount of KSH 40,000 to invest in her current business so as to increase her sales and fulfill her customer demands. With the requested loan, she intends to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, and other fruits and vegetables for sale. This will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, and other fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Inderetsi Group

texts.fr:
Damien fait partie du groupe Indereretsi  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 42 ans et est marié  à Acquline, une enseignante. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants. L’un a 7ans et l’autre 9ans. Ils étudient tous.
Il prend soin d’un neveu qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de  la bière et de  viande (chèvres) dans son bistrot depuis 3ans. 
Il est à son premier crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres pour la vente de  viande, afin de gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter sa propre parcelle pour construire  sa propre maison. Il voudrait en outre voir ses enfants étudier et terminer les études.
texts.en:
Damien is part of the group Indereretsi and lives in Bujumbura. He is 42 years old and married to Acquline, a teacher. Together they have two children, 7 and 9 years old. They are both students. He takes care of a nephew, who is a student.

Damien has had a business selling beer and meat (goat) in his bistro for three years. 

He is on his first loan at Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and buy many goats to sell meat, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy his own plot of land to build his own house. Aside from this, he would like to see his children go to school and complete their education.

loans.use: to buy many goats to sell meat in his bistro

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon is 29 years old and a hardworking man with a great desire to progress in life. He and his wife have two small children and try to do the best for them. They live in a house he built due to his great dedication.
He is one of the more successful businessmen of his town. For more than four years, he has been busy producing and selling grids (fencing). He makes grids from metal. He knows all aspects of his business very well. His experiences and skills help him to develop his business and in this way improve his living condition. Naimjon wants to develop his business further but his income is limited and he needs your help.
He is asking for a loan of 3000 USD to buy metal for producing more grids. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy metal for producing grids.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 47 years old, married and has four children. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for 32 years. He also runs a motorcycle transport business. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He dreams of expanding his business and buying a pickup truck in the future for easy transportation of goods. Charles has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy 10 bags of green grams and two bags of maize.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of green grams and two bags of maize.

loans.name: Bassinadou Group

texts.fr: Responsable du groupement constitué de femmes et d’hommes tous lancés dans l’agriculture en RÉGION CENTRALE, madame Naka est mère de 06 enfants. L’ainé est âgé de 33ans et le dernier 10ans. Elle est veuve et âgée de 50ans. Pour permettre à ses enfants de grandir dans de bonnes conditions, elle cultive la terre. Aidée par 01 personne, madame Naka sollicite un second crédit dans notre institution pour acheter des intrants agricoles. Il y a de cela 17ans qu’elle est dans cette activité et espère qu’avec le profit tiré construire une maison, transformer son champ en une ferme agricole.
texts.en:
The official of a group composed of men and women who all work in agriculture in RÉGION CENTRALE, Ms. Naka is the mother of six children. The oldest child is 33 years old, and the last is 10. She is a 50-year-old widow. To enable her children to grow up under good conditions, she farms the land. 

Helped by one person, Ms. Naka is requesting a second loan from our institution to buy farm inputs. She has been doing this work for seventeen years and hopes to build a house with the profits earned and to transform her field into a large farm.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Nancy

texts.fr:
La dame Nancy fait du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est sociétaire du guichet qui se situe à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Elle est à son 4ème crédit à l’IMCEC  et veut un renouvellement de 150000 F CFA pour pouvoir acheter des draps de lit, des robes pour enfants des parfums pour revendre durant la période des fêtes.
Nancy participe à la dépense quotidienne de la maison.
Avec une augmentation de revenus, elle souhaite appuyer sa fille dans sa scolarité.
texts.en:
The lady, whose name is Nancy, has had a trading activity for more than ten years. She is married and a mother. She is a shareholder/member of the branch, which lies around 22km from the main town. She is on her fourth loan from IMCEC and would like a renewal of 150,000FCFA to be able to buy bed linen, children's dresses and perfumes to resell during the festival period. 

Nancy contributes to the household's daily expenditure. She would like to help out with her daughter's education with an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy bed linen, children's dresses and perfume for resale.

loans.name: Soucoupapaye Group

texts.fr:
Soucoupapaye est créé le 11 Mai 2001. Les membres fondatrices sont solidaires et entretiennent des relations de bon voisinage.
Mme Fatou est l'emprunteur vedette et sur la photo, elle est debout à droite avec la main levée. C'est une femme veuve âgée de 58 ans et mère de 06 enfants (04 filles et 02 garçons) âgés entre 20 et 09 ans.
Avec ce prêt elle va renforcer sa boutique qui est gérée par son fils. Les bénéfices serviront à une meilleur prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Soucoupapaye was created on May 11, 2001. The founding members are together in solidarity and maintain good neighborly relations. 

Ms. Fatou is the featured borrower. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right with her hand raised. She is a widow, 58 years old, and the mother of six children (four girls and two boys), from 9 to 20 years old. With this loan, she is going to provide a boost to her store, which is managed by her son. The profits will be used to take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy various goods for her store

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung is 50 years old, married and has four children, three of whom have jobs. She lives in Baray District with her family. Ung doesn’t want to rely only on her husband’s and children’s income. She is confident that she also is able to generate income to help improve her family’s living conditions. Recently she has been involved in selling papaya salad in a public gathering area of her community, earning approximately 40,000 KHR each day. Her husband manages a fishing-raising business in their village. Due to the lack of capital, Ung’s spouse cannot maintain his fish-raising business. For that reason, Ung would like to take out a loan in the sum of 2,000,000 KHR to purchase 5,000 small fish to raise and 50 kg of feed to fatten them. She hopes to enhance her family-owned businesses as well as her family's living status.

loans.use: to purchase 5000 heads of small fish for raising and 50 kg of feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. For eight years, he has earned income by providing transportation services to support the needs of his three children. He earns 15,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 31-year old father, there’s nothing that can make him happier than to see his children successful in their studies. Roland wants to borrow 35,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children with a better education. He is new to GDMPC. His plan in the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in his business.

loans.name: Quintin

texts.es:
Quintin es un hombre de49 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, tiene un hijo quien ya es mayor de edad y siempre ha sido su razón principal para esforzarse y salir adelante, él es una persona amable, trabajador y entusiasta; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para apoyar a sus padres no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta realizar pequeños viajes con su hijo y en algunas de estas ocasiones aprovechan la oportunidad para comer un delicioso Chupe de Camarones.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Quintin trabaja en su pequeño negocio de elaboración de puertas y ventanas metálicas, desde tempranas horas de la mañana él inicia su labor, dedicando un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, él cree que le va bien por la dedicación que pone en sus trabajos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Quintin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales, tales como: pintura, metales, barniz, entre otros; de esta manera Quintin contará con los materiales necesarios para poder desarrollar su trabajo, aumentar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, así el seguirá esforzándose para salir adelante y superarse.
texts.en:
Quintin is 49 years old, and lives in the city of Camaná. He has one adult son, who has always been his motivation for working hard and getting ahead in life. Quintin is a kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who never had the opportunity to pursue a professional career, since he had to work to help his parents support their family. However, he would have liked to continue his studies at a university. In his free time, he likes to take short trips with his son and enjoy one of his favorite dishes, the delicious, "Chupe de Camarones" (shrimp sucker). 

Quintin works hard every day at his metalworking shop crafting metal doors and windows. He begins work very early each morning, and works about 12 hours per day. He believes that business is going well because he is kind to all his clients, and he puts a great amount of effort and dedication into every item he makes.

Quintin is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, and plans to use the resources from this loan to purchase materials for metalworking, such as: paint, metal and varnish, etc. He hopes that this investment will increase his ability to complete orders for customers, and will increase his overall sales, helping him to get ahead and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as: paint, metal, varnish, etc.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr:
Ngoné s’active dans la vente d’encens et de bijoux : bracelets et colliers depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère  de famille. Ngoné commence sa journée à 8 h et la termine à 18h du soir. Elle demande un crédit de 100000F CFA pour acheter de l’encens et préparer la fête en vendant des bracelets pour enfants et des colliers.
Elle appui son mari dans la dépense quotidienne de la maison.
Elle a comme ambition d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de prêt à porter avec l’appui d’une institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Ngoné has been active for over five years in selling incense and jewelry: bracelets and necklaces. She is married and a mother with a family. Ngoné starts her day at 8:00 AM and finishes at 6:00 PM. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs CFA to buy some incenses and to get ready for the holiday by selling bracelets for children and necklaces.

She supports her husband in covering day-to-day household expenses. 

Her ambition is to open a store selling ready-to-wear clothing with the support of a financial institution like IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy incense, bracelets, and children's necklaces to sell

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Abdou est un jeune cultivateur, qui exerce ce métier depuis 12 ans. C’est un homme assidu au travail qui démarre sa journée de 7h du matin à 19h du soir.
Il est marié mais vit avec ses parents ; et participe à la dépense quotidienne.
Abdou veut un crédit de 50000 FCFA avec lequel il va acheter deux pots de choux, 7 sacs de fumiers et de l’engrais.
Il envisage s’il a un fond, d’acheter une motopompe pour augmenter sa capacité de production.
texts.en:
Abdou is a young farmer who has been practising this trade for the past 12 years. He is a hard-working man who begins his day at 7am and finishes it at 7pm. He is married but lives with his parents and contributes to the daily expenses.

Abdou would like a loan of 50,000FCFA in order to buy two pots of cabbages, seven sacks of manure and fertilizer. If he has the money, he is planning to buy a motor pump in order to increase his production capacity.

loans.use: to buy two pots of cabbages, seven sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr:
Monsieur Gora est un agriculteur  depuis plus de 20 ans. Il vient solliciter IMCEC pour la première fois et demande un crédit de 250000F CFA  pour acheter des intrants agricoles, de l’engrais et 20 pots de choux.
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et travaille pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de cette dernière. S’il avait un fond solide, il augmenterait sa production maraichère.
texts.en: Mr. Gora has been a farmer for twenty years. He is here to requested a loan from IMCEC for the first time. He is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs CFA to buy some farm inputs, fertilizer, and 20 containers of cabbages. He takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses and works to improve the food situation. If he had a solid basis, he would increase production from his market garden.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, fertilizer, and 20 containers of cabbages

loans.name: Kenia Azucena

texts.es: Kenia, de 32 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en San Juan Pueblo, municipio de la Masica Atlántida. Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace dos años de un salón de belleza y venta de productos. Ofrece a sus clientes, peinados, cortes de pelo, alisados, planchados, tintes, tratamiento de uñas etc. también vende productos como tintes, cremas, champoo, glases, quita esmalte etc. el negocio lo tiene en su casa y es muy conocida en la comunidad. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá para surtir de productos de belleza para uso en el salón y para vender. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para sacar adelante a su familia y poderle dar un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Kenia, age 32, is married and has three children.  She lives in San Juan Pueblo in the Masica municipality in Atlántida.

She has had her own business, a beauty salon and beauty product sales, for two years.  She offers her customers hairstyling, haircuts, straightening, ironing, hair color, and nail treatments, etc.  She also sells products like hair color, creams, shampoo, nail polish, and nail polish remover, etc.  She has the business in her house, and she is very well-known in the community.

She will use the requested loan to buy beauty products to use in the salon and to sell.  Her goal is to make her business grow in order to get her family ahead and to be able to give them a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy products like hair color, creams, shampoo, nail polish, and nail polish remover, etc.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su familia, esposa y sus hijos, se dedica a administrar una tienda de productos domésticos y lácteos, este negocio comenzó con el apoyo de su esposa quien le ayuda a atender a los clientes, no tienen un horario establecido y si cuenta con mucha experiencia.

Él solicita un préstamo para comprarse productos como queso, crema, quesillo, para tener abastecido el negocio, esta compra le permitirá crecer y tener surtido en el negocio, podrá atender mejor a los clientes con productos frescos.

El objetivo de Manuel es tener un negocio más grande, que a través de los préstamos logre estabilizar la mercadería, ya que esto le mejorará las condiciones para generar ganancias así como las condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his family —his wife and his children— and works managing a store for home and dairy products. This business started with the support of his wife who helps him to attend to customers. They don't have set hours of operation and they have a lot of experience. 

He is applying for a loan to buy products like cheese, creme, and fresh cheese to be able to supply the business. This purchase will allow him to grow and keep the business stocked. He will be able to better attend to his customers with fresh products.

Manuel's goal is to have a bigger business. Through the loans he could stabilize the merchandise, since this will improve conditions to generate income and the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, and fresh cheese.

loans.name: Cairus

texts.en: Cairus is 20 years old, married, and has three children. He operates a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. He also does farming to generate more income. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has become more knowledgeable about saving because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Cairus has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy maize flour and sugar for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 39 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. To earn a living, Stephen makes shoes and sells them. He operates his business in a competitive environment with loyal customers. He has been in the business for six years and has employed one person. He also does farming to supplement his income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to increase his stock. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy leather, gum, linings, and shoe soles.

loans.use: To buy leather, gum, linings, and shoe soles

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a dedicated mother who works hard to cater for the needs of her family. She continues to sell food stuffs, making them from her home. Fatuma wants to take advantage of the festive season of Ramathan. She wants to increase her supplies and offer a variety of food stuffs. She sells her foods in a strategic place along a busy street where most people gather to buy snacks and juice during the opening hours in the evening after a day of fasting. She says that her business earns her a good profit.

Fatuma is asking for another loan to purchase sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other flavours and ingredients to make more food stuffs for sale. She is very grateful to Kiva and Yehu for their support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other flavours and ingredients

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposo y su familia, no tiene hijos, por el momento nadie depende económicamente de sus ingresos, el negocio ella lo aprendido con su esposo, trabaja desde su casa,  tiene buena experiencia para atender las demandas de la granja. 

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, ya que necesita crecer en la granja y este crédito le ayudará brindandole los recursos económicos para poder fortalecer el negocio, ya que estará engordando un mayor número de cerdos.

Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio y aumentar su clientela,  también poder adquirir su propia casa, para tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Idalia works raising pigs. She lives with her husband and his family. She doesn't have children and for the moment no one depends economically on her income. She learned the business with her husband. She works from home and has good experience to attend to the demands of the farm.

She is applying for a loan to buy pigs, since she needs to grow the farm. This credit will help her, giving her the economic resources she needs to be able strengthen the business, since she will be fattening a greater number of pigs.

She aspiration is to grow in the business, increase her customer base, and also to get her own house, in order to have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jjamer Samuel

texts.es: jjamer  tiene 20 años de edad  y conoce perfectamente los intereses de la juventud, especialmente de aquellos que usan la motocicleta como su primer medio de transporte o trabajan transportando gente, porque necesitan usar  una buena combinación de accesorios que proyecten una imagen de libertad y elegancia. Esto fue en lo que pensó JJamer para dar inicio a su idea de negocio, mediante el cual vende cascos, chalecos, mangas, luces calcomanías y visores, accesorios   que exhibe  en la puerta de su vivienda, ubicada al sur occidente de la ciudad. El trabaja  de lunes a domingo, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y   vende a su principal mercado de motociclistas. Sus compras las realiza con una frecuencia quincenal, de contado en almacenes especializados en estos accesorios y así mismo realiza sus ventas. Este negocio nació hace 1 años y poco a poco ha logrado sostenerse y aunque tiene un potencial de crecimiento,  jjamer no lo ha explorado, porque tiene el desafío de no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para invertirle y expandirse. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cascos, chalecos, mangas, luces, calcomanías y visores, en mayor volumen  con lo que obtendría descuentos por compras en mayor volumen, que traduciría en mas utilidades, porque quiere continuar sus estudios y fortalecer su capital de trabajo, para estabilizar los ingresos que generan bienestar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad, con el que sueña un futuro  exitoso.
texts.en:
Jjamer is 20 years old, and is well acquainted with aspects of youth culture, especially with all things related to motorcycling. Many young people in his area use motorcycles as their primary mode of transportation, or work for a motor-taxi service transporting customers around town. Jjamer perceived the high demand among young people for motorcycle gear and accessories that give off an image of freedom and elegance, and he let this idea form the basis for his small business. He presently makes a living selling motorcycle gear out of his home, including: helmets, vests, sleeves, lights, reflectors, stickers, visors and other accessories. He works from 8:00 every morning until 8:00 every night, and buys his merchandise for resale from wholesalers every two weeks.

Jjamer started his business a year ago, and little by little, has made his way and grown his operation. He has potential for growth, but has not explored these options very much, because he does not have the financial capital to make the necessary investments. His current situation has led him to request this loan, which will be his first with the Santo Domingo Foundation. He plans to use the support from this loan to purchase helmets, vests, sleeves, lights, reflectors, stickers, visors and other merchandise for resale at his business. He plans to purchase these items in bulk in order to receive a discounted price and increase his eventual profits. He hopes in the future to continue his education, strengthen his business and support his family. He lives with his life partner and their 2-year-old son.

loans.use: to purchase helmets, vests, sleeves, lights, stickers and visors in bulk.

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es: Nicolas últimamente ha vendido mucho aguacates, limón y queso y esto es gracias a que con su credikiva aumentó su capital de trabajo y aumentó  el volumen de sus compras, ahora tiene más clientes y su meta es continuar aumentándolo, por eso está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen aguacates y queso para proveerle a tiendas y familias. Su experiencia en el manejo   productos perecederos es su mayor fortaleza por eso vende diariamente y así mismo gana. En su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva dice que “está muy agradecido por la oportunidad ya que antes ninguna otra organización lo había apoyado”.
texts.en: Recently Nicolas has sold a lot of avocados, lemons and cheese. Because of his loan with Kiva, he was able to increase his working capital and buy more products so he now has more customers. His goal is to continue expanding so he is applying for another loan which he will use to buy more avocados and cheese to deliver to stores and individual families. Nicolas's experience dealing with perishable items is his greatest strength--the produce is fresh every day. In his message to Kiva donors he says that he is very grateful for this opportunity as in the past no other organization had helped him.

loans.use: to pay cash for large amounts of avocadoes and lemons.

loans.name: Armeda

texts.en: Armeda is 35 years old, married and the mother of one child. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling vegetables in her village. She earns about PHP 300 a day by patiently making her sales. Armeda is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to expand her business by buying more vegetables to sell, such as eggplants, string beans, squash and bananas. She hopes that expanding her business will allow her to better secure her family's future and give her child a good education. Despite the many hardships she has faced, she is determined to work hard and save for her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mboyo's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 21 Décembre 2009. Les membres qui le composent habitent la même localité et exercent la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Ndèye est âgée de 26 ans. 

Elle est mariée et de 2 enfant dont une fille et un garçon. 

Son prêt reçu, elle achète 4 bidons de 20 litres d'huile, 2 sacs de 50 kgs d’oignons, 2 sacs de 50 kgs de sucre 1 carton de bouillon 2 douzaines de boîtes de lait de corps pour revendre. 

Avec les bénéfices générés par l'activité, elle renforce son épargne, paie ses intérêts pour une partie et avec l'autre elle améliore les conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 21, 2009. The members composing it all live in the same town and have the same work, which is small-scale commerce. 

In the photo, standing at the right with her hand raised, Ndèye, aged 26, is the featured borrower.

She is married and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl. 

With her loan in hand, she is buying four 20-liter containers of oil, two 50-kg sacks of onions, two 50-kg sacks of sugar, a box of bouillon cubes, and two dozen containers of body lotion to resell.

With the profits generated from this business, she boosts her savings and pays the loan interest. The rest is used to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil, onions, spices, sugar, cookies, and cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Ami's Group

texts.fr:
le groupe a été crée le 21 décembre 2009. Il est composé de femmes issues de la même localité et exerçant la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo en arrière plan et levant la main, la vedette Diabou est âgée de 38 ans. 

Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont un garçon et 5 filles. 

Son prêt reçu elle va acheter 4 moutons qu'elle va faire vacciner et élever, un sac de 10 kgs de savon en poudre, 1 à 2 cartons de sachets de 25 g de savon en poudre toujours, un sac de 50 kgs de sucre et un carton de café pour revendre. 

Avec les bénéfices elle renforce ses épargnes, paie ses intérêts pour une partie et avec l'autre elle améliore les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 21, 2009. It is comprised of women from the same town who have the same work, which is small-scale commerce. 

In the photo, standing at the right in the background with her hand raised, Diabou, aged 38, is the featured borrower.

She is married and the mother of six children, a boy and five girls. 

With her loan in hand, she is going to buy four head of sheep she is going to vaccinate and raise; a 10-kg sack of powdered soap, 1 to 2 boxes of powdered soap in 25-gram pouches; a 50-kg sack of sugar; and a box of coffee to resell.

 With the profits, she bolsters her savings and pays the loan interest. The rest is used to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep, powdered soap, coffee, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is 38 years old and the father of three children. He earns a living by operating a retail shop that is located in a very busy area and has many repeat customers. He has one employee, and has already taken out and repaid one loan from Faulu Kenya. He supplements his income by working in a quarry. Mathew dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future, and is requesting a loan for 110,000 KES to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Soukhaly Gouyar Alte Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois Soukaly Gouyar Alte est créé le 28 décembre 2010; le groupe PC 02 est constitué de seize  femmes qui habitent le même village, elles sont parentes, amies et voisines.

Madame Mbène la responsable est âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée mère de trois enfants dont un garçon; elle s'active dans le petit commerce de couscous et capitalise une bonne expérience. Elle est debout sur la photo  habillée en camisole multicolore et a levé la main gauche.


Elle achète chaque jour du mil et du maïs qu'elle transforme en couscous pour le revendre dans le village.


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter par jour 4 kilos de mil, un kilo de maïs, payer le moulin pour la transformation en farine pour faire son couscous le vendre ;pour ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Les bénéfices obtenus lui permettent d'épargner chaque mois, d'aider son mari dans la gestion des dépenses familiales et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois Soukaly Gouyar Alte was created on December 28, 2010; the group "PC 02" is comprised of sixteen women living in the same village. They are related, friends, or neighbors.

Ms. Mbène is the group's official. She is 52 years old, married, and the mother of three children, including a boy; she is active in the small-scale commerce of couscous and capitalizes on good experience. In the photo, she is standing with her left hand raised and dressed in a multi-colored camisole. 

Each day, she purchases millet and corn that she processes into couscous to resell in the village.

With this loan, she plans to purchase 4 kg of millet and 1 kg of corn a day, pay the miller to produce the flour for her to make her couscous to sell, so as to make more income. 

The profits obtained will enable her to save money each month, help out her husband in managing family expenses, and support herself.

loans.use: to buy grains for processing into couscous to sell

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es:
Freddy Antonio  tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar. Desde temprana edad ha trabajado en el campo dedicándose a la siembra de maíz y frijoles; Freddy es un hombre que siempre ha procurado llevar seguridad económica a su familia, por ello, cuando no es época de cultivar la tierra, es decir en verano, atiende una tienda que se encuentra en su misma casa de residencia en la que provee a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad. Cada año se prepara para la nueva cosecha la cual con la fe puesta en Dios espera sea abundante. 

Su familia lo aprecia mucho ya que es un hombre responsable, trabajador y ejemplar. Además se ha ganado la confianza de algunos clientes los cuales prefieren sus productos por ser de buena calidad y a precios accesibles. Como todo buen agricultor está listo para esta nueva temporada de siembra y para darle el mantenimiento adecuado a sus sembradillos y así obtener una cosecha abundante y grano de calidad, ha decidido solicitar a ésta institución un préstamo que le ayude a invertir en los insumos agrícolas (abonos, semillas e insecticidas) necesarios para el buen desarrollo de sus cultivos ya que de eso dependen los resultados de la cosecha. Sin dejar de lado que anteriormente recibió préstamo de esta institución, por lo cual expresa estar muy agradecido con INTEGRAL ya que gracias a su ayuda pudo abastecer de nuevos y mejores productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Freddy Antonio is 37 years old and lives in his own home with his family. From an early age he has worked  in the fields, cultivating corn and beans. Freddy is a man who has always been able to provide for the economic security of his family.  When it is not planting or harvesting season, namely the summer season, he runs a general store from his home.  Every year he prepares for the new harvest, which with his faith in God, he hopes will be abundant. 

His family greatly appreciates him because he is a responsible, hardworking and exemplary man. He has also gained the confidence of some customers who prefer his products because of their good quality and accessible prices. Like all good farmers he is ready for this new planting season and to do the upkeep necessary in his fields and thus reap an abundant harvest. He has decided to request a loan that will help him invest in the agricultural supplies (fertilizers, seeds and insecticides) necessary for his crops to grow well because a good harvest depends on this. He is not ignoring the loan he received previously from INTEGRAL, and is very grateful to this field partner, because thanks to their help he was able to stock new and better products in his store.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Bibigul

texts.en: Bibigul is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children who she loves very much. She sells children’s clothes to earn a living, and has been in this line of work for seven years. Thanks to financial support from Imon International, she has managed to grow her business. She dreams of continuing to do this and becoming prosperous in the future. Bibigul is requesting a loan for 5,000 TJS to buy seasonal clothing such as school uniforms to sell to her customers. She wants to thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jorge Emilio

texts.es: Jorge de 30 años de edad, es propietario hace 2 años de un restaurante ubicado en el municipio de Sabanalarga, población de gente talentosa, creativa y cuna de inteligencia, por eso no por capricho sus habitantes dicen  "Sabanalarga ciudad donde la inteligencia es peste"; no obstante a esta población, el desplazamiento diario de sus habitantes la han señalado como  “dormitorios” del Atlántico, debido a que sus habitantes están estrechamente ligados a la oferta laboral y de educación superior en la ciudad de Barranquilla.      Ese es lugar donde Jorge vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 4 años, a quienes sostiene mediante su trabajo autónomo e independiente, producto de su restaurante donde vende desayunos, almuerzos y comidas especiales, con una frecuencia diaria y mediante una transacción mixta entre crédito y contado. Ubicado frente al hospital de la población, Jorge logra tener clientes constantes como los empleados de esa institución, los familiares de pacientes que se encuentran en este lugar y los visitantes del mismo. La meta principal de Jorge es abrir un nuevo punto comercial y lograr apoyar a su esposa en sus estudios como profesional de la  medicina, porque preparan para sus hijos un futuro prometedor y muy exitoso. En la actualidad Jorge está aplicando a un credikiva,  porque va a agregar nuevos productos a su mercado y estos son las comidas rápidas, como perros calientes, sanduches y otras   variedades de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, para lo cual requiere un “carruaje de perros calientes” . Con esta inversión aprovechará el potencial de clientes que durante 24 horas permanecen en el hospital y requieren alimentarse y   no encuentran como hacerlo en un sitio tan cercano como lo ofrecería Jorge.  Esta es justamente la razón de éxito de un credikiva, primer financiamiento que lograrán con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que planea crecer aun mas.
texts.en:
Jorge, 30, has owned a restaurant for 2 years that is located in the municipality of Sabanalarga.  This area has a population of talented, creative and intelligent people.  It's not for a whim that its residents say "intelligence is endemic." However, due to the daily commute of many of its residents, it is referred to as the "bedroom of the Atlantic," as they travel to the city of Barranquilla seeking the better work and education opportunities that are available there.  

Jorge lives in Sabanalarga with his wife and their 2 children, aged 3 and 4.  They support their children by working independently in their restaurant where they sell breakfasts, lunches and special meals on a daily basis.  They sell both on a cash and credit basis.  Located in front of the local hospital, Jorge manages to get a constant flow of customers, including the employees of this institution, and the relatives and visitors of hospital patients.  

Jorge's main goal is to open up a new commercial location so that he can support his wife in her studies to become a medical professional.   Also, they are preparing their children for a promising and successful future.  At this time, Jorge is applying for a Kiva loan so that he can add new products to his business, including fast food, hot dogs, sandwiches and other products made from wheat flour.  To do this, he needs a hot dog cart.  With this investment, Jorge can take advantage of the fact that the hospital has potential customers who work there at all hours of the night and day who need food, and he will have the nearest food business.  This is precisely the reason why this Kiva loan will be successful. This is the first loan that Jorge will take from the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and with this organization he plans to grow his business even more.

loans.use: to buy a hot dog cart

loans.name: Gildardo De Jesus

texts.es: Gildardo con su anterior credikiva aumentó sus compras en materias primas e insumos variados y de diversos matices, como cuero, herrajes y tintes, con esta inversión produjo artículos de talabartería y marroquinería que vendió y generó más ingresos. El se encuentra muy  satisfecho y ahora se prepara para aplicar a un nuevo credikiva con el cual aumentará nuevamente sus compras de contado de materias primas, para desarrollar nuevos diseños en cuero y artículos   como carteras, bolsos y billeteras. Con su credikiva espera un buen incremento en sus ventas y poco a poco lograr aumentar cada vez más sus utilidades.   Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Un agradecimiento muy especial por el apoyo recibido, con el cual mi negocio ha crecido bastante. “
texts.en: With his previous Kiva loan, Gildardo increased his purchases of raw materials and a variety of supplies in numerous colors, such as leather, hardware and dyes.  With this investment, he produced saddlery and leather goods that he sold, generating more income.  He was very satisfied with this result, and now he is getting ready to apply for a new Kiva loan that he will use once again to buy raw materials on a cash basis so that he can develop new designs in leather and items such as wallets, purses and billfolds.  With this Kiva loan, he hopes to see a good increase in his sales and gradually increase his profits over time.  His message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "A very special thank you for the support I have received, with which my business has grown quite a lot."

loans.use: to purchase supplies in bulk

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum, aged 46, has been engaged in farming and hog-raising for more than 25 years. Thanks to these businesses, she has been able to supply basic necessities to her family and provide education to her children. She is responsible for four children, two of whom are married and live separately. The two younger children are single and still live at home with her. 

Chhum is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pay for labor costs. She hopes that this loan will let her business grow gradually so that she can attain financial freedom.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa is a 63-year-old businesswoman who lives in Mombasa. She is married and has earned a living for the last six years by selling vegetables and fruits, a business she has been very successful in. She is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD to expand her business by buying more cabbage, spinach, oranges, tomatoes and kale to sell to her customers. She will use the profits she expects to earn to start another business. Her hopes and dreams are to be a successful businesswoman and provide her family with a financially stable future.

loans.use: to buy more cabbage, spinach, oranges, tomatoes and kale to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie, a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Oroquieta City, has been making and selling fruit salad for a living for six years now, earning 8,000 PHP monthly. In 2011 she joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients to make more fruit salad. She hopes to be able to expand her business even more in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to make fruit salad.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes John, a 30-year-old businesswoman in Mombasa, is a married mother of three. For the past five years she has been selling vegetables and fruits. This will mark her second business loan from KADET LTD to expand her enterprise. She plans to purchase more cabbage, spinach, oranges, tomatoes and kale to sell.

Agnes John will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to start other businesses. She hopes to see her family lead a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbage, spinach, oranges, tomatoes and kale.

loans.name: Arame  Loum's Group

texts.fr:
le groupe a été crée le 21 Décembre 2009. Il est composé de femmes habitant la même localité et exerçant la même activité qu'est l'embouche bovine, ovine et de caprins. 

Debout à droite de la photo, en arrière plan et levant la main, Arame la vedette est âgée de 67 ans. 

Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon et une fille. 

Son crédit reçu, elle achète une dizaine de moutons, 3 à 4 chèvres et 3 boeufs qu'elle engraisse, élève et revend après. 

Avec ses bénéfices, elle assure certaines charges familiales comme la dépense quotidienne, les frais de scolarité de ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
The group was formed on the 21st of December 2009. It is made up of women who live in the same area and who all work in the rearing of cattle, sheep and goats. 

Arame, the group's 67 year-old leader, is the lady with her hand raised in the background of the photograph. She is married and has a daughter and a son. 

With her loan she is seeking to purchase a dozen sheep, 3 or 4 goats and 3 cows, which she will fatten, rear and sell. 

With the profits she generates she will see to her family's needs, such as daily expenditure, and her grandchildren's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, sheep and goats to rear and sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a hardworking 29-year-old businessman. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He operates his business in a competitive environment with reliable customers. Besides this, he also does mechanics to supplement his income. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He needs a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu sells new clothes, earning income to support her family that way.This is a recently opened business in addition to her charcoal selling business. She says that she wants to stock clothes for sale during this month of Ramadan.

She’s been very responsible and has shown good repayment behavior with previous Yehu loans. She’s currently requesting her third loan to buy more fashions of clothes for her business and to offer to her customers.

Zainabu dreams of seeing her children develop and also of growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more fashions of clothes

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est à son premier cycle, composé de femmes ayant des relations de solidarité et d'entre aide très fort, elles vivent toutes dans le même quartier.

Madame Astou(assise en deuxième rangée à l'extrême droite)est l'emprunteuse vedette. elle est âgée de 43 ans, elle est marié et mère de 04 garçons et 02 filles. son activité consiste à acheter des coupons de tissus pour la confection de drap pour la revente à crédit pour une durée de deux mois maximum.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 60 mètres de tissus des 10 fils de bobine pakistanais du renfort et du brillant.

les bénéfices tirés de cette activité lui permettront d'augmenter son épargne et d'améliorer son niveau de vie et de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group, made up of women bound together by a very strong relationship based on solidarity and looking out for one another, is on its first loan cycle. They all live in the same neighborhood.

Astou (seated, in the second row, on the far right) is the highlighted borrower. She is 43 years old, married, and mother of four boys and two girls. Her work consists of buying rolls of fabric for making sheets that will be sold for credit, with a maximum length of two months.

With this loan, she plans to buy 60 meters of fabric, 10 spools of pakistani thread, patches, and glitter.

The profit from this business will allow her to increase her savings and improve the standard of living of both her family and herself.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing and for resale

loans.name: Sounkar's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 28 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Juillet 2008. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.
Madame Sounkar (accroupie à l’extrême droite dans la photo) est emprunteur vedette du groupe,  âgée de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfant (01 garçon et 02 filles).
Elle achète et vend des prêts à porter des colliers en verre, des bracelets, des bagues … une activité qu’elle fait depuis plus de 3 ans.
Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner au niveau des grossistes de la capitale du pays pour revendre en détaille dans son village et les villages environnants.
-	Pour une somme de 50 000F Cfa de marchandise il lui faudra 03 semaines en moyenne pour l’écouler.
Elle se retrouve souvent avec un bénéfice net de 20 000F Cfa après déduction de toutes ses charges.
Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense quotidienne et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 28 women who play an active role in the micro-credit village bank that was founded in July 2008. They are all from the same village and all have a good relationship with each other. They operate small-scale store-based businesses. 

Madame Sounkar (kneeling down in the far right hand corner of the photo) is the group leader. She is 30 years old, married and a mother of three (one son and two daughters). 

She buys and sells clothing, beaded necklaces, bracelets, rings... a trade she been working in for over three years. With this loan she is seeking to purchase goods from the capital's wholesalers in order to sell at retail in her village and in the neighbouring villages. 

With 50,000 FCFA's worth of merchandise she would sell out within three weeks. She often generates a net profit of 20,000 FCFA after expenses.  The profits that she generates from this business will enable her to put some money aside as savings, and to see to a small portion of her family's daily expenses, as well as her children's school fees.

loans.use: to source goods from the capital's wholesalers in order to sell at retail in her own village, and neighbouring ones

loans.name: Galle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 28 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé Juillet 2008. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Gallé (assise à l’extrême droite dans la photo) est responsable du groupe,  âgée de 58 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 09  enfants (4 Garçons et 5 filles).
Elle a une place au marché ou elle vend du poisson fumé et séché, elle a une expérience de 02 ans dans ce domaine.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en poisson séché et fumé dans les régions côtières.
-	Elle achète les 02 paniers de poisson fumé à 40 000F Cfa pour le revendre au détail à 70 000F Cfa
-	Elle achète aussi le panier du poisson séché à 10 000F Cfa pour le revendre au détail à 17 500F Cfa
-	Pour le transport et la manutention elle paie 5 000F Cfa
Chaque 15 jour après déduction de ses charges liées à son commerce et la dépense quotidienne elle se retrouve avec un bénéfice net de 25 000F Cfa en moyenne tous les 15  jours.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner et  en vu de construire une maison pour ces enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 28 women who all play an active role with their local micro-credit bank, founded in July 2008. They are all from the same quarter and all get on well. They primarily work in small store-based retailing. 

Madame Gallé (sitting on the far fight hand side of the photo), is the group leader. She is 58 years old, widowed, and a mother of 9 children (4 boys and 5 girls). She has a market stall where she sells smoked and dried fish, where she has worked for 2 years. 

With this loan she aims to source dried and smoked fish from her country's coastal regions. 
- She would like to buy 2 baskets of smoked fish, at 40,000 FCFA for re-sale at 70,000 FCFA
- She would like to buy a basket of dried fish for 10,000 FCFA, which she will re-sell at 17,500 FCFA
- She would need 5,000 FCFA for transport and upkeep of the stall

Every fortnight, after subtracting operating expenses she generates an average net profit of 25,000 FCFA.

The profits that she generate enable her to put money aside as savings, with the aim of building a home for her children.

loans.use: to stock up on dried and smoked fish for re-sale

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert operates a grocery shop to earn a living. He had previously acquired a loan of 20,000 KES which helped him to buy cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes and kale for his business. With the income he generated, he was able to support his family. Robert has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy bananas, potatoes and onions.

loans.use: To buy bananas, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 31 years old, married and has four children who are in school. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. Besides that, she does farming to generate more income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has improved her saving culture because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a hardworking businessman who operates a motorcycle transport business to make a living. He runs his business in a competitive environment with loyal customers. He has been engaged in this business for seven years. He has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. Antony dreams of expanding his business to generate more income and employ more people in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is 27 years old and married. To earn a living, he operates a "boda boda" (motorcycle) transport business. He operates his business in a competitive environment with loyal customers. He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. Besides that, he does farming to generate more income. Through the seminars he attended at Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and owning a fleet of Nissans in the future. Martin has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is an enterprising man, dedicated to his work and prepared to get ahead. He wants to achieve his goals and works hard every day to reach them. He wants to increase his clientele because this will increase his income, but he needs to invest in more shaving machines, so he has approached Yehu to request a second loan that will allow him to buy another shaving machine and start a new barber shop. 

Evans has good payment references and he is certain that he will repay his debt and also continue to expand his business, thanks to his hard work.

loans.use: to buy another shaving machine and start a new barber shop.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema's business has improved greatly and this marks Rehema’s second business loan from KADET LTD after successfully paying back her previous loan well and in good time. 

She plans to purchase more braids, weaves, hair chemicals and hair oils. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop. She hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, hair chemicals and hair oils

loans.name: Katuku

texts.en: Katuku is 50 years old and married with three children who are in school. To earn a living, Katuku operates a retail shop. She has been in the business for seven years. Besides this, she does livestock farming to supplement her income. Through the seminars she attended at Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save and manage her business because she has been trained on business management. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. Katuku has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar, maize flour, soap and rice for sale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, soap and rice

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Bernard is 49 years old and married. He practices poultry farming to earn a living. He operates his business in a conducive environment with reliable customers. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of improving his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more chickens for his farm.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Monica Maria

texts.es: Mónica de 24 años de edad es propietaria de un negocio ubicado en el municipio de Sabanalarga, población de gente talentosa y creativa  y que por  el desplazamiento diario de su población lo han señalado como uno de los municipios “dormitorios” del Atlántico, cuyos habitantes están estrechamente ligados a la oferta laboral y de educación superior en la ciudad de Barranquilla.   Este es un negocio donde  vende variedades como enseres, productos artesanales, calzado, ropa y papelería. Su experiencia data desde hace 5 años cuando lo inició apoyada por su familia de cultura comercial. Ella tiene un punto de ventas en su propia casa donde vende a los vecinos de su alrededor y sus clientes son principalmente docentes y empleados oficiales. Las mercancías la compra en diversas regiones del país a donde viaja: en la  ciudad de Barranquilla en el departamento del Atlántico compra  todo lo que tiene que ver con papelería y útiles escolares,  en el municipio de San Pues en el departamento de Córdoba, todo lo que se refiere a las artesanías y en la ciudad de   y en Bucaramanga  en el municipio de Santander todo lo que tiene que ver con el cuero pues estos son especialistas en calzado, bolsos y también en ropa infantil. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artesanías y calzado, artículos  que han sido solicitados en su preventa y quiere impactar a su fiel clientela con precios y calidad. Su credikiva será una inversión exitosa, porque le aportará a su capital de trabajo  la posibilidad de comprar en mayor volumen  y obtener descuentos, que lógicamente formarán parte de sus utilidades y  aumentaría sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mónica, 24, owns a business located in the municipality of Sabanalarga, a town with talented, creative people which due to the commuting nature of its population has been designated one of the “bedroom” communities in Atlántico; its residents are tightly associated with employment and higher education in the city of Barranquilla.

She sells appliances, crafts, footwear, clothes and stationery supplies in her store.  Her experience goes back five years to when she started out with support from her family who has commercial tradition.  She has a sales point at her house where she sells to neighbors nearby and her main customers are teachers and government employees.  She buys the merchandise in various regions of the country she travels to.  She buys everything related to stationery supplies in Barranquilla, Atlántico Department.  Everything to do with crafts she buys in San Pues in Córdoba Department and everything related to leather in Bucaramanga in Santander Department because they are the experts in shoes, purses and children’s clothes.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through which she’ll buy crafts, footwear and other items her customers have requested during pre-sale; she wants to have an impact on her loyal customers with prices and quality.  Her Kiva loan will be successful because it will provide her with working capital to be able to buy in large volume thus obtaining discounts which will logically be part of her profits thus increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy crafts and footwear.

loans.name: Pahe

texts.en:
Pahe is 40 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are in school. She has proven to be a hard-working woman. She lives in a rental house, which is located in the District of Mombasa, Kenya. 

Pahe sells fruits and vegetables at the market. Pahe sells these products to local residents and friends. Every day she strives to attract more customers and generate more orders for her products so that she can earn a better income. This business helps her with covering her personal expenses and assisting her family with the household finances. 

Pahe wants to restock her vegetable stall with more merchandise. Hence, she is looking to take a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fruits and vegetables. Her aim is to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 40 years old and married with eight children. She does tailoring to support her family. Rose has been in this business for ten years and has employed one person. In addition, she does farming to generate more income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has become financially knowledgeable because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Rose has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is from Biasong, Lopez Jaena. She is 39 years old. Ana is married and has three children. To make a living, she sells fish while her husband does fishing. She's been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Ana joined GDMPC. Ana is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 56 years old and married with only one child. She is a resident of Baray district of Kompong Tom province. For many years now, Sok and her husband have helped each other in managing around two-hectares of farmland, on which she plants and harvests rice to sell each season. She typically earns in the neighborhood of 8,000 Khr per day. For additional income, Sok uses her spare time to raise pigs and operates a small convenience shop from her house. 


Sok has requested this loan in order to purchase fertilizers to put on her soil and buy feed to keep fattening her pigs. Sok is hoping that these inputs will be a great help in developing her current businesses and thereby produce a positive outcome and a better living standard.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to put on her soil and buy feed to keep fattening her pigs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a hardworking 52-year-old business lady and a mother of two children. To support her family, she operates a retail shop in a busy environment with reliable customers. She has been in the business for seven years. Besides that, she does farming. Agnes hopes to expand her business in the future and open another outlet. She needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy sugar, rice and maize flour for sale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and maize flour

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 28-year-old green-grocery store owner in Mombasa. He also runs a retail shop to supplement his income. He is married and has been running the grocery store for the past six years successfully. 

This is James’ third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas. He will use the anticipated profits to start a charcoal business. 

He hopes to have his own permanent residential house.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 45 years old and a retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. She is a single mother of two children. She has been running her retail shop for the past year with great success. 

This is Fatuma’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour, and washing powders to sell. 

She will use the proceeds from her expanded business to buy land to build rental houses. She hopes to excel in her business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour, and washing powders

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 22 years old and married with one child. He sells clothes to make a living. He has been in this business for two years.  In addition, he does farming to supplement his income. Since he has become a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of opening another outlet in a different location in the future. Wilson has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Billy

texts.es: Billy de 19 años de edad, desde hace menos de dos años es la propietaria de un café internet, donde ofrece acceso a las redes, servicio de fotocopiaje, escaneo y llamadas a celulares; su negocio ubicado en el municipio de Galapa, población área metropolitana de la ciudad de  Barranquilla. Billy quiere mejorar la oferta de servicios a sus clientes, pero  aunque cuenta con módulos disponibles, no tiene  computadores para ubicarlos en ese espacio y su clientela muchas veces se va, porque no logra la solución a sus necesidades de comunicación en el ciberespacio. Para Billy el insuficiente capital de trabajo para hacer esta inversión es su mayor desafío, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un nuevo computador  y con ello empezará poco a poco  a responder a las necesidades de su clientela. Billy es muy trabajadora, ella da apertura a su negocio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche; sus compras las realiza de contado y a crédito en las papelería de la ciudad de Barranquilla y sus ventas son de estricto contado y dependen del tiempo en el cual utilice su cliente su equipamiento y acceda al internet. Billy sueña con tener un local mucho más amplio y bien acondicionado, para ofrecer más confort a su clientela, que bien se lo merece y eso es justamente a lo que ella quiere llegar.
texts.en:
Billy, 19, has owned an Internet Café for less than two years.  He offers network access, photocopying services, scanning and mobile phone calls.  His business is located in the municipality of Galapa, a town in the Barranquilla metropolitan area.  

Billy wants to improve the services he offers customers.  Even though he has available modules, he lacks the computers to put into them and customers often leave because they can’t satisfy their need to connect to cyberspace.
