For Billy, insufficient working capital is his greatest challenge and the reason why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a new computer and start to better respond to customer demand.

Billy is very hardworking.  The business is open from 8 in the morning until 10 at night.  Purchases are cash and credit in a stationery shop in Barranquilla and sales are strictly cash and depend on how long the customer uses the equipment to access the Internet.  Billy dreams with having a more spacious, well-equipped locale to offer more comfort to customers; it’s something that’s more than deserved and precisely the goal to reach.

loans.use: to buy a new computer.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de queso,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia,la socia lleva su mercaderia a Cusco y Mollepata para distribuir a sus clientes que le solicitan,a la vez la socia tambien sigue dedicandose a la ganaderia ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de quesos para su negocio.


La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Gregoria is continuing with her business buying and selling cheese.  She has been in this business for a long time, and it is going very well, thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business.  Gregoria is a responsible person who has a strong desire to continue to work for her family.  She takes her products to Cusco and Mollepata to distribute to the customers who request them.  Gregoria also works raising livestock; she will continue with this activity to provide for her family.  

Gregoria is requesting a loan to buy cheese for her business.  She is grateful for this loan, and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy cheese for her business

loans.name: Almara

texts.en:
Almara is a 49-year-old farmer. She is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her children and husband in an IDP Settlement. She breeds sheep and sells it for meat and fur purposes. She has been in this business for 8 years. Her husband is a workman and his job is low-paid and not permanent.

Almara usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them in 4-5 months and resells them for a more profitable price to the local vendors. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Mutton is considered very healthy and is also present in everyday life. Fur is very useful for blankets and bed mattresses made by local women.  
   
She applied for 1200 AZN to purchase one milker cow and six sheep. This will be her second loan with AqroInvest and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milker cow and six sheep

loans.name: Nohemy

texts.es: Nohemy de 37 años se dedica a la venta de comidas y refrescos en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Soledad, donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 6 a 18 años. Ella tiene 12 años de experiencia en este negocio, desde que sus padres le ayudaron a emprenderlo inicialmente en un kiosco donde vendía refrescos, jugos naturales y productos  empacados como papas y golosinas; hoy adicionó la venta de contado y a crédito de comidas,  en un horario  desde las 5 de la mañana,   hasta las 10 de la noche. En la actualidad está aplicando a su financiamiento # 18, en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque necesita adecuar un dormitorio y el baño, para poco a poco organizar su vivienda, porque los ingresos provenientes del negocio están destinados al  los gastos familiares y a su reinversión.    Ella dice que la Fundación la ha apoyado durante 10 años y ella confía y está agradecida con esta organización, y  e sabe la va a continuar apoyandola, para que su casa esté en las mejores condiciones posibles y todos en su familia encuentren un ambiente confortable, por lo bien organizada que a futuro estará.
texts.en:
Nohemy, 37, sells food and beverages in her house located in the municipality of Soledad where she lives with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 6 to 18 years.  She has 12 years’ experience in this business since her parents helped her set it up initially in a kiosk where she sold soft-drinks, natural fruit juice and packaged goods like potatoes and snacks.  At present, she’s added selling food for cash and on credit.  Her schedule is from 5 in the morning until 10 at night.

She’s currently applying for loan #18 in Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because she needs to build a bedroom and bath to gradually organize her house because income from the business are earmarked for family expenses and for reinvestment.  She says that the Fundación has helped her during 10 years and she trusts and is grateful to this organization and she’s sure that it will continue supporting her so that her house will have the best possible conditions and everyone in her family will have a comfortable environment because of the good way it will be organized in the future.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es: Fredy con su anterior credikiva, logró comprar en mayor cantidad materias primas e insumos, como marcos y machimbre en  aluminio, con los cuales elaboró puertas y ventanas que vendió y aumentó un poco más sus ingresos. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir un nuevo credikiva con el que planea aumentar el volumen de sus compras una vez más, e incrementar también su capital de trabajo y responder a su nueva clientela, que cada día hace mas pedidos y sueña con ser más oportuno en sus tiempos de respuesta. Fredy invertirá su crédito en hojas y tablas de aluminio en mayor volumen. El envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva “ Estoy agradecido por el apoyo recibido con los préstamos que me han ayudado a salir adelante. “
texts.en:
Freddy used his previous Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies like frames and aluminum siding in larger amounts that he used to manufacture doors and windows that he sold thus increasing his income a bit.  He’s currently getting ready to receive a new Kiva loan he plans to use to once again increase the volume of his purchases and also to increase his working capital to respond to new customers who daily place more orders; he dreams with being able to fill order in a more timely fashion.

Freddy will use his loan to buy metal sheets and aluminum siding in larger amounts.  He sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “I am grateful for the support received through the loans that has helped me to get ahead.”

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and aluminum.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John runs a motorcycle transport business. He also operates a retail shop to generate more income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to buy a motorcycle for his business. This helped his business to improve as he was able to supply his goods easily. He has requested a loan of 35,000 KES to buy cooking oil, maize flour and sugar for his retail shop.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Saybali

texts.en:
Saybali, a 48-year-old married father of four children, is an IPD who lives and works in an IDP settlement. His business is sheep breeding, a profitable and stable enterprise he has had for 10 years. Saybali buys lambs, raising and fattening them in four-five months and then resells them for profit in the local livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN.

People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt. Mutton is considered very healthy and enjoyed in everyday life. Fur is very useful for blankets and bed mattresses made by local woman.

Saybali would like to increase his herd and so is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to buy five sheep and one milking cow.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and one milking cow.

loans.name: Construyendo Sueños Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Construyendo sueños con Esperanza” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de verduras, venta de ropa, venta de comida rápida, artesanía, venta de ensaladas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Casablanca, ubicada en la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Maria, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste chaqueta de color café, en su cuello usa un pañuelo de color café claro y en sus manos sostiene una carpeta de Fondo Esperanza, en sus piernas sostiene su cartera de color negro.
Ella se dedica  al rubro de comida rápida, específicamente a la venta de churrascos, almuerzos, chorrillana, empanadas, entre otros, desde hace 9 años. Comenta que trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo e hijo, trabaja de  lunes a domingo desde las 10ºº hasta las 02ºº horas de la mañana.
La mercadería e ingredientes que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Valparaíso y Santiago en distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará bebidas, carne y vienesas.
Una de las metas de Maria es seguir creciendo con su negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su esposo, y 2 hijos de 29 y 9 años de edad. Sus sueños son obtener una casa propia y continuar con el negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Casablanca es una comuna de la provincia de Valparaíso, ubicada en la región del mismo nombre. Tiene un clima de tipo mediterráneo, con veranos de sequía prolongada y lluvias invernales cortas, pero muy fuertes. El nombre “Casablanca” proviene del siglo XVI cuando existía “una casa de muros blanquecinos“ sobre una loma ubicada a un costado de uno de sus caminos más antiguos, llamado camino real de carretas. 
Actualmente su economía se basa en servicios, agricultura, transporte, agroindustria, turismo, comercio.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Construyendo Sueños con Esperanza” (Building Dreams with Hope).  It has 21 members who are in a variety of lines of work among which are vegetable sales, clothing sales, fast-food sales, crafts, salad sales and services, among others.  They are all from the Casablanca Commune located in the city of Valparaíso.

María is a member of this communal bank and in the photo appears seated in the first row, second from right to left, wearing a brown jacket and a light brown scarf tied around her neck.  She’s carrying a Fondo Esperanza folder in her hands and has a black purse on her lap.

She sells fast-food, specifically ‘churrascos’ [grilled meat], lunches, ’chorrillana’ [a bed of French fries topped with a layer of fried onions with scrambled eggs, and on top is sautéed beef and served with a side of pebre sauce] and turnovers, among others.  She’s been in business nine years.  She comments that her husband and her son help her with the work.  She works Monday through Sunday from 10 until 2 in the morning.  She buys the merchandise and ingredients she needs in the cities of Valparaíso and Santiago at low-cost suppliers which is convenient economically.  She will use the loan to buy beverages, meat and sausages.

One of María’s goals is to continue growing with her business in order to generate higher income as well as to have a better quality of life.  María lives with her husband and two children who are 29 and 9 years of age.  Her dream is to own a house and to stay in business.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza because it will make it possible for her to invest in her business.  With respect to the communal bank she’s part of, she comments that it has very good communication.

Casablanca is a commune in Valparaíso Province located in Valparaíso Region.  Its climate is Mediterranean with summers of prolonged drought and short but very intense winter rains.  The name “Casablanca” comes from the 16th-century when a house with very white walls existed on top of a hill alongside one of the most ancient roads, called “Camino Real de Carreteras.”  Its economy is currently based on services, agriculture, transport, agribusiness, tourism and commerce.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meat and sausages.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
Tofiq is a 31-year-old young man, very hardworking and friendly. He is IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his two daughters and wife in an IDP Settlement. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his garden. He has five years of experience in this field. With the help of AqroInvest he was able to start his business five years ago.

Tofiq usually sells his crop from his yard. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in an Azerbaijan family and also they make fresh punch. He primarily grows grapes, pears, apples, peaches and plums, as well as tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers and carrots. His monthly income is 130 AZN.

He applied for 1000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en: Rudy is a married 55-year-old man living in Biasong, Lopez Jaena. He has 6 children. He has been cultivating his land for 20 years and earns 7,000 PHP each month. He joined GDMPC in 2011 and is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. With the revenue made possible by this loan, Rudy hopes to expand his land.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady est vendeuse de poisson depuis 15 ans. Elle loge dans un village situé à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Elle a initié la vente de poisson frais dans le village ; compte tenu que c’est un endroit un peu enclavé et que cela arrange la plupart des habitants de cette contrait.
Elle sollicite pour la 3ème fois un crédit de 300000 FCFA pour pouvoir satisfaire la clientèle qu’elle s’est déjà faite.
Khady gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa propre maison.
Elle envisage d’acheter un congélateur pour pouvoir acheter en quantité et congeler ses produits puisque la demande augmente de jour en jour.
texts.en:
Khady has been selling fish for 15 years. She lives in a village about 22 km from the main city. She started the sale of fresh fish in her village as the area is somewhat closed-in, and most of the locals find this arrangement accommodating. 

This is her third loan cycle, and she is seeking 300,000 FCFA to meet the needs of her customer base. 

Khady is responsible for her household’s daily expenses. 

She plans to buy a freezer, which would allow her to buy and store large quantities of fish as customer demand is increasing steadily.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for resale in her village.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Isabel tiene 61 años de edad,la socia tiene un negocio de artesania,ella vende tejidos de chompas en forma independiente ofrece a sus amigos y amigas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un atienda donde pueda vender las chompas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lanas de colores y palitos de tejer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Isabel, 61, belongs to the “Virgen del Carmen de Calca” communal bank located in Calca District belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.  She has a crafts business selling knitted sweaters independently to her friends and acquaintances.  She works from 8am until 6pm and her dream is to have a store where she can sell the sweaters.  She’s asking for the loan to buy yarn in assorted colors and knitting needles.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy yarn in assorted colors and knitting needles.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria tiene 48 años la socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 10 años en este trabajo,el sueño de la socia es tener un colegio.La socia solicita el credito para pagar estudio de su hijo que esta en el colegio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: María, 48, belongs to the “Virgen del Carmen de Calca” communal bank located in Calca District belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.    She works as an elementary school teacher from 8am until 6pm and she has ten years’ experience in this occupation.  Her dream is to own a school.  She’s asking for the loan to pay for her son’s schooling; he’s in secondary school.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to pay her son's schooling costs.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, también encontramos playas hermosas y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, sus pobladores poseen una habilidad para la preparación de platillos ya que su comida es deliciosa y sobre todo tienen una alegría muy contagiante. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, especialmente ver los noticieros, pero también aprovecha en algunas oportunidades disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos Miguel solo tuvo estudios de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Miguel trabaja día a día en su pequeño negocio como chofer de mototaxi, con el cual puede apoyar en su hogar con los gastos, ya que es su fuente de trabajo; Miguel labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque trata con respeto a sus clientes.

Miguel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, cambio de llantas y compra de repuestos; de esta manera el podrá tener un vehículo en buen estado y manejara con más seguridad, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener otra mototaxi”.
texts.en:
Miguel, 40, lives in the city of Chicha, a city noted for its warm, welcoming climate.  One can also find beautiful beaches here and it’s the birthplace of great Peruvian sports heroes.  Its residents are very good at cooking their traditional food which is very delicious.  Above all, they possess a joy that’s contagious.  When he has free time available he likes watching television very much, especially newscasts but he also takes advantage sometimes to enjoy one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Carapulca con Sopa Seca.”  Because of his limited economic resources, Miguel only attended secondary school but would have liked to have had a university career.

With much enthusiasm, Miguel works day to day in his small business driving a mototaxi that makes it possible for him to support his home and cover expenses since it’s his source of employment.  Miguel works about 10 hours daily and can tend to up to 25 customers per day.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s kind to his customers and above all because he treats them with respect.

Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve give him he will be able to service his vehicle, replace tires and buy spare parts so that he will have a vehicle that’s in good operating condition and he will drive with more security which will lead to improved income so that he can continue striving day to day toward making his greatest dream a reality: to own a house and another mototaxi.

loans.use: to buy tires, spare parts and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: The mother of six children, five of whom attend school, Pauline is 41 years old and married to a businessman. She earns a living through selling fish by the piece in a small store. She has been in this business since 2003. In order to address the problem of competition in the market and keep her customers, she has requested a loan from Yehu so that she can restock her merchandise (fish, cooking oil, etc.) Pauline would like to participate in her children's education and expand her business. Her business goal is to be the best fish supplier in the region.

loans.use: restock her merchandise (fish, cooking oil, etc.)

loans.name: Fashanye Group

texts.fr:
J.Baptiste fait partie du groupe Fashanye et  habite à  Muramvya. Il a 29 ans et est marié à  Suavis, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce  des bières locale et industrielle  depuis 2ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bière locale et beaucoup de caisses de bière industrielle à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

 Grâce aux bénéfices de son commerce, il payera les frais de scolarité, les frais de santé de la famille et habillera ses enfants ans les prochaines années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
J. Baptiste, age 29, is a member of the group Fashanye and he lives in Muramvya. He is married to Suavis, a farmer. They have three children, one of whom attends school. 

J. Baptiste has been selling local and industrial beers for two years. This is his first loan cycle with Turame, and he plans to use this credit to bolster his working capital and stock up on large quantities of local and industrial beers for resale. This will help to increase his revenue.  

The profits earned through his activity will allow him to pay for his children’s tuition and clothing, and to provide for his family’s healthcare. In the coming years, he would like to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to stock up on large quantities of local and industrial beers for resale.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Presente Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Emprendedoras Presentes” está conformado por 20 emprendedores  quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de frutas secas, venta de ropa, venta de shampo y cremas, almacén, venta de comida de animales, repostería, venta de plantas de interior y exterior, feriante, venta de cloro y lavalozas, clases de tango, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Renca, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Cecilia presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en segunda fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de  izquierda a derecha, viste una polera de color negra y encima lleva puesto un chaleco de color café, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de artículos varios y según temporada, como ropa, juguetes adornos florales, volantines, desde hace 13 años. Comenta que trabaja durante las tardes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras y liquidadoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará volantines, juguetes y ropa interior.
Las metas en su negocio son seguir creciendo para aumentar sus ingresos y brindarle a su familia un buen bienestar.
Cecilia vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja en construcción como soldador, y su hija de 3 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es terminar su casa, ya que siempre le falta algo por terminar.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que existe buena comunicación. Por otro lado  las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Renca es una comuna ubicada en el sector norponiente del Santiago (capital de Chile), región metropolitana. Es una comuna con un fuerte trabajo comunitario, entre lo que se destaca el canal de televisión comunitario “Renca TV”, creado con el fin de promover las actividades culturales y artísticas de la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Emprendedoras Presentes” (Present Entrepreneurs).  It has 20 members who carry out a variety of lines of work among which we have dried fruit sales, clothing sales, shampoo and cream sales, store, animal feed sales, pastry shop, interior and exterior plant sales, street merchant, chlorine bleach and dishwashing soap sales, tango classes and services, among others.  All are from Renca Commune located in the city of Santiago.

Cecilia is communal bank president.  In the photo she is standing in the second row, third from left to right, wearing a black blouse with a brown vest over it; her hair is dark brown and she wears it gathered up.

She works selling miscellaneous, seasonal merchandise like clothes, toys, floral decoration and kites.  She’s been in business 13 years.  She comments that she works afternoons and arranges her schedule to fit her availability.  She buys her merchandise from suppliers and liquidators at low cost which is an economic advantage.  She will use the loan to buy kites, toys and underwear.  Her business goal is to continue growing to increase income and provide wellbeing for her family.

Cecilia lives with her husband who works in construction as a welder and with her 3-year-old daughter.  Her dream at the family level is to finish building her house since it always has something still to do.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza because it will make it possible for her to invest in her business.  With respect to her communal bank, she comments that there is good communication.  On the other hand, the training has been useful for her to learn new sales strategies and bookkeeping.

Renca is a commune located in northwest Santiago (Capital of Chile) metropolitan region.  It’s a commune with a strong community work among which the community television station “Renca TV” stands out.  It was created in order to promote the commune’s cultural and artistic activities.

loans.use: to buy kites, toys and underwear.

loans.name: Gulsum

texts.en:
Gulsum is a 45-year-old woman, married with three children. She is IDP. She has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables in her garden for the last 10 years. Her husband helps her raise crops.
She raises apples, pears, peaches, grapes, pomegranates, cucumbers, tomatoes, potatoes, corn and carrots. She sells her crops from her yard. Her monthly income from this business is 180 AZN. 

Gulsum needs additional financial sources to invest into her business and for this purpose she applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. She will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Eulogia tiene 65 años de edad,la socia anteriormente era profesora,pero ahora ya es profsora cesante,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y vestidos,la socia vende panatalones,chompas,casacas,ella tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda venta de ropa y vestidos.La socia solicita le credito para comprar vestidos,chompas,pantalones y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Eulogia, 65, belongs to the “Virgen del Carmen de Calca” communal bank located in Calca District belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.  She used to be a teacher but she’s retired now.  She also sells clothes and dresses.  She sells pants, sweaters and jackets.  She has a store where she works from 8am until 6pm.  She’s been in business four years.  Her dream is to expand the clothing store.  She’s asking for the loan to buy dresses, sweaters, pants and blouses.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph runs a motorcycle transport business to make a living. He is also a farmer. Previously, Joseph had acquired a loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to buy fertilizer. He has requested a loan of 90,000 KES to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 55 years old and married with three children who are in school. She operates a retail shop to earn a living. She has engaged in this business since the year 2007. She also does farming to generate more income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of operating a wholesale business in the future. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy mugs, plates, and buckets.

loans.use: to buy mugs, plates, and buckets.

loans.name: Bibie

texts.en:
Bibie is 43 years old and a food stall owner in Mombasa. She is married. She has been selling food for the past five years.

This marks her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and also in the expansion of her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane is a 36-year-old Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and five school-aged children. She’s a friendly and above all hard-working woman. She’s a seamstress; very talented at her job and has twelve years of experience working in the same occupation. She’s specialized in making "fish trickles". She’s well known in her area and works upon clients' requests from her home. In order to provide the family with extra financial support, her husband also works and has his own business. 

With her requested loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l, she will purchase different types of needles and thread in addition to many other items. She is very optimistic and has the ambition to open her own factory as soon as she can, hoping to enhance her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase different types of needles and thread in addition to many other items

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy is married and has three children. Christy is 30 years old and lives at Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. Christy is operating a fishing business venture to earn a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. In 2009, Christy joined GDMPC. In the future, Christy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 53 years old and married with two children who are in school. She does livestock farming to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for fifteen years. She also depends on her husband's salary. Previously, Mary had acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She hopes to practice poultry farming in the future. She has requested a loan of 37,000 KES to install electricity in her cow shed.

loans.use: to install electricity.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is a retail store owner who sells grocery items to the people in her village. She has been doing it for over five years and is very thankful for her income which serves as sustenance for her family's meals and provides an allowance for her child. Zenaida hopes to sell more merchandise. That is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, and biscuits to sell in her store. Additional merchandise will help her increase sales too. She will then be able to pay for school fees on time.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, and biscuits to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a 53-year-old firewood vendor in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of five school-age children. Her business has been in operation for the past year with great success. 

This is her fourth loan term from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more firewood to supply her customers. She will use the proceeds from her business to educate her children and repay her loan.

She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a housewife but does only do household chores for her family. She also runs a small store in front her house as source of income. Aurora has managed her store for 10 years now. She usually earns PHP 300 daily selling grocery items to the people in her village.  She wants to keep selling good products and to increase her merchandise, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, and eggs to sell in her store.

Aurora is very determined and hoping to continuously offer friendly services to all her valued customers. This will also result in more sales at her store leading to her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia's photo was taken on her way to the public market with her spouse, Felix. They buy vegetables and re-sell them for profit. Selling fruits and vegetables is their business. They have been doing it for almost 10 years. Delia is now borrowing a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy more merchandise to sell. She will buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes, and beans to sell. Additional income will be used for her children's school fees. 

With her family's support and determination in life, they will achieve better living conditions someday.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 25 years old and a humble farmer who has been living in Kompong Cham province. She owns and manages a few plots of farmland, on which she cultivates rice both for her daily sustenance and for sale. She has been engaged in this type of business for almost 7 years. Sok has two school-aged children who still depend on her income.
	
At the present, Sok would like to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase lubricant oil and gasoline for her tractor and also buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides in order to grow healthier bean crops this season. She hopes that she will be able to make her business more sustainable so as to pursue better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase lubricant oil and gasoline for her tractor and also buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: La Bonne Semence De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Jeannine est La coordonatrice de son groupe La Bonne Semence de Ouanaminthe.  Elle est mariee. Elle a 6 enfants.

Jeannine habite dans la région de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son  commerce de chaussures de tennis pendant les 5  dernières  années.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir pour acheter chaussures de sport pour femmes, hommes et enfants. Jeannine espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise.

Des autres membres de sont groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbon le produits divers et cosmetiques, quincaillerie, etc. Jeannine dit que son défit principal c'est devenir  un grand commercant.
texts.en:
Jeannine is the coordinator of her group La Bonne Semence de Ouanaminthe. She is married, and she has six children.

Jeannine lives in the region of OUANAMINTHE in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. She has been managing her tennis shoes business for the last five years. 

She would like to use this loan to invest in buying athletic shoes for women, men, and children. Jeannine hopes that this loan will help her to expand her enterprise.

Some other members of her group have need of a loan for such businesses as charcoal, a general store, cosmetics, hardware, etc. Jeannine says that her main challenge is to become a major merchant.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes to sell

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has been working on a freelance basis since 2000 selling detergents to customers located in different geographical zones. In parallel, he has worked in a local company since 2002 in order to supplement the family’s income.  

In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory of cleaning products to be able to increase his sales and therefore his income. In the future, he is planning to open his own detergents shop.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of cleaning products

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is very industrious. He is single, a student and an entreprenuer from Anquiray. During weekends, he helps his parents generate income to supplement his studies, too. He sells plastic ware such as basins and mats. He has been doing it for three years now. He earns P3,000 each month selling these items. He is now asking for a loan of P6,000 to further increase his income by selling more plastic ware. He will buy more basins, mats, hangers and pots to sell. 

In the future, Ismael would like to keep generating income for  his family so he can also pay his matriculation fees on time.

loans.use: to buy more basins, mats, hangers and pots to sell

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 40 years old; he owns a food stall in Mombasa. He is a married father of three. He has been selling food for the past two years.

This marks his second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and also in the expansion of his business. 

He hopes to educate all his children to college level and see them lead a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 46 years old and has six children. To earn a living, she does tailoring and also repairs shoes. She operates her business in a competitive environment with reliable customers. She also farms to supplement her income. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Rose has requested a loan of 25,000 KES to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.en: Prudencio is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. He is 33 years old. Prudencio is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Prudencio makes and sells iced buko (pie) to sell. Prudencio been in business for 5 years and earns PHP 6,000 per month for these activities. In 2011, Prudencio joined GDMPC. Prudencio is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make his products for sale. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 52 years old and sells detergents in Mombasa. She is a married mother of three children. Her business has been in operation for the past two years and it is doing great. 

This is her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more detergents to re-sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more detergents.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en:
Pum is a 43-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Pum is in the business of selling a variety of things, including grocery items, spices, canned foods, noodles, and beverages in a local market of the province. Her husband is her motivation in this retail business. She earns an average of 5.00 USD per day. 

Pum would like to refill her stock of merchandise again in order to satisfy her customers. Due to the lack of insufficient capital, she has applied for a loan of 250 USD to purchase more commodities such as spices, canned food, smoked fish, beverages, and other miscellaneous things. Through this purchase, Pum is hoping to develop her business and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities such as spices, canned food, smoked fish, beverages, and other miscellaneous things.

loans.name: Dukomezegusenga Group

texts.fr:
Barnabé fait partie du groupe  Dukomezegusenga et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 40 ans et est marié à  Euphrasie, commerçante de restaurant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 7 à  16 ans, tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce  des objets en métaux  depuis 4 ans. 

Il est à son huitième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’objets en métaux(des carcasses des vieux véhicules,...) à revendre en Ouganda, pour gagner plus. 

 Grâce aux bénéfices de son commerce,  il voudrait  avoir un grand capital pour avoir plus de bénéfices
texts.en:
Barnabé is part of the group Dukomezegusenga and lives in Bujumbura. He is 40 years old and married to Euphrasie, a restauranteur. Together they have four children, from 7 to 16 years old, who are all students. 

Barnabé has been dealing in metallic objects for four years. 

He is on his eighth loan at Turame. With this KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and buy many pieces of metal (junked vehicles, … ) to resell in Uganda, so as to earn more. 

Thanks to the profits from his business, he would like to have a large amount of capital to have more profits.

loans.use: to buy many metallic items (junked vehicles,...) to resell in Uganda

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is from Biasong, Lopez Jaena. She contributes to her family's finances through her business making pots. She’s a 59-year-old married woman with 9 kids, who tries her best to earn profit. For 25 years, she has managed this business. She earns about PHP 4,500 per month. For the time being, she’s needs to buy more clay to use in her business. She joined GDMPC just this year and asks for a loan of PHP 5,000. Rosalinda desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clay to use in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for rickshaw transport business

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Sarom is 44 years old and widowed with three children, one daughter and two sons, who have their own employment at a garment factory. She lives in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province where rice farming is a common way to earn a living and she has been farming rice for ten years to support her family, supplementing her family’s income by selling a sweet fermented (alcoholic) black rice dessert. The current business earns her approximately US$8 per day and she manages to save about US$5 each day after daily expenses. 

This is the third loan for Sarom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden. Now she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of US$1,000. With this loan, she is going to purchase a motorcycle for her children to use to commute to their workplace. She hopes this loan will enable her children to save some time in traveling back and forth to work so they can help with the family’s business and housework. Sarom also hopes to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to use to commute to their workplace

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has three children. She sells clothes and panties in Ayensudu, near Elmina, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a farmer. Grace uses her income to pay her children's school fees as well as a few household expenses. Grace will use the loan to purchase clothing and panties in bulk. With her new profits, Grace plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase outerwear and panties in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch and sardines.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria Antonieta tiene 56 años de edad,la socia se dedica al negocio de tejidos,ella teje chompas,mantas y pantalones y luego lo vende en forma independiente,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le gusta tejer mucho,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender los tejidos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lanas de colores y palitos de tejer.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta is requesting a loan to buy colored wool and knitting sticks.  She belongs to the Communal Bank, "Virgen del Carmen de Calca."  The bank is located in the Calca district, belonging to the province of Calca and Cusco.

Maria Antonieta is 56 years old and is involved in the textile business.  She knits sweaters, blankets and pants and then sells them independently.  She has been in this business for 5 years and enjoys knitting a lot.  Maria Antonieta's dream is to have a store where she can sell her knitting ware.  She is requesting a loan to buy colored wool and knitting sticks.

Maria Antonietar is happy for the loan and agrees to meet the payments on time.

loans.use: to buy colored wool and knitting sticks.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
Azamjon is from Tajikistan. He is 23 years old and is not married yet. He lives with parents. To make a living, he sells food items as sugar, pasta, oil, conserves (a mixture of fruit, often with raisins and sometimes nuts, that is cooked until it becomes very thick and chunky), etc. in the shop. He has been engaged in his business for 3 years and earns little money for these activities. He wants to offer a wider variety of goods and in this way attract many customers. He is requesting a loan of 2,100 USD which will be used to buy more food items to sell.
He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy food items for more variety.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and buy an over machine and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
The lead member of this group is a shy, traditional 24-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has 3 years experience, and with a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq, she is planning to buy an embroidery machine, a table and chair for her sewing machine, and some fabric and raw materials. Through these purchases and the investment she has made, she is hoping to improve her little business and offer better services for her customers.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor (thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual). As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this group of borrowers has been altered for their  protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, a table and chair for her sewing machine, and some fabric and raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Guliston

texts.en:
Guliston is 32 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to be a successful businesswoman. She is married and has two clever children. She graduated from the Pedagogical University. She is a teacher of biology but her salary from teaching is small and that’s why she began her own business selling cloth some years ago. 

As she is very smart, her business has developed year by year. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop the business and in this way improve her living conditions. Her husband helps her with the business. 

Guliston wants to develop her business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy. She is asking for a loan to buy new varieties of cloth to expand the assortment of her goods. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy new varieties of cloth

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, of Lower Tiparak, Oroquieta, helps her family by providing services such as cake baking for birthdays and other occasions. She’s a 46-year-old married mom with 1 child, who tries her best to earn on her own. For 11 years, she has managed this business. She earns about PHP 16,000 per month. For the time being, she’s needs to buy more equipment for her business. She joined this year and thank GDMPC microfinance for the loan of PHP 20,000 it provided to her. Gemma desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 41-year-old food stall owner in Mombasa. He is a married father of three. He has been selling food for the past five years.

This marks his third business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and also in the expansion of his business. He hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Elevenia

texts.en:
Elevenia is 38 years old and married with three children.

Elevenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Elevenia has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and vegetables.

Elevenia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and over machine and buy an embroidery machine and an iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair the vehicle for her husband's transport business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 43 years old and married with six children.

Alejandra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Alejandra has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening.

Alejandra aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.fr:
Jean Marie Vianney  est né au Rwanda et a 25 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfant de 1 ans. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants.  Son niveau d’éducation est de 2 ans de secondaire.

Jean Marie Vianney  est commerçant. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter en gros du sucre, riz, sel, huile pour le revendre dans sa boutique……, payer le frais de transport.

Pour faire croitre son commerce il planifie de donner un service de qualité à ses clients et avoir des diversités des articles pour attire plus des clients et sollicite d’autres crédits pour augmenter ses activités. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  devenir un grossiste des produits alimentaire. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de son enfant, construire une maison et assure le bien être de sa future famille.
texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney was born in Rwanda and is 25 years old. He is married and has one child, who is a year old. He has one person to support other than his child. He has two years of secondary education.

Jean Marie Vianney is a merchant. This loan cycle is his second one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy in bulk: sugar, rice, salt, oil… to resell in his store. and to pay the transport costs. 

To grow his business, he plans to provide quality service to his customers, have a diversity of goods in order to attract customers, and request more loans to increase his business. In the coming years, he would like to become a wholesale grocer. With the profits, he plans on covering the cost of his child's schooling, build a house, and ensure his future family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy in bulk some sugar, rice, salt, and oil to resell in his store.... and to pay for transport costs

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en:
Zakariya is a married man living with his wife and three children. Two of them are working and one is still attending school. He’s a 42-year-old hard worker looking to better enhance his family’s way of living. Zakariya has many years of experience in his current job. He’s a furniture painter who works with high professionalism. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can. He’s known for being punctual and well-organized.
Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added painting tools for his business such as brushes, oils, new paint colors, and many other items. He will be utilizing the loan to improve his work and take on added projects. Zakariya is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he looks to take more projects maybe outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase more painting tools for his business.

loans.name: Jose Octavio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Jose Octavio tiene 72 años de edad,el socio tiene un negocio de ferreteria,el socio vende clavos,pinturas y herramientas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m.el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas,pinturas y clavos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; The bank is located in the province of Calca and in the department of Cusco. 

The bank member, Jose Octavio, is 72 years old. He has a hardware store, from which he sells nails, paint and tools. He works from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm. He has had this business for 8 years. His dream is to make his business bigger. He has requested a loan to buy tools, paint, and nails. 

The bank member is happy to have the loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools, paint and nails.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Luisa tiene 61 años de edad,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de cereales,ella vende en el mercado,la socia vende trigo,cebada y moraya,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,la socia tiene 7 años en este negocio en sus ratos libres la socia le gusta preparar tortas para su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar trigo,cebada y moraya.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; the bank is located in the district of Calca in Calca province, Cusco Department. Luisa, 61, sells grains such as wheat and barley and dehydrated potatoes in the market from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. This has been her business for 7 years and the means by which she hopes to get ahead. In her free time, she likes to bake cakes for her family. She dreams of having a stand where she can sell grains and will use this loan to buy wheat, barley, and dehydrated potatoes. She is pleased to have the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy wheat, barley,and dehydrated potatoes.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
Jean Pierre  est né au Rwanda et a 26 ans, il est célibataire. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de secondaire.

Jean Paul  est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter en gros du sucre, riz, sel, huile pour le revendre dans sa boutique……, payer le frais de transport.

Pour faire croitre son commerce il planifie de donner un service de qualité à ses clients et avoir des diversités des articles pour attire plus des clients. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  devenir un grand, ouvrir d’autres alimentations et supermarché. Avec les profits, il prévoit de construire une maison et assure le bien être de sa future famille.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre was born in Rwanda and is 26 years old. He is not married. He has five years of secondary education.

Jean Pierre is a merchant. This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy in bulk: sugar, rice, salt, and oil to resell in his store... and to pay the transport costs. 

To grow his business, he plans to provide quality service to his customers and have a diversity of goods in order to attract customers. In the coming years, he would like to become a major merchant and open other grocery stores and a supermarket. With the profits, he plans on building a house and ensuring his future family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy in bulk some sugar, rice, and oil to resell in his store and to pay for transport costs

loans.name: Les Phares De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Terlius est le coordonateur de son groupe LES PHARES DE OUANAMINTHE. Il est celibataire et  a 0 enfants. Il habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. 

Terlius a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du tennis. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Les autres membres Les Phares ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz, chaussures et des vetements. 

Terlius dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises. Terlius dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’un camion pour transporter les marchandises.
texts.en:
Terlius is the coordinator of his group LES PHARES DE OUANAMINTHE. He is unmarried and has no children. He lives in the city of OUANAMINTHE in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Terlius has been running his business for the last six years. He would like to use this loan to invest in buying tennis shoes. He hopes that this loan will help to expand his business. The other members of Les Phares have need of a loan for such businesses as selling charcoal, rice, shoes, and clothing. 

Terlius says that his main challenge is a lack of regular customers. His dream is to buy a truck to transport merchandise. Terlius says his main goals include increasing his business.

loans.use: to buy tennis shoes to sell

loans.name: Marie Rosine

texts.fr:
Mme Marie Rosine est une femme mariée, mère de 06 enfants âgés entre 30 et 14 ans. Elle s'active dans l'agriculture artisanale et le maraîchage.
Avec ce prêt, elle va acheter des semences d'arachide pour cultiver et de pépinières de légumes et papate douce pour le maraîchage.
Avec le bénéfices de l'activité, elle va aider à la prise en charge de ses enfants et aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en: Ms. Marie Rosine is a married woman and the mother of six children, from 14 to 30 years old. She is active in artisanal farming and market gardening. With this loan, she is going to buy peanut seeds to grow and some vegetable and sweet potato nurseries for her market gardening. With the profits from her business, she is going to help support his children and also to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy plant nurseries and seeds for her market gardening

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Marina se dedica al ngeocio de agricultura,ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva maiz y trigo y luego lo vende al por mayor estos productos,la socia tambien trabaja como profesora del nivel inicial en el distrito de Calca,la socia ya tiene 5 años dedicandose a la agricultura,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender sus productos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su tierra de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA.” The bank is located in the district of Calca in Calca province, department of Cusco. Marina owns agricultural land on which she grows corn and wheat to later sell at wholesale. She is also an elementary teacher in the Calca district. She has been farming for 5 years and dreams of having a stand where she can sell her products. Marina will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her framland. She is pleased to have this loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Avec ce troisième crédit qu’elle sollicite dans notre institution, madame Yawa veut s’approvisionner en pagnes. Elle est âgée de 41ans, mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. C’est en 2004, qu’elle a  démarré l’activité et elle s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus considérable lui permettant de se prendre en charge, d’assurer le niveau de vie de la famille. Elle veut créer une boutique, faire prospérer son activité et voir ses enfants grandir dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en: With this third loan she is requesting from our institution, Ms. Yawa wants to stock up on 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She is 41 years old and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school. In 2004, she started her business and is very pleased with it because it brings in significant revenues enabling her to support herself and ensure her family's living situation. She wants to establish a store, make her business prosper, and see her children grow up under good conditions.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Martha Sinforosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Martha Sinforosa tiene 64 años de edad,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de jora que es un productos que se usa para preparar chicha que es una bebida a base de maiz,la socia vende la jora en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de jora.La socia solicita el credito para comprar jora al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”. The bank is located in the district of Calca, which belongs to the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.  

The bank member, Martha Sinforosa, is 64 years old. She makes a living selling "jora" which is an ingredient that is used to prepare chicha, a fermented corn drink. She sells "jora" in the market from 8:00 am until 7:00pm. Her dream is to increase and improve her business. She has requested a loan to buy "jora" at wholesale cost.   

She is happy to receive a loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy "jora" (an ingredient used to make a traditional drink) at wholesale cost.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants âgés de 08 et 05ans, tous scolarisés, Mme Abla est mariée à un chaudronnier. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes et des ustensiles de cuisine depuis 2006. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend de façon ambulante. Sa difficulté est le problème d’emplacement et de stockage. Elle veut augmenter son stock c’est pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES un second prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises (ustensiles de cuisine et pagnes) elle espère avec le profit réalisé ouvrir une boutique et devenir une grande commerçante. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle voudrait assurer la scolarité et les besoins sociaux des enfants.
texts.en:
A mother of two children, 5 and 8 years old, both in school, Ms. Abla is married to a metal worker. She has been a retailer of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and kitchen utensils since 2006. She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells her goods door to door. Her problems involve placement and inventory.

She wants to increase her inventory. To do so, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise (kitchen utensils and 'pagnes'). She hopes to use the profits to open a store and become a major merchant. As for the future, she would like to ensure that her children's schooling costs and needs in life are met.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Nelly Faustina

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer de 45 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus Padres, a quienes ama y cuida mucho, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus Padres, lamentablemente Nelly no puso estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las acogedoras calles de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Nelly trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas, desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad para vender sus dulces, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Nelly se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de golosinas para su negocio, tales como: galletas, caramelos, chocolates, wafer, entre otros dulces; de esta manera Nelly contará con la mercadería necesaria para realizar sus ventas, así ella espera incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco irá ahorrando para poder adquirir una carrera más grande para poder facilitar sus ventas y con ello en un futuro no muy lejano sueña con tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Nelly, 45, is single and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents, whom she loves and cares for. Nelly is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiatic person who puts great effort into getting ahead and improving her parents' lives. Sadly, she wasn't able to study for a professional career, though she would have liked to do so. In her free time, she likes to take a stroll down the city's lovely streets or sometimes cook the delicious traditional dish "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" to share with her family.

Every day from early in the morning, Nelly works with dedication and enthusiasm at her small business selling sweets as a street vendor. She works about 10 hours a day and believes her business is doing well because of her dedication and friendly customer service. Nelly is very grateful to Kiva lenders because their support will allow her to buy cookies, candies, chocolates, wafers, and other sweets for her business. In this way, she hopes to increase her income, which she is saving little by little so that she can pursue another career that will have higher sales and allow her to buy her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sweets such as cookies, candies, chocolates, and wafers for her business.

loans.name: Sol Y Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Sol y las Estrellas” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros , entre los cuales se encuentran; tejidos, venta de dulces, artesanía, venta de botas, joyas, venta de ropa, accesorios de plásticos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Quilicura, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Sara, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al fondo de la última fila, ocupando el cuarto  lugar de izquierda a derecha, su cabello es corto y de color castaño oscuro, y en su cuello lleva un pañuelo de varios colores.
Ella se dedica al rubro de confección de vestuario, específicamente poleras, blusas, desde hace 15 años. Comenta que trabaja todos los días, tiene una persona que le ayuda con las costuras, y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. Su taller lo ubica en su propia casa y entrega su trabajo  en colegios, agencias de viaje y bancos.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la comuna de Independencia, que se especializa en ventas de géneros y telas al detalle y por mayor.
Con el crédito comprará tela e hilos para la confección de sus costuras.
Las metas en su negocio son continuar con las costuras para tener seguir teniendo una buena calidad de vida.
Sara vive con su esposo y su hijo de 28 años de edad quien trabaja y estudia. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es ver que su hijo termine sus estudios y sea un gran profesional.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Quilicura es una comuna perteneciente a Santiago, capital de Chile, ubicada en el extremo noroeste de región metropolitana. El origen del nombre de la comuna viene del mapudungun (lengua mapuche): "kila", que significa “tres” y "kura" que significa “piedra”, por lo que se deduce que el nombre de Quilicura equivale a "tres piedras", como  el nombre que le dieron los primeros habitantes de este valle en referencia a los tres cerros que son perfectamente visibles y que delimitan la comuna.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank, called “Sol y Las Estrellas,” is made up of 16 entrepreneurs who are engaged in different fields, among which are woven goods, the sale of sweets, handicrafts, the sale of  boots, jewelry, the sale of clothing, plastic accessories and services, among other areas. All of them live in Quilicura Commune, located in Greater Santiago.

Sara, president of the Communal Bank, who is standing in the photo in the back in the last row, fourth from the left, has short, dark brown hair and is wearing a multi-colored scarf around her neck. She has been making clothing, specifically T-shirts and blouses, for 15 years. She notes that she works every day and has someone who helps her with the sewing. She arranges her delivery schedule according to her availability. Her workshop is located in her home and she delivers her finished products to schools, travel agencies and banks. She buys the merchandise she needs in Independencia Commune, which specializes in both retail and wholesale sales of different types of fabric.

Sara will use the loan to buy fabric and thread to make her garments. Her business goals are to continue sewing in order to continue having a good quality of life.

Sara lives with her husband and 28 year-old son who is working and studying. Her dream, as far as her family is concerned, is to see her son complete his studies and become a great professional. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided to her by Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business. She says that the training workshops have been fundamental for both her business and for her own personal development because she has learned how to organize and better distribute her income and investments.

Quilicura is a commune belonging to Santiago, the capital of Chile, located in the extreme northeast metropolitan region. The origin of the commune’s name comes from Mapudungun (the language of the Mapuche): “kila”, which means  “three” and “kura” which means “stone” from which it follows that the name “Quilicura” means “Three Stones”, the name the first inhabitants gave this valley in reference to the three hills that are clearly visible and that delimit the commune.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread to make her garments.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
This is Lucita. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her grandchildren and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for buying groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better.  Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her grandchildren. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lucita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 49 years old is a carpenter in Mombasa. He is married and a father of four children. He has done carpentry work for the last twelve years and he is doing great.

This would be his first loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With the proceeds, he would like to purchase new hammers, nails and chisels. He will use the anticipated profits as a result of the loan to educate his children and repay his loan.

He hopes to gradually expand his business and to be able to easily support his family.

loans.use: to purchase new hammers, nails and chisels

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo ya que necesita volver a invertir en la tienda, comprándose materiales no perecederos como arroz, frijoles, y también azúcar, también se comprará aceite, de detergentes, y otra variedad de productos que son demandados por los clientes, este préstamo le dará la fortaleza para poder mejorar el inventario en el negocio y asi mismo poder tener un mejor nivel de ventas.
Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo fortaleciendo el negocio con las ganancias, ya que se reinvirtieron para poder mantener el nivel de productos en el negocio y poder retener a los clientes.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is asking for a new loan because he needs to invest in the store again buying non-perishable items like rice, beans and sugar; he’ll also buy oil, detergent and other products his customers ask for.  This loan will strengthen his store’s inventory so that sales level will improve.  

He got good results from the previous loan in that the business improved profits that were reinvested into having a good supply of products in the store in order to retain customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
