Carmen es una mujer de 46, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus 5 hijos, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias desde hace varios años se separó de su esposo, desde entonces ella ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos,   ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que dedicada todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su empeño y a su espíritu emprendedor, Carmen se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Arroz con Pollo para engreírlos.
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Carmen trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confección de carteras y casacas, desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella inicia su labor, dedicando a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Carmen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales para su negocio, tales como: telas, cuero, evillas, botones, cierres, entre otros artículos; de esta manera Carmen contará con los materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo, así ella espera poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco utilizará para expandir su negocio y conseguir su gran sueño de crear su propia marca de cartera, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto con su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 46 year old woman who lives in the city of Chincha with her five children. Unfortunately, due to various circumstances, she and her husband  separated a number of years ago. Since then, she has been both father and mother to her children. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her effort to moving her family forward. Thanks to her hard work and enterprising spirit, Carmen is studying for a degree in Business Administration. In her spare time she enjoys sharing pleasant times with her children and occasionally she cooks a delicious “Arroz con Pollo” to pamper them.

Thanks to her children’s support, Carmen works day after day, with determination and enthusiasm. She has a small business making handbags and jackets. She starts work early in the morning and spends approximately 10 hours a day. She enjoys her work and believes that it is going well because of her dedication and her helpful service to her customers.

Carmen is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy material for her business, such as fabric, leather, buckles, buttons and clasps, among other items. In this way Carmen will have the necessary material to carry out her work. Thus she hopes to be able to increase her sales and income, which she will use to slowly expand her business and achieve her great dream of creating her own trademarked handbag. Thus she will continue working so that she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business, such as fabric, leather, buckles, buttons, clasps, etc.

loans.name: Saveth's Group

texts.en:
Saveth is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district. All of her daughters are still in school in the area. Rice farming is the main source for her family’s income, and she has been farming rice on a three-hectare area of farmland for about fifteen years. The current business earns her family a daily income of about 60,000 KHR, but she is able to save 25,000 KHR each day. 

This is the second loan for Saveth’s group of two members, and they both completely paid back the first loan with VisionFund. With the successful first loan, she has been able to keep her two daughters in school and afford to fence her house. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to pay for some soil to fill the lower part of her house. With this loan, she hopes to improve her house and also hopes to have a decent house in the future.

loans.use: To pay for some soil to fill the lower part of her house

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Grimaneza tiene 64 años de edad,la socia tiene un negocio de jugueteria,ella vende muñecas,carros entre otros juguetes,al socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m ahsta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene este negocio 3 años,en sus tiempos libres la socia le gusta pasar con sus 2 hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar juguetes como muñecas y carros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE CALCA” Communal Bank. The bank is located in Calca District, belonging to Calca Province in the department of Cusco.

The member, Grimanez, is 64 years old and has a toy store, selling dolls and cars among other toys. She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. and has had this business for three years. In her spare time she enjoys going out with her two children. Grimaneza’s dream is to expand her toy-selling business. She is applying for a loan to purchase toys, such as dolls and cars.

This member is happy with the loan and is committed to making all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase toys such as dolls and cars.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase large quantities of milk for a milk- and yogurt-selling business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna. She previously borrowed a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education expenses, for household needs, and for necessary business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 25,000 PHP, to increase her inventory by purchasing groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products. By displaying more items at the store, she feels that she can generate more profits. Her business profits will definitely help her to pay for her family's daily needs and for her children's education expenses. She looks forward to generating more profits with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna hopes to be able to expand her business in the near future, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of three additional family members (grandchildren). She is a tailor. She operates her business from home. She has been in this business for the last 16 years. She also gets additional income through operating a pay phone. She works six days a week.

She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials for making clothes.

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms and also to educate her children up to the university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials

loans.name: Lucinda Maribel

texts.es:
Lucinda, se ha decidido por darle continuidad al negocio con un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de telas para continuar confeccionando ropa y tambien cuero para fabricar carteras y bolsones, esta nueva inversión le ayudara para que Lucinda fabrique vestidos, blusas y trajes casuales, tambien pueda confeccionar carteras y bolsones, pues variara la mercaderia puesta a la venta. 
Con el prestamo anterior, logro comprarse materiales de costura, ella considera que a traves de estos prestamos se le proporcionan las herramientas para que ella continue trabajando, esta muy contenta de que su fuente de ingresos permanezca estable.
texts.en:
Lucinda has decided to give continuity to her business with a new loan to buy fabric and continue making clothes and also leather to make wallets and purses.  This new investment will help Lucinda manufacture dresses, blouses and casual outfits and will also be able to manufacture wallets and purses in order to sell a variety of goods.

She was able to use her previous loan to buy sewing supplies.  She considers that by means of these loans she acquires the tools she needs to be able to stay in business.  She’s very happy that her source of income can remain stable.

loans.use: to buy fabric and leather.

loans.name: Carlos Borromeo

texts.es:
Carlos, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 15 años y tres años de edad, el administra un taller de enderezado y de pintura automotriz, tiene 15 años de trabajar en este taller y lo aprendió realizando trabajos en otros talleres, actualmente el negocio es propio desde hace cinco años, tiene tres operarios, su horario de atención es de 7:30 de la mañana a 5:00 de la tarde o dependiendo de la demanda de los clientes.

Solicita un préstamo para comprarse materiales para realizar la construcción de un cuarto totalmente encerrado con el estilo de un horno, para poder pintar los vehículos en este cuarto en aquellas ocasiones donde exista poco sol, ya que el cuarto lo encerrará con lamina para poder mantener el calor y de esta manera realizar su trabajo, el préstamo le servirá con los recursos económicos para que él pueda realizar el proyecto y así poder mejorar su servicio a los clientes.

Su aspiración es crecer en su trabajo, ganar nuevos clientes, que la construcción de este cuarto le  de la funcionalidad que necesita.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and two children who are 15 and 3 years of age.  He runs a car body and paint shop.  He’s been working in this shop for 15 years and learned by working in other shops.  He’s owned the business for the last five years and he has three employees.  He’s open to the public from 7:30am until 5pm or according to customer demand.

He’s asking for a loan to buy supplies he needs to build a completely sealed, oven-like room to be able to use to paint cars in when there’s little sunshine.  He will enclose the room with metal sheeting to retain the heat and be able to do his work this way.  The loan will be of use because he’ll have the economic resources to carry out the project thus improving customer service.  His hope is to grow in his business, to acquire new customers and that building this room will lead to the functionality he needs.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is still running his windscreens-making business. He has all of the necessary equipment for his business in his garage. Vahan’s business is the only source of income for his family.

With the loan proceeds from the previous Kiva loan, Vahan bought materials needed for his business. Now he is seeking another loan, this time in the amount of 800,000 AMD to buy additional materials (e.g., glass, cellophane and plastic film) for his business from wholesale markets in Yerevan.

loans.use: to purchase materials (such as glass, cellophane and plastic film) needed for his business

loans.name: Safaraly

texts.en:
Safaraly is 37 years old. He is a clever and industrious man with a great desire to get ahead. Sharifamoh is his partner; they have a son and love him very much. 

Safaraly offers a variety of manufactured items including lamps, cosmetics and mirrors and sells his merchandise in a local market. He began this work over 7 years ago because he needed to earn money. Currently, his partner helps him to purchase his merchandise. This is his second loan with IMON International and he is grateful for its financial support in helping him to realize his plans. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy additional manufactured items to increase the assortment of items he sells.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 38 años, su pareja es Juan, con quien tiene tres hijos, ellos viven en la casa que compraron durante en el tiempo que llevan de convivencia.
Los padres de Alicia, desde muy pequeña, le enseñaron el cuidado de los animales, especialmente de los gallos. Ahora, ella en su chacra a parte de tener cultivos tiene sus gallos, los que en cada feria o fiesta de su localidad vende, ya que están bien entrenados y muy fuertes, pues los usan para los torneos de pela de gallos. Gracias a la venta de estos animales ella puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y lo que a veces le afecta son las enfermedades que pueden tener, pues pueden morir y pierde su inversión.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura que cumplirá puntualmente sus obligaciones de pago. Además, se siente fortalecida y en confianza con su banco comunal.
Con los 4,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará los materiales (madera y mallas de aluminio) necesarios para construir galpones para sus gallos.
texts.en:
Alicia is 38-years-old.  Her spouse is Juan and they have three children.  They live in the house they bought during the years they’ve been living as a couple.

Alicia’s parents taught her when she was still little how to care for animals, especially roosters.  Now, in addition to growing crops in her field she also raises her roosters that she sells at each street market or local festival since they are well-trained and very strong; they are used for cockfighting.  

Thanks to the sale of these animals, she can cover her household expenses.  She’s been in this business 20 years and what sometimes affects her is the illnesses they can sometimes be affected by because they can die and she loses her investment.

This is her first MFP loan and she assures that she will make her installment payments punctually.  She feels strengthened and comfortable in her communal bank.  She will use the requested 4000 new soles to buy building materials and supplies (lumber and aluminum mesh) needed to build the corrals for the roosters.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
Jose, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir más en el negocio del cultivo de maíz, el se comprará abono y herbicidas para poder aplicarlo a la siembra y prevenir las plagas y la maleza en la producción, ya que esto le permite asegurar la alimentación a su familia.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener una buena inversión aplicada en insumos para mejorar la producción del cultivo, con esto ha logrado tener la seguridad para la alimentación a su familia y al mismo tiempo poder comercializar parte de la cosecha, está muy agradecido por el proyecto ya que le permite mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
José’s asking for a new loan because he needs to invest more in his corn business.  He will buy manure and herbicide to apply to his crops and prevent infestations and weeds in the crops since they insure his being able to feed his family.

He was able to use his previous loan for a good investment in supplies to improve crop yields.  This led to his having a secure source of food for his family while also making it possible for him to sell part of his harvest.  He’s very grateful for the project because it’s allowed him to improve his production.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Iy's Group

texts.en:
Iy is a 46-year-old father of eight children, five of whom are students in the local public school. His big family resides in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. As the breadwinners in the family, he and his wife have struggled to earn sufficient income for their children to survive by growing cassava on two hectares of farmland. They have been involved in this business for ten years and are able to earn about 29,000 KHR per day. 

Iy's group consists of two members; he is the group leader and a first time borrower while his comember is a second time borrower. They are each seeking to borrow 500,000 KHR. Iy will use his most of his portion of the loan to pay for plowing fees and a small amount of it to buy bean seed for planting in order to earn additional income. He hopes to double his profit in order to achieve a good standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and buy bean seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants.

loans.name: Thuon's Group

texts.en:
Thuon is 48 years old and lives in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district.  She has six children, two of whom are dependents while the others are independently employed in Thailand. Thuon and her husband have made a living as fishermen for several years; sometimes she works for others for a fee. 

Thuon’s group consists of two female members.  This is Thuon's third loan, and her comember’s seventh loan, with VisionFund. Her past two loans, which she repaid, have helped relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. As the leader of her group, Thuon will use her portion to buy household necessities for her family and use a portion of it to buy rice for her family’s consumption. She hopes to increase her needed household provisions to improve her daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy household necessities as well as rice for her family’s consumption.

loans.name: Teresian

texts.en:
Teresian is a 47-year-old business lady in Mombasa. She is married. She sells vegetables and fruits, a business she has been doing for the past six years with success.

This marks her second business loan from KADET LTD to expand her business. She plans to purchase more cabbages, spinach, oranges, tomatoes, and kale. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to start another business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and a financially stable future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbages, spinach, oranges, tomatoes, and kale.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 23 años, su pareja es Teodosio, de 30 años,  fruto de esa relación tienen un pequeño hijo, Henry de 2 años, a quien le brindan amor y desean un mejor futuro.
Hace 3 años que ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda. Para poder obtener las ganancias necesarias trata de que siempre esté surtida con los productos que sus clientes le solicitan, ya que esa es la manera de tenerlos satisfechos y que regresen a comprarle. Por lo general trabaja sola, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja cuando él esta libre de su trabajo.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP,  por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, como en anteriores oportunidades. Además, se siente agradecida con su banco comunal por el buen trato que hay entre todos.
Con estos 3,000 nuevos soles abastecerá su tienda con bebidas, verduras, arroz, conservas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Ángela is 23-years-old.  Her spouse is Teodosio, 30.  They have a little boy, Henry, 2, who they love and wish a better future for.  She’s had a home-based grocery store for three years.  To earn the necessary profits she always tries to have it well-stocked with the products her customers request because that’s the way to keep them satisfied so that they will return to buy more.  In general she works alone but sometimes her spouse helps out when he’s off work.

This is her 3rd MFP loan and she commits to continue making her payments like she’s done previously.  She’s grateful to her communal bank because of the good way they treat each other.  She will use these 3,000 new soles to stock her store with beverages, vegetables, rice and conserves, among others.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants.

loans.name: Gal-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Gal-Erdene, 42, lives with his wife and two children in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Gal-Erdene has has been running a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar since June of 2011, previously having conducted a retailing business in the Russian border towns. His wife works as a teacher in the kindergarten. His six-year-old son is disabled and receives the child allowance from the government.

Living in the ger in winter is cold, and Gal-Erdene's children always get sick because of that cold. He has therefore started to build a house for his family and plans to install double-glazed vacuum windows in his new home to reduce coal fuel costs and pollution.

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) and snow storms occur. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night as families just try to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic emissions from cars are a major contributor to pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that operate on natural gas.

loans.use: to pay for double-glazed vacuum windows for his new family house.

loans.name: Makara

texts.en:
Aged 35 years old and originally from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province, Makara is a married mother of two daughters who are still in school. 

For ten years, she has made a living for her children's sake via cassava and soy bean planting. She can save about 4 US dollars per day on average. Makara has taken loans from VisionFund three times and managed to pay back the loans with success. From the past loans, she feels empowered that she can well-manage her household progressively, especially with decent food for her daughters. 

To keep her business going, she is now seeking a new loan as a fourth loan-cycle client in the amount of 1,000 US dollars. She will use a portion of her loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs, and another portion of it for leasing another plot of land for growing her cash crops. 

She hopes to gain more income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and lease an additional plot of farmland, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es:
Leocadio tiene 33 años, su pareja es Grimanesa, de 30 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos. 
Ellos tiene una tienda de comestibles que acondicionaron en su casa desde hace un año, la cual la atiende Grimanesa, mientras él está pendiente de su parcela, cuidando de sus plantas de café y cacao, que obtuvieron durante 10 años de trabajo. Con las ganancias de la tienda invierten en la compra de más productos y con las ganancias de sus cosechas solventan los gastos de su hogar. Pero aun así necesita un apoyo financiero para que siga creciendo con su tienda, ya que es lo que más ingresos le genera. Con el tiempo anhela comprar mostradores de vidrio para exhibir sus productos y que su tienda se vea más ordenada y atractiva.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente contento de saber que ha obtenido un préstamo que le ayude a cumplir con sus planes de negocio. Asimismo, asegura que será puntual con sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito. 
Con estos 3,000 nuevos soles comprará un saco de arroz, otro de azúcar y variedades de conservas que requiere en su tienda.
texts.en:
Leocadio is 33-years-old.  His spouse is Grimanesa, 30, and they have five children.  They own a grocery store they set up at home a year ago that Grimanesa runs while he’s out working his land caring for his coffee and cocoa bean plants that they’ve acquired over ten years of work.  With profits from the store they buy more products and with profits from their crops they cover household expenses.  However, even so they still need financial help so that the store can continue to grow because it’s the bigger income producer.  In time he hopes to buy glass display cases to exhibit their products so that their store will look more orderly and attractive.

This is his first MFP loan and he feels good to know that he’s obtained a loan that will help him reach his business goals.  In addition, he assures that he’ll be punctual with his installment payments because he’d like to access another loan.  He will use these 3,000 new soles to buy a sack of rice and another one of sugar plus a variety of canned goods the store needs.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Jerald

texts.en:
Jerald is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to purchase more combs, hair foods, salon towels, and hair chemicals for his shop. 

He will use the anticipated profits for the gradual expansion of his cosmetics shop. 

He hopes to be successful in this business and be able to live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase more combs, hair foods, salon towels, and hair chemicals for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beads, clothes, thread, etc. for her embroidery business.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So is a 40-year-old widowed mother of four children.  She lives with her children in Ornlong Veng district, Oddar Meanchey province. She is expert in farming practices and primarily grows rice on her existing farmland. At the same time, So operates a white wine distilling business for extra household income. She is really a business-minded woman. With the profit she earns from farming and the wine distilling business, she invests in a hog-raising business to double her income. She works honestly with her daily tasks because she has three school-aged children who still need her support.

Due to the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to pay for the operating expenses in her rice farming business and to purchase piglets for raising. In the future, So hopes to have an abundant harvest and earn a good profit from her businesses in order to support the welfare of her family and to save for their future.

loans.use: to pay for the operating expenses in rice farming business and to purchase piglets for raising.

loans.name: Meggy

texts.en:
Meggy is a 53 year-old restaurant owner in Mariakani. She is  married. She has been operating the restaurant for the past twelve years with great success. 

This is Meggy’s fourth business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to renovate her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables. She will use the anticipated profits to further expand her business.  She hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to renovate her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables

loans.name: Sarorn's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Sarorn is 54 years old and has two children. One daughter is dependent on her and helps in the family’s business. Sarorn is a teacher in the local area and she is also a rice farmer. She has been in this business for thirty years, earning about 12,300KHR but is able to save about 4,000KHR each day.

Sarorn’s group consists of four members who are all female. She and other two members have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six loan cycles while the other is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. The past loans have helped her improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy some materials to build a kitchen and also use a portion of it to buy wooden board to build house wall. She hopes this loan will enable her to complete her house’s wall and kitchen for a better living.

loans.use: To buy some materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Ankhbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Ankhbaatar, 41, operates a passenger transportation business in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For 2 years he has been running his business and he has had some regular customers. Currently he lives with his family in the old house which is in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The roof of his house has been bad and damaged for a long time.  He made repairs many times, but unfortunately it is broken again. In winter, there is too much heat loss through the bad roof. He uses a coal-fired furnace to warm his house. However, that is one of the main reasons for air pollution in Mongolian cities and all around the world. So he decided to replace his roof. It will cost about 3,000,000MNT approximately, in the market. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to repair his house roof.

loans.use: To repair his house roof.

loans.name: Antonio De Jesus

texts.es:
Antonio, es agricultor, está soltero vive con su familia, sólo le ayuda a sus padres con su trabajo, siembra maíz en los terrenos de sus padres, lo aprehendió desde joven y lo está realizando año con año.

Solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de insumos para el cultivo como lo son herbicidas, abonos, semillas mejoradas, que son necesarios para poder iniciar el trabajo, este crédito lo ayudará brindando los recursos económicos y poder realizar una buena inversión.

Su aspiración es mejorar su condición económica en la familia, aumentar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Antonio is a farmer who is single and lives with his family.  He helps his parents with their work by planting corn in their fields.  He learned when he was young and he continues working each year.

He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the cultivation such as herbicides, fertilizers, and better seeds.  These are necessary to start his work and the loan will help him obtain the economic resources to be able to develop the business.

His aspiration is to improve the family’s economic situation and to increase their productivity of their fields.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizer and better seeds

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap is a 39-year-old mother of four dependent children, two daughters and two sons. All of them are still in school. She works one hectare of farmland growing cassava and another hectare growing paddy rice.  She has been doing this for several years and is able to earn about 19,000 KHR per day. This is her fourth loan cycle with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past loans, which she completely repaid, have made a better living for her family and sufficient food in a steady manner. Now she forms a group of two members- the other member is a second-time borrower. Both of them are seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Sopheap will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to grow her cash-crops timely during the high prices for cassava so she will continue to maintain the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 43 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y agradable. Ella compró su casa junto a su esposo Raúl, de 44 años, en la que ahora viven junto a sus cuatro hijos, quienes aun están en etapa escolar.  
Ella es una mujer dedicada al agro, su mayor tiempo lo pasa en su parcela desyerbando las malezas que aquejan sus plantas. Cultiva café, cacao y frutas cítricas (naranjas, mandarinas, tanyelos). Esta labor la realiza desde hace 22 años en sus terrenos propios, y lo hace con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es la persona que la apoya en todos los trabajos de cada día para que logren mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar. En los tiempos de cosecha siempre cuentan con el apoyo de jornaleros, quienes los ayudan a que terminen de extraer los frutos de manera rápida. Seguidamente los llevan a comercializar a los centro de acopio de su comunidad, quienes gratifican a muy buenos precios según la calidad del producto.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta por contar con este apoyo financiero, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago para que en otra ocasión obtenga otro crédito. 
Con estos 2,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes naturales (abono orgánico) para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 43 years old. She is a very hard-working and friendly woman. She bought her house together with her husband, Raul, of 44 years of age. She now lives there with her four children who are still of school age.

She earns her living through agriculture and spends most of her time on her plot of land pulling out the weeds which impede her plants from growing. She grows coffee, cocoa and citrus fruits (oranges, mandarins and tangelos). She has been carrying out this work on her land for 22 years and  does so with the support of her husband, who is the person who helps her in her everyday work to try to help achieve a better quality of life  for their household. During harvest time they always have the help of day-workers who who help them finish picking the fruits quickly. Often they take them to sell at the collection centers in her community, which pay a very good price according to the quality of the product.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy that she has this financial support, and for this reason she promises to be punctual with the repayments so that she can obtain further loans in the future. With the 2,000 nuevos soles she will buy natural fertilizers (organic manure) for her crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer (organic manure) for her crops.

loans.name: Sara

texts.fr: Sara est une femme de 45ans celibataire et mère de deux enfants dont l'âge varie entre 18 et 20 ans. Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale où  elle commercialse les friandises(les frites de plantains) depuis deux ans.C'est grâce à cette activité qu'elle s'occupe de sa petite famille. La bonne qualité de ses frites lui a permis d'acquerir et de fidèliser une grande clientèle au fil du temps. Le fait d'acheter les plantains et le petit matériel pour frites en détail ne rapporte pas assez  pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter plusieurs régimes de plantains de bidons d'huile et petit matériel (plastiques) en gros. Elle reintisera une partie de ses bénéfices dans l'activité et le reste sera économisé  pour remettre sa fille à l'école.
texts.en:
Sara is a 45-year-old woman who is unmarried and the mother of two children, 18 and 20 years old. She is a merchant in a district in the capital where she has been selling sweet snacks (fried plantains) for two years. Thanks to this business, she is taking care of her small family. The good quality of her food enabled her to acquire a loyal customer base over the course of time. 

Having to purchase her plantains and frying supplies at the retail level does not bring in enough to meet the needs of her family. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to purchase wholesale several bunches of plantains, some containers of oil, and sundry items (plastic). She will reinvest part of her profits into her business, and the rest will be saved to send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy several bunches of plantains, containers of oil, and sundry items (plastic) in bulk

loans.name: Diariatou

texts.fr:
Mme Diariatou est dans le groupe depuis son inauguration le 04 décembre 2009. Elle est commerçante, comme la majorité des membres de son groupe.
Diariatou est une femme de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle fait du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter de la pâte d’arachide, de l'huile de palme et des sacs de légumes pour revendre au niveau du village. Les bénéfices de son activité aideront à la prise en charge de ses enfants pour la santé et la scolarité surtout.
texts.en:
Ms. Diariatou has been in the group since its inauguration on December 4, 2009. She is a merchant, like the majority of the members of her group.

Diariatou is a 44-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three children, including two boys. She has been in commerce for over ten years. 

With this loan, she intends to buy some peanut butter, palm oil, and sacks of vegetables to resell in the village. The profits from her business will help her to support her children in terms of healthcare and schooling costs in particular.

loans.use: to buy peanut butter, palm oil, and vegetables to sell retail

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata est membre du Banc Villageois Aminata Allé Sall depuis le 9 juillet 2011 date d'ouverture, elle est au cycle 03. Elle est âgée de 37 ans mariée elle n'a pas d'enfant;elle s'active dans le commerce de la friperie ;elle est la première femme ayant bénéficié du prêt spécial dans son BV et tisse de bonnes relations avec les autres membres.

Elle envisage de continuer le commerce de la friperie; elle s'approvisionne en général à Dakar pour revendre à Sanar à côté de l'Université Gaston Berger de Saint Louis.

Elle va acheter la friperie pour une valeur de 300000 F.

Les revenus sont recyclés pour renforcer le pouvoir d'achat; les bénéfices servent à épargner et résoudre ses besoins personnels et familiaux.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata has been a member of the Banc Villageois Aminata Allé Sall since July 19, 2011 when it opened. She is on loan cycle 3. She is 37 years old, married, and without children; she is active in the commerce of secondhand clothing; she is the first woman to benefit from special loans in her 'banc villageois' and is weaving good relations with the other members. 

She envisions continuing in the commerce of secondhand clothing; she gets her supplies in general from Dakar to resell in Sanar, next to the University of Gaston Berger de Saint Louis.

She is going to buy 300,000 francs CFA worth of used clothing. 

The revenues are recycled to bolster her purchasing power; the profits will go toward a savings account and resolving her personal needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans et mère d'un enfant . Fatou est membre du banc villageois depuis son cycle premier. Son groupe est composé de femmes issus du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales et économiques.
Elle fait du commerce par la vente de produits alimentaires depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Son nouveau crédit de 300000 elle va se payer de l'huile du sucre en poudre qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son village.
les bénéfices que génère son activité lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois et d'aider son mari dans la gestions des charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou is a married woman, 40 years old, and the mother of one child. Fatou has been a member  of the 'banc villageois' since her first loan cycle. Her group is composed of women from the same district. They are united by good social and economic relationships. She has been in business selling grocery items for a long time and has good experience in this domain. 

With the new loan of 300,000 francs, she is going to purchase oil and some powdered sugar that she will sell retail in the village. The profits generated from her business will enable her to bolster her saving account at the 'banc villageois' and to help out her husband in managing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy oil and powdered sugar to resell

loans.name: Sonia Janeth

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 37 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe, ella es una persona amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Obstetricia que tanto deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura, en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Sonia trabaja como Secretaria en una empresa constructora de su ciudad, desde tempranas horas de la mañana asistente a su centro de trabajo para iniciar sus labores; adicionalmente también trabaja vendiendo cosméticos,  ella trabaja un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Sonia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de cosméticos para su negocio, tales como: labiales, esmaltes, rubor, perfumes, entre otros; de esta manera Sonia tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, así ella espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos y así poco a poco ella seguirá esforzándose y trabajando para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sonia is a woman of 37. She is single and lives in the city of Chiclayo in the district of Guadalupe. She is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to achieve. Unfortunately, because of the need to work to help her parents and pay her expenses, she was not able to study for the career in obstetrics that she so much wanted, but she very much would have liked to be able to do it. In her free time, she likes to spend a little time reading. Sometimes she cooks a very delicious "arroz chaufa" (a Peruvian fried rice dish influenced by Chinese cuisine) to share with her family.

With great effort and enthusiasm, Sonia works every day as a secretary in a construction business in her city. From the early hours of the morning she is at her work center to begin her work. In addition, she also works selling cosmetics. She works about 8 hours a day and feels that it is going well for her because of her good effort and the friendly treatment she offers to others.

Sonia is very appreciative of the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they offer she will be able to make the purchase of cosmetics for her business, such as lipsticks, nail polish, blush, and perfumes, among other items. In this way Sonia will have her business better stocked. Thus she hopes to be able to increase her sales and her business income, and thus little by little she will continue exerting herself and working to achieve her great dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en: Suha is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has a few goats that she uses to get milk and make some dairy products like yogurt and cheese for sale in order to help her husband in paying some household bills. She has applied for this loan in order to get more goats and buy some tools that can make her production process easier.

loans.use: to get more goats

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es: Florentino tiene 54 años y desde hace más de 3 décadas se dedica a la producción de café como lo han hecho la mayoría de los integrantes de su familia. En la comunidad en la que vive no cuenta con todos los servicios ya que el agua la tienen que jalar de un pozo pues no hay agua potable. A pesar de las dificultades Florentino siempre se muestra optimista pues ha sabido trabajar muy bien el café y ha obtenido muy buenos resultados con créditos anteriores. El proyecto más próximo que Florentino tiene pensado llevar a cabo es la realización de un vivero de planta de café la cual le servirá para sembrar en sus fincas y además la podrá vender a otros productores de la región en la que vive. También va a comenzar a cambiar su producción de café convencional a orgánico y por estas razones está solicitando un crédito, ya que de otra manera le sería imposible cumplir las metas que se ha propuesto. Durante la última cosecha tuvo una producción de 15 toneladas y en un lapso 3 años espera llegar a producir 20 toneladas. Florentino también nos platicó que una de las cosas que le gustaría realizar al final de la cosecha es hacerle unas mejoras a su casa ya que hay algunos detalles que le hace falta terminar.
texts.en: Florentino is 54 and like most of his family works in the coffee industry. He has been working as a coffee producer for more than 30 years. The community where he lives does not have basic services; water has to be brought up from a well and there is not potable water. Despite all difficulties Florentino has remained optimistic because he is an expert coffee grower and has obtained very good results from previous loans. Florentino's current project is to build a coffee tree nursery, which will provide him with the trees to plant on his farms as well as allow him to sell trees to other growers in his region. He is also beginning the transition from conventional growing methods to organic farming. Without a loan he would not be able to reach his proposed goals. Last year's harvest brought in 15 tons of coffee and within three years he plans to produce 20 tons. Florentino also noted that after the harvest this year he would like to make some home improvements as there are some projects around his home that he would like to finish.

loans.use: build a coffee nursery

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru:
Илхомчон проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 19 лет. Илхомчон холост. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его мать работает в аптеке. Сам Илхомчон уже год как занимается купле-продажей сухофруктов. Илхомчон занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города. 
Илхомчон просит кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Ilhomjon lives in the town of Isfara. He is 19 years old. He is single and lives together with his parents. His mother works in a pharmacy. Ilhomjon has been buying and reselling dried fruits. He works as a vendor at the central market of his town.

Ilhomjon is requesting a loan in order to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells bowls and clothes in Ayensudu, near Elmina. Ekua has received education through middle school. She is married to a driver and has four children. Ekua has been selling bowls and clothes for five years. She is responsible for helping to pay for her grandchildren's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bowls and clothes in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bowls and clothes in bulk

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sophal, 52, has seven children in total. Six of them are staying with the family and some are still in school. Sophal and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for ten years to make a living and the main challenge for her family’s business is the lack of water. 

Sophal has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now requesting a loan of US $1,000, she will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice paddy and also use a portion of it to spend for labor and gasoline to carry water into the rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice in a healthy way and also hopes to make more rice to improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 49 años, tiene dos hijos, de 18 y 15 años. Juntos habitan en una casa sencilla, pero propia construida en una comunidad nativa de la selva central.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde joven, ahora cultiva café en cuatro parcelas y achiote en dos. Prioriza estos productos porque los considera más rentables, pues también produce plátano y naranjas, pero las ganancias de éstos la ayudan solo para algunos gastos extras. Por la experiencia que tiene ya sabe cómo y dónde vender su producción, tiene contactos en los centros de acopio, a quienes provee de café y achiote inmediatamente después de las cosechas. “No me hago problemas, ya llevo como 6 años con esta rutina y me va bien”, menciona. Como le iba bien, hace 3 años empezó a arrendar otras tierras para aumentar su producción, y es lo que piensa seguir haciendo en estos años.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP. Ella es muy fiel a la entidad, por eso está agradecida por la ayuda que le han dado en tantos años. Pertenece al banco comunal “Flor de Almendra” y se siente contenta de participar en un grupo sólido y responsable.
Victoria invertirá estos 2000 soles en la compra de viveros de café para plantarlos en reemplazo de las plantas viejas, también comprará bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Victoria is 49 years old and has two sons who are 18 and 15 years old. Together, they live in a simple house they own, built in a native community in the central jungle. 

She has been working in agriculture since she was young. Now she grows coffee in four plots and annattos in two. She prioritizes these products because she believes they are the most profitable. She also produces bananas and oranges, but the profits only help for some extras. 

Due to her experience, she knows how and where to sell her production. She has contacts in some collection centers where she provides coffee and annattos immediately after the harvest. "I have no problems, it's been about six years with this routine and I do well", she says. Because she was doing well, three years ago she started to lease other lands to increase her production, and that's what she expects to keep doing in the next years. 

This is her credit number seven with MFP. She is very loyal to the organization, so she is grateful for the help they have given her all these years. She is a member of the communal bank "Flor de Almendra" and she is happy to participate in a strong and responsible group. 

Victoria will invest these 2,000 soles in buyin nursery coffee to replace the old plants, and she will also buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy nursery coffee to replace the old plants, and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Azizmad

texts.ru:
Азизмад родился 1974 году в районе Хамадони. Он самостоятельный и хороший человек. Азизмад женат. У него пятеро детей. Жена Азизмада домохозяйка. 
Азизмад в основном занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Летом Азизмад занимается торговлей дыни и арбуза. Этот вид деятельности является сезонным. Торговлей Азизмад занимается уже два года. 
Азизмад просит кредит для покупки дыни и арбуза.
texts.en:
Azizmad was born in 1974 in the Hamadoni Region. He is a self-reliant and decent person. Azizmad is married. He has five children. His wife is a homemaker.

Azizmad mainly sells fruits and vegetables. In the summertime, Azizmad sells melons and watermelons. This is a seasonal activity. HE has been working as a vendor for two years. Azizmad is requesting a credit in order to buy melons and watermelons.

loans.use: to buy melons and watermelons.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 37 años, su pareja es Emilio, con quien tiene seis hijos. Ella y su familia viven en una casita rústica que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo en su comunidad nativa.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, con la producción de café, kión, plátano y cacao. Tiene cinco parcelas de terrenos en las que cultiva estos productos. Lleva como 20 años en esta actividad y menciona que tuvo que pasar diferentes inconvenientes, uno de ellos fue la falta de capital para iniciar sus primeras siembras. Ahora puede estar segura que con trabajo esmerado puede lograr lo que ella se propone. Cada vez que cosecha traslada sus productos hacia los mercados de la ciudad que está a 70 minutos de su localidad. “No siempre los precios son favorables, pero seguimos produciendo”, menciona optimista. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por ello promete que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas y responsable dentro de su banco comunal “Las Kioneras”, cuyas socias son mujeres trabajadoras.
Invertirá estos 1000 soles en el pago de los peones que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos de café, kión y cacao. Gastará como 300 soles por cada una de esas tres parcelas.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old. Her partner is Emilio, with whom she has six children. She and her family live in a rustic little house that they built with great effort in their native community.

She works in agriculture, in the production of coffee, ginger, bananas, and cocoa. She has five parcels of land on which she grows these products. She has been doing this for about 20 years and comments that she had to overcome various problems. One of them was the lack of capital to begin her first plantings. Now she can be sure that with conscientious work she can achieve what she sets out to do. Every time she harvests, she transports her products to the markets of the city that is 70 minutes from her town. "The prices aren't always favorable, but we continue producing," she comments optimistically.

This is her first loan with MFP, and so she promises that she will be punctual in making her payments and responsible within her communal bank, "Los Kioneras," whose members are hardworking women. 

She will invest these 1000 PEN in paying the workers whom she will hire to clean her coffee, ginger, and cocoa fields. She will spend about 300 PEN for each one of these three fields.

loans.use: to pay the laborers whom she will hire to clean her coffee, ginger, and cocoa fields. She will spend about 300 PEN for each of these three parcels of land.

loans.name: Khaleda

texts.en:
Khaleda is a 44-year-old married woman. She has four children (three daughters and a son), two of whom are married.

Khaleda has a sewing machine at home that she uses to tailor different models of curtains. Her clients bring her the fabric and tell her what design it is that they wish her to make.

She is applying for a 1000 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank to buy supplies for her curtain business. She hopes to see it grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her curtain business.

loans.name: Emprendedores Lord Cochrane Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Emprendedores Lord Cochrane” está conformado por  18 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, trabajos en vidrio, bazar, almacén, venta de pañuelos, venta de perfumes, venta de cremas de caracol, venta de yerbas medicinales, tejido artesanal, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Margarita, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón de color negro, lleva puesto una chaqueta de color café y en sus piernas sostiene una cartera de color negra, su cabello es de color oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de bazar surtido, como artesanía, tabaquería, prendas de vestir, esoterismo, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a sábado y a veces los domingos cuando las ferias tienen  más movimientos de gente, su horario de trabajo es de 10ºº hasta las 21ºº horas.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará carteras, inciensos, pañuelos, tabaco, carteras, aros, para abastecer su bazar.
Sus metas son continuar con su negocio y tener la posibilidad de tener un puesto estable para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Margarita vive con sus 2 hijos de 23 años de edad quien se prepara para entrar a servicio militar y de 19 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener una casa propia, para vivir con tranquilidad y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Emprendedores Lord Cochrane".  It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who make a living in the commerce sector. Specifically, clothing sales, glasswork, bazaars, stores, scarves, perfumes, spiral creams, herbal medicines, hand weaving, and other services.  All of the entrepreneurs are residents of the city of Valparaiso.  

Margarita, head of the communal bank group, is seen sitting in the first row on the right in the picture above.  She is wearing black pants and has a brown coat while holding a black purse on her legs. She has been making a living in a bazaar stocking crafts, tobacco, garments, and esoteric items for the last three years.  She works Monday through Saturday and sometimes on Sundays when festivals cause more traffic.  Her work schedule is from 10am to 9pm.  

She usually purchases her merchandise in Santiago at a low price therefore being economically desirable.  With this loan she will purchase purses, incense, scarves, tobacco, and scarves for her bazaar. Her goals are to continue her business and have the possibility to own a stable spot in order to generate more revenue and this way have a better quality of life.  

Margarita lives with her two children.  One is 23 years old and is preparing to enter military service.  The other is 19 years old and is a student.  Her family goals are to have her own place to live in peace and give her sons the best.  

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity brought to her by Fondo Esperanza as it permits her to invest in her business.  She mentions that the training has been fundamental to her business and to her personal development now that she has learned to organize and distribute her revenues and investments in the best fashion.  

Valparaiso is located 120 kilometers Northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and also host of the country's legislature.  It is the nation's first port and offers a variety of landmarks both beautiful and picturesque.  For example, the house of Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize, is located here.

loans.use: to purchase purses, incense, scarves, tobacco, and scarves for her bazaar.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 25, lives with her husband and four children in a village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district in Cambodia. Her children, two daughters and two sons, are in school. To make a living, Channy and her husband have been farming rice for almost ten years as well as raising chickens to sell.

Channy has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two loan cycles and has completely paid back these loans. With them she has managed to improve her family’s living standards and send her children to school.

Presently, Channy can earn about 27,800 KHR a day from her farming. She is requesting another loan of 2,000,000 KHR from VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her rice paddy and feed for her chickens. She hopes to continue improving her family members’ lives.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chicken feed.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy additional processed meat needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and the family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan, which she will be utilizing to buy more frozen food products. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Victoria hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of giving her children a high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional processed meat to stock her store

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 40 años, se encuentra felizmente casado, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Mecánica que tanto quería, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de su Padre, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Jorge trabaja como chofer taxi, desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor recorriendo las calles de la ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, él labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde en encontrar clientes y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.    
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción y el mejoramiento de su auto; de esta manera Jorge tendrá su auto en buenas condiciones para poder seguir trabajando, así espera poder seguir brindando sus servicios e incrementando sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para asegurar la educación y bienestar de su pequeño.
texts.en:
Jorge is a man of 40. He is happily married and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with his wife and their little son. He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his efforts to raising his family. Unfortunately, because of the need to work to pay his expenses, he was not able to study for a career as a mechanic, which he so much wanted, but he very much would have liked to do it. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors, and on occasion he cooks a very delicious "carapulcra and dry soup" (a traditional Peruvian dish made from pork, dried potatoes, noodles, and vegetables) to share with his family.

Thanks to the help of his father, and with great effort and enthusiasm, Jorge works day by day as a taxi driver. From the early hours of the morning he begins his work driving through the streets of the city looking for passengers. He works about 10 hours a day and feels that it is going well for him because he know the areas to find customers and because of the kind treatment he offers to others.

Jorge is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered he will be able to refurbish and improve his car. In this way, Jorge will have his car in good condition to be able to continue working. Thus he hopes to be able to continue offering his services and increasing his income, which will be of great help to him to assure the education and well being of his little one.

loans.use: to refurbish and improve his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic goods (boxes of detergents, cigarettes, cookies, candy)

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia tiene 21 años, vive en la casa que le heredó su padre, junto a su pareja, Cristian de 24 años, y su pequeño hijo Marlo, de 4 añitos.  
Ella es una joven laboriosa, desde que formó su familia se dedica a labrar la tierra, donde cultiva hoja de coca y café. Esta labor la empezó desde muy pequeña, pero lleva 4 años haciéndolo independientemente en su propia chacra, trabaja junto a su pareja, quien se encarga de fumigar las plantas para que los mosquitos o gusanos no las dañen. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, por eso siempre está en busca de mejorar cada día. Sin embargo, lo que le es difícil es caminar desde su casa hasta su parcela llevando el almuerzo, ya que tiene que hacerlo con su hijo durante 40 minutos, por eso, para el futuro, desea comprar una movilidad. Por eso está pendiente de sus cultivos, porque gracias a las ganancias de sus cosechas podrá hacer su sueño realidad.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece a todas las personas que lo hacen posible, quienes confían en su trabajo y sobre todo en su palabra de ser puntual en sus pagos.
Con estos 1,500 nuevos soles comprará dos sacos de abono orgánico, con el resto contratará a un peón para que les ayude en los trabajos en su chacra.
texts.en:
Olimpia is 21 years old. She lives in the house that she inherited from her father, along with her partner, 24 year old Cristian, and their small son Marlo, who is 4 years old. 

She is an industrious young women; since she started her family, she has worked cultivating the land. She grows coca leaves and coffee. She has been doing this work since she was very young, but for 4 years, she has been doing it independently on her own farm. She works together with her partner, who is in charge of fumigating the plants so that the mosquitoes or caterpillars don’t damage them. 

She likes her work a lot; therefore, she looks to improve upon it every day. However, it is difficult for her to walk from her house to her plot of land carrying her lunch, since she has to do this with her son in 40 minutes. Because of this, in the future she wishes to buy a means of transportation. She is dependent on her crops, because thanks to the earnings from her harvest, she will be able to make her dream a reality. 

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is grateful to all the people who made it possible, and who trusted in her work and above all in her word on being timely with her payments. 

With the 1,500 nuevos soles she will purchase two sacks of organic fertilizer; with the rest, she will hire a laborer to help them with their farm work.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of organic fertilizer; with the rest, she will hire a laborer to help with the farm work.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 27 años, su pareja es Enrique, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, de 11, 8, 5 años y un pequeño de 8 meses de nacido. Ella y su familia habitan una casa rústica en una comunidad nativa.
Hace 5 años que ella trabaja produciendo kión, café, maíz, yucas y plátanos. En total tiene como cinco parcelas, y gracias a la variedad de sus productos puede estar segura de obtener ganancias en cada fecha del año. “Me gusta producir kiones, es cansado pero los precios son buenos, no bajan mucho como el café”, menciona. Por esa razón este año también iniciará una siembra; por otro lado, cuidará de su cafetal y de las yucas, abonará el plátano que cada quince días recoge. Le gusta la vida del campo, se siente libre y contenta con sus resultados. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, está entusiasmada de trabajar en grupo y le agrada la compañía de sus socias porque comparten los mismos intereses.
Nelly invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de varios kilos de semillas de kión y tres bolsas de fertilizantes naturales para iniciar otra siembra que cosechará el próximo año.
texts.en: Nelly is 27 years old and married to Enrique, with whom she has four children, ages 11, 8, 5 and 8 months. She and her family live in a cottage in a native community. About five years ago she started growing ginger, coffee, corn, cassava and bananas. In all, she has five plots of land, and thanks to the variety of her products she is assured of earning year-round income. "I like growing ginger. It's tiresome but the prices are good; they don't drop as much as coffee," she said. It's for this reason that she will plant another crop this year, while also caring for her coffee and cassava crops, and fertilizing her bananas, which she picks every 15 days. She enjoys living in the country; she feels free and is happy with her results. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is enthusiastic about working in a group and welcomes the company of her fellow bank members who share the same interests. Nelly plans to use the loan to purchase a number of pounds of ginger seeds and three bags of fertilizer to start another planting cycle that she will harvest next year.

loans.use: to purchase pounds of ginger seeds and three bags of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Christine Florence

texts.fr: Florence est une femme mariée de 38 ans en séparation sans enfants, mais ayant 4 personnes à sa charge. elle est commerçante et a ouvert un petit restaurant dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 01 an. c'est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille depuis sa séparation avec son époux. c'est une activité qui rapporte souvent mais elle ne s'en sort pas assez parce qu'elle achète le poisson et les boissons en détail pour cause son capital n'est pas important. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter ses stocks en achetant en gros son poisson et ses boissons (20 casiers de boissons et 10 kg de poissons). Elle aidera sa famille avec une partie de ces bénéfices et le reste sera réinvesti dans l'activité.
texts.en:
Florence is married woman, 38 years old, separated, and without children, but she has four persons to support. She is a businesswoman and has opened a small restaurant in a district in the capital a year ago. This business is what enables her to meet her needs and those of her family since her separation from her husband. 

Her business often makes money, but she doesn't make enough because she purchases fish and beverages at the retail level, since her capital is not significant. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to increase her inventory by buying her fish and beverages wholesale (20 cases of drinks and 10 kg of fish). She will help her family with part of the profits, and the rest will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy 20 cases of beverages and 10 kg of fish for her restaurant

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal vive en una colonia muy pablada de Nuevo Laredo, es soltero y cuenta con un pequeño negocio de abarrotes, al cual quiere surtir ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga mas variedad de mercancía  ya que es la única tiendita que esta en la colonia y así satisfacer las necesidades que tiene su clientela.
Con este préstamo su negocio tendrá más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Vidal lives in a very crowded area of Nuevo Laredo. He is single and has a small convenience store, which he wants to stock since it doesn't have much variety and his customers are requesting more merchandise. It is the only store in his area, so he wants to meet his customers' needs. With this loan he will able to earn more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est âgée de 30ans. Elle a un enfant de 04ans qui va à l’école. Afin d’aider son conjoint gendarme dans les charges du foyer, elle vend depuis 2000 des bijoux au marché et s’approvisionne à Lomé et à Cotonou. Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour s’approvisionner en marchandises (bijoux). Elle veut assurer les besoins de la famille et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en: Akou is 30 years old and has a 4-year-old child, who goes to school. To help her spouse, a policeman, to cover household expenses, she has been selling jewelry at the market since 2000. She gets her supplies from Lomé and from Cotonou. She is requesting this second loan to stock up on merchandise (jewelry). She wants to ensure that her family's needs are met and to sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El señor Abraham solicita el préstamo para realizar un mejoramiento a su vivienda que es poner un techo en el patio trasero de su casa, para protegerse de las inclemencias del tiempo. 
Don Abraham trabaja en una empresa desde hace más de cinco años como guardia de seguridad, es originario del estado de pueblo, pero ya tiene mas de ocho años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Es propietario de su vivienda y desea seguir realizando mejoras a su vivienda para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Abraham is requesting a loan to make an improvement on his home: putting in a roof over the back patio of his house in order to protect it from inclement weather. 

Abraham has worked in a business for more than five years as a security guard. He is a native of the state of Puebla, but he has lived for more than eight years in the city of Nuevo Laredo. He is the owner of his home, and he hopes to continue making improvements on his house in order to make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to install a wood roof over his back patio.

loans.name: Amowassino

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de mercerie dans une boutique,  Amowassino mère âgée de 37ans à 04 enfants. Trois vont à l’école et ils sont âgés de 11,08, 6 et 1an. Son conjoint est tailleur. Elle exerce seule son activité et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Afin d’augmenter son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un quatrième prêt pour acheter des articles de mercerie. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, assurer sa pérennité et le bien être de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of sewing supplies in a store,  Amowassino is a 37-year-old mother who has four children. Three of the children go to school, and they are 1, 6, 8 and 11 years old. Her husband is a tailor. She operates her business by herself and gets her supplies from Lomé. To increase her inventory, she is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES to buy some sewing supplies. She wants to reinvest in her business, ensure it is sustained, and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Ayant pour conjoint un  magasinier, Amavi née en 1975 est revendeuse. C’est en 2000, qu’elle s’est lancée dans cette activité (vente de tissus et des produits d’alimentaires). Elle le fait à domicile et dans un marché de la place.  Avec ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle va s’approvisionner en marchandises pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Avec le profit réalisé, elle veut stocker plus de tissus.
texts.en: Having a warehouse keeper as her spouse, Amavi was born in 1975 and is a retailer. In 2000, she got started in this business (selling cloth and grocery items). She operates in her home and at a local market. With this second loan she is requesting, she is going to stock up on merchandise to respond better to the needs of her customers. With the profits earned, she wants to stock up on more cloth.

loans.use: to buy cloth and grocery items

loans.name: Estha

texts.fr: Estha habite à Lomé avec son mari et ses 2 enfants de 12 et 9 ans, tous les deux scolarisés. Son mari exerce la profession de mécanicien auto. Estha est quant à elle revendeuse d'alimentation générale. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 13 ans au marché. Estha sollicite pour la première fois un crédit chez Wages toujours dans le but d'augmenter son stock. Ses profits lui permettront de réinvestir dans l'activité. Elle espère pouvoir un jour construire une habitation et prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en: Estha lives in Lomé with her husband and her two children, 9 and 12 years old, who are both in school. Her husband works as an auto mechanic by trade. Estha herself is retailer of grocery items. She has been in this business for thirteen years at the market. She is requesting a loan from WAGES for the first time still with the goal of increasing her inventory. Her profits will enable her to reinvest in her business. She hopes to be able to build a house one day and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned tomatoes and a variety of other goods to sell

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr: Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille et rendre son activité pérenne, Mr Kossivi revendeur d'articles de mercerie sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. C'est depuis 2000 qu'il exerce l'activité dans une boutique. Il est marié à une pâtissière et ont ensemble 02 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 09ans et le dernier 06ans. Il veut devenir grossiste et construire une maison pour y habiter.
texts.en: To meet the needs of his family and to sustain his business, Mr. Kossivi, a retailer of sewing supplies, is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. He has been operating in a store since 2000. He is married to a pastry chef, and together they have two children, both in school. The oldest child is 9 years old, and the last is 6. Mr. Kossivi wants to become a wholesaler and build a house in which to live.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies to sell in his store

loans.name: Concordia Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento CONCORDIA Está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete  mujeres  y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  María  tiene 46 años casada con cinco que ya son independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que realiza todos los días en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una de las calles Más concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba preparando y ofreciendo a su clientela platos variados, La mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia la misma que  desarrolla conjuntamente con una empleada quien le ayuda a preparar y también atender a sus clientes, el destino del crédito es para la compra por mayor de insumos (papa, arroz, fideo y otros) para lograr tener una despensa llena,  la Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad de la venta de comida está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos mantienen solas a su familias.
texts.en: The Concordia community bank consists of nine members - seven women and two men. The bank president is María, a 46-year-old married mother of five children who are all full-grown. She makes a living selling food, which she does every day from a sales post on one of the busiest streets in the city of Cochabamba, preparing and offering her customers a variety of dishes.
