She says that the work is the main source of income for her and her family, which along with an employee helps prepare the food and tend to customers. She plans to use the loan to purchase wholesale ingredients (potatoes, rice, noodles and other items) so she has a full pantry. María is a very hard working person who has years of experience selling food and is very grateful for the support being provided to her and her fellow bank members, since many of them are the sole providers for their families.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale ingredients (potatoes, rice, noodles and other items)

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 23 años, su pareja es Gimena, de 21 años, tienen un hijo de 3 años, y actualmente viven en la casa de unos tíos de él.
Sergio produce café, cacao y frutas. Esta labor la realiza hace más de 2 años, en su propio terreno agrícola, Normalmente lo hace solo, pero en los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de amigos jornaleros quienes ayudan extraer de manera rápida los frutos de cada cultivo. Para él, su trabajo es muy fácil, ya que gracias al buen cuidado que le brinda llega a obtener una buena calidad; sin embrago, lo que no le gusta es usar muchos químicos, ya que corre el riesgo de contaminarse, por ello prefiere usar abono natural.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, una vez más agradece el apoyo que le brindan para que siga logrando su objetivo de trabajo.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará abono orgánico para sus plantas.
texts.en:
Sergio is 23 years old, and his partner, Gimena, is 21 years old. They have a child of three years and currently live together in the house of one of Sergio's aunt and uncle. Sergio grows coffee, cacao, and fruits. He has been doing this work for over two years, on his own farming land. Normally Sergio works alone, but during the harvest season he relies on the help of day laborer friends who assist in quickly picking the fruits for each harvest. For him, the work is easy because--thanks to the great care with which he tends his crop--he is able to obtain a high level of quality. He does not like to use a lot of chemicals, however, because he then runs the risk of contamination. For this reason he prefers to use natural fertilizer. 

This is Sergio's second loan with MFP. Once again he is grateful for the help that has been provided so that he can continue achieving his work goal. This loan of 1,500 nuevos soles will help him to buy organic fertilizer for his plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his plants.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe / Ngrk Group

texts.fr:
Claudine fait partie du groupe Abishyizehmwe / Ngrk. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les unis». Elle a 37 ans, elle est mariée avec 5 enfants de 7 ans à 15 ans, dont 5 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Claudine est agriculteur des maniocs. C’est son Premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des tomates, elle planifie de demander d’autres crédits pour augmenter la capacité de son agriculture des tomates. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être un grand fournisseur des tomates dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Claudine is part of the group Abishyizehmwe / Ngrk. The group's name means "They who are united". She is 23 years old and married, and she has five children, from 7 to 15 years old, all of whom are in school. She has six years of secondary education. 

Claudine is a cassava farmer. This loan cycle is her first one with the microfinance institution ACB. She is going to use his loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor. 

To expand her tomato farming, she plans to ask for more loans to increase her farm capacity. In the coming years, she would like to be a major supplier of tomatoes in her region. With the profits, she plans on covering her children's school and medical costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: As a married parent of 3 children, Habiba works hard to support her family. She has a clothes sales business in Tajikistan, which she has had for 9 years. She sells women’s and men’s clothes. Her elder son helps her with the business. Habiba has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from Imon International organization. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, Habiba hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her children. She is asking for a loan to buy a new variety of clothes to widen her assortment. She awaits your support. Please, help her if it possible because her husband, Tohir, can’t help Habiba with the money and you are the only one who can support her.

loans.use: To buy a new variety of clothes to widen her assortment

loans.name: Wardeh

texts.en:
Wardeh is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Wardeh is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of two kids. Her husband is a driver. After having her kids she started a small business at home selling kids’ clothing items, which she found is a good business for her. With just showing a few of what she has, Wardeh wishes to take a loan to add a new collection for different ages so she can one day open her own clothing store.

loans.use: to add a new collection for different ages

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a conservative woman, so she asked her oldest daughter to take her place in the photo.

Basma is an independent married woman and the mother of three. She runs a small beauty salon of her own that she wants to enhance. So she has applied for this loan to buy some beauty products and new equipment that will help in improving the services she offers.

loans.use: to buy some beauty products

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Cheng has been in rice farming for over 10 years and she has enough skills to ensure a fruitful harvest each season. She is pursuing this occupation in order to provide her family’s daily sustenance, pay for commodity costs and the allowances for her school-aged child. 

She also pays additional laborers, who help her in doing the farm work on her plantation. Cheng has four children; three of them are already married and only her last-born child is still attending school.

Cheng aims to maintain her rice production and make improvements to her business. This is why she is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to hire a few laborers to transplant rice, purchase lubricant oil for the maintenance of her plowing machine and also to purchase pesticides to use on her rice crops. 

She would be grateful to Kiva lenders if this was granted, to enable her to enhance her crop production.

loans.use: to hire a few laborers to transplant rice, purchase lubricant oil for the maintenance of her plowing machine and also to purchase pesticides to use on her rice crops.

loans.name: Sam Ath's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province, Sam Ath is a mother of three children (one daughter and two sons) who are currently under her care as they are still in school. To cover the family's basic daily needs, Sam Ath has been managing an area of one and a half hectares to grow cassava, about three and a half hectares to grow cashews, and another hectare of farmland to grow rice paddies in order to earn a living. However, her main challenge is the significantly dwindled price of cassava. 

Sam Ath's group consists of five members. She is the group leader. Sam Ath and two of her members are in their third loan cycle while the remaining two members are in their first loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She leads this group to seek a new loan. For her loan portion, Sam Ath will buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide for her farmland, while a portion of it will be used to pay for labor costs. She hopes to double her profit so that she can maintain her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Jihan

texts.en: Jihan is a 19-year-old single lady who attends a college to get a diploma degree. She is the oldest of five siblings. She wishes to get her diploma then continue by applying to a university to get a BA degree. For now she has applied for this loan in order to pay for her upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 52-year-old widow, who is living with her two sons. 

To be able to support herself, she opened a mini-market, which sells mainly snacks. Now she wants to support her business with more food products and goods. She has therefore applied for this loan in order to fulfill her wishes.

loans.use: to support her business with more food products and goods

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is continuing with his watch repairing and selling business. He likes his occupation very much and he has followed his vocation for a quarter of a century. Thanks to his business, Hamlet is able to provide for his family. 

Hamlet used his second Kiva loan to buy watches, spare parts and other necessary materials for his business. 

Now he is seeking a 600,000 AMD loan to buy different types of watches, crystals for watches and spare parts for his business.

loans.use: to buy different types of watches, crystals for watches and spare parts for his business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has three children. She received schooling through to middle school. 

Elizabeth has sold clothes in Ayensudu, near Elmina, for five years. Her husband is a farmer. 

Elizabeth uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase clothes in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to continue to care for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Hasna

texts.en:
Hasna is a 47-year-old married woman. She helps her husband in supporting their six sons and daughters by running her mini-market, which serves the people in the neighborhood. 

Being the second source of income for the family made her want to increase it. She has therefore applied for this loan to add more goods to the store. This will help her achieve her target.

loans.use: to add more goods to the store

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a 30-year-old married woman who has no kids. She has recently started a small business selling blankets at home. She only bought a few to start with and found it a good business to do while she is at home. She has applied for this loan to increase the quantity she has of blankets and bed covers to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and bed covers

loans.name: ِayat

texts.en:
Ayat is a university student majoring in French language. She is still in her first year. 

Being one of five siblings at home, she decided to support her own studies to relieve some stress from her parents. She has therefore applied for this loan so she can pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is single and has two children. 

She sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. She has done this for the past seven years. 

Esi uses her income to take care of herself; paying all household and other expenses. She is 70 years old. 

Esi will use the loan to purchase maize for the production of kenkey. With the new profits, Esi plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize for the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.en:
Zokirjon is a 47 year-old man, who is married to a lovely woman called Zuhro. He is the father of four children. All of the children are already in school and university.

He has been busy making furniture and selling it at a local market for 15 years. Thanks to his many years of experience in this area, he is able to obtain goods to sell but it brings in little income. 

He wants to develop his business and therefore earn more income to provide his family with better quality living conditions. He will also pay for his son’s university studies with the profits. 

He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy wood to make furniture. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a hardworking young man, who works in a supermarket to support himself. He is also a university student majoring in Industrial Engineering. 

Murad wishes to take this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees, which will get him a step closer to graduation and finding a suitable job in his field of study.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Norm's Group

texts.en:
Norm is 34 years old and lives in a rural area of the Kror kor district of Pursat province. She is married with two sons and one daughter who all are under school age. She makes a living through farming rice on one hectare of farmland and her husband is a palm juice maker. They have been in this business for several years. They can earn about 15,000 KHR per day to support her family. Low crop yield due to drought is the main challenge for her business.

Norm has been with VisionFund for two cycles while her group members are just with VisionFund this cycle. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her support her family better. Now leading her group of three to request a loan with VisonFund, Norm, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to gain more income from the business in order to improve her standard of living and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Han is a 48-year-old widowed mother of seven children, two (one daughter and one son) of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has struggled to feed her children by growing rice and working as a paid worker in a local area for several years to support her family. Drought is the main challenge for her current business. 
 
Han's group consists of three members and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully paid back the past loans, which have enabled her to have a better standard of living. The current business earns her about KHR 20,000 per day to meet her family’s needs. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Han, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor costs. She hopes to gain more income from the crop yield in order to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Besim

texts.en:
Besim is a married man from Kosovo. He has been selling electrical equipment for more than twenty years, specifically electrical boxes to stabilize electricity. 

In Kosovo, electricity is often a problem as power outages and surges are common, and people can be without electricity in extreme conditions, such as cold, snowy winters and very hot summers, for hours or even a day at a time. 

Besim is asking for a loan in order to buy more electrical boxes to stabilize electricity for people, as both the need and demand for these boxes are great. 

The increased sales will generate a reserve for Besim to eventually start his own business, which is his goal.

He is very happy for this support, and he very much appreciates all KIVA lenders!

loans.use: to buy more electrical boxes to stabilize electricity.

loans.name: Thouy's Group

texts.en:
Aged 43 years old, Thouy has nine children. Four (two daughter and two sons) of her children are dependent on her and still in school. She has been in rice farming on four hectares of farmland and raising chickens for almost 30 years, while her husband is a palm juice maker to earn additional income. Together they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Low crop yield due to a lack of water is the main challenge for her business. 

This is the fourth loan for Thouy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans to support her children’s education. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Thouy, who is the group leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor. She hopes to earn more income from the crop yield and sell it for a good price in order to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has three children. Efua sells sandals in Ayensudu, near Elmina, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a carpenter. Efua uses her income to pay her children's school fees. Efua will use the loan to purchase sandals to sell. With her new profits, Efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sandals to sell

loans.name: Ercilio

texts.es:
Ercilio tiene 47 años, está casado con María, de 53 años, y tienen dos hijos. Viven en la casa que compró hace 10 años con el esfuerzo diario que realizaba en su trabajo. 
Hace 6 años abrió una tienda de abarrotes donde labora su esposa, mientras él se va a la chacra a ver sus cultivos de cacao y café. Todas las mañanas Ercilio y su esposa se levantan muy temprano para abrir las puertas de su negocio y empezar con la limpieza y la atención a los primeros clientes, ya que en su localidad la gente es muy madrugadora y necesitan hacer sus compras desde muy temprano. Él no se conforma al tener que comprar sus productos poco a poco, pues gracias a los préstamos obtenidos puede comprar su mercadería al por mayor.

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP y agradece por la confianza que le brindan, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago, como en los anteriores créditos.
Con los 2,500 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, verduras y otros productos para su tienda.
texts.en:
Ercilio, 47, is married to María, 53, and they have two chidren.  They live in the house he bought ten years ago through the daily effort he put in at work.

Six years ago he decided to open a grocery store where his wife works while he takes care of the cocoa and coffee plantations.  Every morning, Ercilio and his wife get up early to open the doors to their business and start cleaning and getting ready for the first customers, since people in their town are early risers and they must do their shopping very early.  He does not conform to purchasing his products little by little, but rather buys them wholesale thanks to the loans he has received.

This is his 14th loan through MFP and he is grateful for the confidence placed in him and committed to paying it back on time, as with previous loans.

The 2,500 PEN loan will be used to buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, vegetables and other products for his store.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, vegetables and other products for his store.

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
Eudosia tiene 62 años, es viuda. Actualmente vive en compañía de su hijo Edson de 33 años, quien la apoya en todo.
Ella es una mujer muy activa, siempre está al pendiente de sus plantas de cacao, café, hoja de coca, palillo y raíces de barbasco. Esta labor la realiza hace 40 años, antes contaba con el apoyo de su esposo, pero ahora lo hace con su hijo; mas en los tiempos que cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros para que de esa manera logren terminar de manera rápida. Después de la cosecha realiza el secado y luego de haber culminado con ese proceso lo lleva comercializar a los centros de acopio donde le remuneran buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de sus productos.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que trabaja con personas que apoyan a su necesidad. Asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago como en los anteriores préstamos que obtuvo. 
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles Eudosia comprará abono y otros fertilizantes para las plantas que ahora tiene en su parcela.
texts.en:
Eudosia, 62, is a widow who currently lives with her son, Edson, 33, who supports her in everything.  She is a very active woman who is always caring for her plantations of cocoa, coffee, coca leaves, mullein branches and roots.  She has been in this line of work for 40 years and used to have her husband's support, but now it is her son who helps her.  At harvest time she also has hired workers to help so she can finish the work sooner.  After harvest she does the drying and then takes her produce to collection centers where she earns a good profit for every kilogram of product.

This is her sixth loan through MFP and she likes being a part of her communal bank, since she works with people who support her.  She is also committed to paying back the loan on time, as with her previous loans.

With the 1,000 PEN, Endosia will buy fertilizer for her plantations.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Tacko

texts.fr: Madame TACKO est une femme mariée qui vit au SENEGAL. C’est une enseignante qui évolue depuis 2007 dans le secteur de l’éducation. Elle est soutient de famille et assiste ses enfants dans le domaine de leur nourriture quotidienne, et le règlement de leurs frais de scolarité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation. Elle y a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs.  Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 FCFA prévu pour appuyer un de ses parents proches a payer son ordonnance. Son objectif principal est d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale   de la famille élargie, mais aussi d' épargner de l’argent pour ses besoins personnels. Son plus grand rêve est de devenir une grande femme d’affaires.
texts.en:
Tacko is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She is a teacher, and has been working in the education sector since 2007. She supports her family and helps feed her children every day, as well as paying for their school fees. 

Tacko is a member of the UIMCEC branch in the area where she lives, and has already repaid her two previous loans. She has requested a loan of 100,000 francs CFA, which she will use to help one of her close relatives to pay for their prescriptions. Her main goal is to improve the social conditions of her extended family, as well as to save money and to cover her personal expenses. Her biggest dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy prescription drugs.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr:
Marthe est une femme de 34 ans celibataire et mere de 2 enfants tous scolarisés avec 1 nièce à sa charge . Elle est est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale et exerce cette activité depuis 6 ans. Grâce à la qualité de ses produits(poissons, crabes, crevettes ...) toujours frais et les prix pratiqués, elle a engrangé au fil des ans une clientèle quelle a su fidelisé par sa sociabilité. Suite à l'accroissement d'une demande permanente et exigente, elle fait face à des ruptures de stocks et sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientele ( hôtel, restaurant,etc...)mais également d' étendre son activité.Les benefices genérés lui permettront de continuer à envoyer ses enfants à
 l' école.
texts.en:
Marthe is a 34-year-old, single woman. She has two children, both of whom are at school, and also has a niece under her care. She works as a retailer in a neighborhood in the capital, and has been doing so for the past six years. Thanks to the quality of her always fresh products (fish, crab, shrimp, etc.) and her prices, she has built up a customer base over the years, and they remain loyal because of her friendly nature.

Following a growth in demand, which is now permanent and challenging, Marthe has encountered stock shortages. She has therefore requested a loan which will not only allow her to ensure that her customers (hotels, restaurants, etc.) remain satisfied, but will also allow her to expand her business. The profits generated will allow her to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Bol's Group

texts.en:
Bol, aged 25, is a resident from a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has been rice farming on two hectares of farmland for several years to earn a living. She can earn about KHR 10,000 per day from the current business. Drought is the main challenge for her paddy-field business. 

Bol’s group consists of four members who are all female and live in the same village. She leads the group which is applying for another microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The first loan has helped Bol to relieve her family’s burden. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it to pay labor costs. Bol hopes to increase her income so she can fulfill her dream of running a new business in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, aged 51, lives in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother of two children and makes a living through rice farming. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn about KHR 30,000 per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Yon has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and has completely repaid the past loan which has helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan of US$500. With this loan, she is going to buy a cow to raise in order to help her rice farming activities. Yon hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her rice farming business and to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise to help her rice farming activities

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 40 años, está casado con Teodora, de 37 años, tienen dos hijas: Miriam y Elena, y juntos viven en su propia casa, la que compraron gracias al gran trabajo que realizan a diario.
Félix se esmera por dar lo mejor a los miembros de su familia, por lo cual trabaja arduamente en sus tierras de cultivo, donde tiene cacao y maní. Viene trabajando 28 años en la agricultura y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los productos recolectados hasta cierto tramo para luego ser transportados para su venta. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo diario hoy disfruta der ver que sus plantas le resultan muy productivas, así obtiene buenas ganancias. Cuenta que los tiempos de lluvia no son de su agrado porque son los meses donde abunda mayor cantidad de insectos, perjudicando sus sembríos. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se siente orgulloso por contar una vez más con la oportunidad de crédito. Asimismo se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas como fue en los anteriores.
Con estos 2,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes para realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas.
texts.en:
Félix, 40, is married to Teodora, 37, and they have two daughters, Miriam and Elena.  They all live in their own house which they bought through working hard every day.

Félix does all he can to give his family the best, and he works hard on his cropland where he grows cocoa and peanuts.  For 28 years he has worked in agriculture; and during harvest time he has the support of hired workers who take care of the harvest and transportation of the produce to a point from which it will be taken to be sold.  He is very committed to his work because, thanks to his daily efforts, nowadays he is able to enjoy seeing how productive his plants are and what good profits they bring in.  He says that he does not like the rainy seasons because of the abundance of insects which damage his crops.

This is his third loan through MFP and he is proud to be able to take advantage of a loan once again.  He is committed to paying it back on time, as with his previous loans.

The 2,000 PEN will be used to buy fertilizer for plant maintenance.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for plant maintenance.

loans.name: Na's Group

texts.en:
Na, aged 26, lives in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has one dependent son who is under school age. To make a living, she works as a rice farmer on 0.5 hectare of farmland and plants cassava on one hectare of farmland. Na also supplements her family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for several years, she is able to earn about KHR 10,000 per day to meet her family’s needs.

Na's group consists of five female members who all live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles while the other members of the group have been with VisionFund for from one to three loan cycles. The past loans have helped her to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Na, who is leading her group to apply for a loan, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes to earn more income thus expanding her current business and making a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay labor costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida tiene 20 años, es una joven soltera y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y se esmera por salir adelante continuando con sus estudios.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, siempre está apoyando en la chacra de sus padre que con el tiempo será suya, ya que su padre le dará una hectárea para que pueda sembrar lo que mejor le genere ganancias. Frida ya tiene pensado lo que cultivará, por ello empezará desde este mes cultivando plantas de café. Ella dice que las cosechas de café son muy rentables, ya que las sociedades recolectoras gratifican muy bien por cada kilogramo. De esa manera continuará con sus estudios, porque ese es su mayor anhelo.  

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy agradecida por contar con este apoyo financiero. En su banco comunal es una socia joven, responsable con sus pagos. 
Con estos 500 nuevos soles comprará plantas de café para cultivar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Frida, 20, is a young, cheerful, single woman who lives with her parents and works hard to get ahead while continuing her education.  She is a farmer who is always helping out on her parent's plantation, which eventually will be hers, because her father will give her a hectare to grow whatever crop gives her the best profit.  Frida has already decided what she wants to grow, and as of this month she will begin planting coffee.  She says coffee growing is very profitable because the collection associations pay very well for each kilogram.  This will allow her to continue her education, which is what she desires most.

This is her second loan through MFP and she is very grateful to be able to count on this financial support.  In her communal bank she is one of the youngest members, but responsible in her payments.

With the 500 PEN she will buy coffee plants to grow on her land.

loans.use: To buy more coffee plants for land.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 34 años, tiene tres hijos, quienes se encuentran en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la casa que sus padres le dieron como herencia.
Hace 2 años que atiende la tienda de un colegio de su localidad, allí vende galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, refrescos, lapiceros, cuadernos, sándwich, etc. Además de esta labor que realiza en las mañanas, también en su vivienda vende bebidas (gaseosas, refrescos y otros). Le gusta su trabajo porque le agrada atender a los alumnos que siempre acuden a su puesto. Desde que se enteró sobre los préstamos de MFP, no dudo en acercarse y solicitar uno para que pueda mejorar su puesto.

Este es su primer crédito, por lo que está agradecida y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por permitirle ser parte y apoyarla en su necesidad. 
Con los 300 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará dos cajas de galletas variadas, caramelos, gaseosas y otros dulces para surtir su puesto.
texts.en:
Irma, 34, has three children who are school-aged.  They live together in the house she inherited from her parents.  Two years ago she opened a store at the town school where she sells cookies, sweets, sodas, softdrinks, penciles, notebooks, sandwiches, etc.   Apart from this work, which she does in the mornings, she also sells drinks (sodas, softdrinks, etc.) out of her home.  She enjoys her work because she likes selling to the students who always come to her stall.  Ever since she found out about the MFP loans, she wanted to request one to improve her stall.

This is her first loan, for which she is grateful, and she is committed to paying it back on time.  Also, she thanks her communal bank for letting her join and for supporting her in her needs.

With the 300 PEN she will buy two boxes of assorted cookies, sweets, sodas and other candy for her stall.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of assorted cookies, sweets, sodas and other candy for her stall.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn, aged 55, is a rural villager from the MongKul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is widowed and has three children, two of whom work for others for a fee. She has struggled to feed her family by selling grocery items and supplementing her family's income by working as a paid worker for 30 years. With her current business, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Yorn has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and has successfully repaid her past loans while her group members have been with VisionFund for from one to two loan cycles. She is leading the group of three to ask for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Yorn is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to earn more income thus expanding her grocery business and improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Thin's Group

texts.en:
Thin lives in a village in the MongKul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is the 52-year-old married mother of seven children: four of her sons work as paid workers. Thin has been raising pigs for almost 30 years. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee to earn extra income. The current business earns her about KHR 20,000 per day of which she manages to save about KHR 10,000 after paying her daily expenses.

Thin's group consists of two members. She has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and has completely repaid the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family's financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a loan from VisionFund of KHR 500,000 each. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy more piglets to raise and will use a portion of it to buy pig feed. With this loan, she hopes to expand her pig-raising business thus earning more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and more piglets to raise

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, a 44-year-old mother, lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She has four sons: all are dependent on her and some are in school. She has been a rice farmer on two hectares of farmland for several years. The lack of water supply for her paddy field is the main challenge for her business.

Sokha is in her second loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other group members are in their first loan cycle. She has successfully used the first loan to relieve her family’s burden. Now, she is leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Sokha is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to pay for labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her crop yields thus improving her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana continues to operate her clothes and shoe trading business. She still manages her business in the rented location as the repair of her own shop has not yet been completed. Liana spends part of her business’s income on her family’s needs and the other part she uses to finish her own shop's repairs. Liana is sure that having her own shop will allow her to reduce her business’s costs. 

Liana used her first Kiva loan to buy a spring assortment of clothes and shoes for her business. Now she is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy autumn season clothes and shoes ahead of the beginning academic year.

loans.use: to buy autumn season clothes and shoes ahead of the beginning academic year

loans.name: Ros' Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Ros is aged 28 years old and is married with two children. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice and planting pineapple. Having been in this business for several years, they are able to earn about KHR 40,000 per day to meet their family's needs. 

Ros’s group consists of three members who live in the same village. He is a second loan cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and has completely repaid the previous loan. Ros has successfully used the first loan to better support his family. Now, he and the other two group members are applying for a loan from VisionFund of KHR 1,200,000 each. Ros, who is the group leader, will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to earn more income thus fulfilling his dream of having a decent house in which to live.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Ermile

texts.en:
Ermile is 20 years old. He is married and lives in a small village in Baghdati District with his family: his wife, Nona, their 2-year-old daughter, his father and grandmother. His grandmother is a pensioner. Ermile runs the family's agricultural business. In particular, he has a vineyard and a plot of land, where nuts and maize are grown. 

Ermile works hard on his plot during the spring and summer seasons in order to get a good harvest. He picks grapes in late summer and produces wine. Ermile sells wine, nuts and maize at the local open market. In addition to his agricultural activities, Ermile works in a car wash and earns a monthly salary. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris which is hardly enough for food for the five members of the family.

Ermile has requested a loan for purchasing milking cows. He will be able to produce and sell cheese. Thus, he wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, he will be able to spend more on the family’s daily needs and the family's living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase milking cows

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married and has six children. For the past eight years, she has sold rice, beans, and salted fish in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Her husband is a mason. Esther uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase fish, and raw rice and beans in bulk. With the new profits, Esther plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, and raw rice and beans in bulk

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 24 years old. She lives in Baghdati District with her family: her mother, her brother and an uncle. Her brother and uncle have chronic health problems and get the relevant pension from the local government. Kristine and her mother are busy with their agricultural business. In particular, they are busy with livestock; they have two milking cows and a pig. Kristine milks cows twice a day and produces cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family members and the rest is sold in nearby villages. The family owns a vineyard as well. They take good care of their livestock and they work hard on their agricultural land to get a good harvest but they still don’t have enough income to save money and renovate their house. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris.

Kristine has requested a loan to purchase a milking cow. With three milking cows, she will be able to increase cheese production and sales accordingly. Thus, she wants to expand her business. With the increased income, Kristine will be able to renovate the house which is very old and uncomfortable. As a result of the above-mentioned activities, she will be able to provide better living conditions for family members and they will be able to spend their evenings after their hard-working days in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is married and has seven children. She sells kenkey (fermented maize dough) in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for the past eight years. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase maize in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa plans to continue to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has four children. She sells banku (fermented maize dumplings) and fish in Ayensudu, near Elmina, which she has done for six years. Her husband is a security officer. Ekua uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for her banku and fish. With her new profits, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her banku and fish

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 34 years old and lives in Vani district with her family. She has a husband, Gia, a father-in-law and five children (aged 3, 5, 8, 12 and 15). Three of them go to the local school and the younger children go to the village kindergarten. Tamar’s father-in-law is a pensioner.

Tamar and her husband run an agricultural business. They own three milking cows and produce cheese. They sell cheese at the local open market. The family has a plot of land and a vineyard as well. They sell nuts and wine in nearby villages. Tamar and her husband are very hard-working people and they work hard from early morning until late evening to get a good harvest. The family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get the relevant pension from the local government. 

Tamar is asking for a loan to buy a plot of land. She will be able to plant nuts and maize. Tamar and Gia will work hard on the plot during the spring and summer seasons. The loan will help her by giving her financial resources to guarantee a good harvest. The loan will improve the family’s economic situation and Tamar will be able to provide her children with all necessities.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 58 years old and lives in a small village in Baghdati district. He is married and has a wife, Izolda, and a son, George. George works as a security officer in a private company and earns a monthly salary. Tengiz and Izolda earn their living through a dairy farm with three milking cows. Izolda milks cows twice a day and produces cheese. Part of the cheese is used by the family and the rest is sold locally. They also own a plot of land and a vineyard. Tengiz and Izolda are especially busy with the plot during the spring and summer seasons in order to ensure a good harvest in late summer which they sell at the local open market.

Tengiz is now requesting a loan to purchase a milking cow. He will be able to increase cheese production and sales as well. This will help him to increase the family’s income significantly. With increased income, Tengiz will repair the house which is very old and uncomfortable. Taking into account the above-mentioned points, he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family members.

loans.use: to purchase an additional milking cow

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna continues to manage her food and household goods shop at her own small stall. After her husband's death, her elder son and his family moved into Ruzanna's house. 

Thanks to her business's income, Ruzanna was able to buy the necessary furniture for her house and to organize her three children's weddings. Ruzanna spent her previous Kiva loan on increasing her shop's assortment of goods. Now, she is seeking a 750,000 AMD loan to buy beverages, foods, cereals, canned goods, household goods, etc. to sell.

loans.use: to buy beverages, foods, cereals, canned goods, household goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 29 years old and lives in a small village of Keda district. Shorena’s family consists of six members: her husband, Guram, their two children (aged 1 and 4), her mother-in-law, her father-in-law and herself. Shorena’s husband works as a driver and earns a monthly salary. Guram's parents are pensioners. The family members earn their living through an agricultural business. They have 0.7 hectares of land, where they grow vegetables and fruits with the harvest sold locally. The family owns three milking cows as well. Shorena milks the cows every day and produces cheese. She sells the cheese at the local open market. 

Shorena has requested a loan to purchase beehives with bee colonies. The bees will produce honey  which she plans to sell in nearby villages. This will increase the family's income. With the increased profit, Shorena will be able to reinvest in the family's agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. Taking into account the above-mentioned points, the family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita sells charcoal in Ayensudu, near Elmina. She is married to a mason and has two children. Rita has been selling charcoal for six months. She is responsible for assisting with the payment of household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy charcoal in bulk. Rita hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to support her family and help her children.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 54 years old and lives in a small village in Kareli district. He is married and has a wife, Esma, and a son, Joni. Esma works at the local school as a teacher and earns a monthly salary. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They have a plot of land where tomatoes, cabbage, garlic, strawberries and barley are grown. Archil has two cars and a farm tractor. The family members work hard but they still don’t have enough income to save money to improve their living conditions.

Archil has requested a loan to purchase and legalize the ownership of the plot of land. This is essential for Archil so he can continue developing his business and have a stable income, which will help him to ensure a prosperous life for his family. He will reinvest the additional earnings to expand their agricultural enterprise to make it more profitable, thereby improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 49 years old and lives in the Kareli district with her two sons, Zaza and George (aged 20 and 22). According to the government's estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they receive monthly social assistance from the local government. 

Leila and her sons run an agricultural business which is the main source of income for the family. In particular, the family has a plot of land where tomatoes and barley are grown. The family owns a milking cow as well. Leila milks the cow every day and produces cheese. The cheese is sold at the local open market. The family works hard but they still don’t have enough income to save money to improve their living conditions. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris.

Leila has requested a loan to purchase apple saplings and also to harvest barley. She will work hard with her sons in her apple orchard to increase production. Leila will sell the harvested products for a good price. Thus, she will earn additional income. She plans to use the additional income to purchase household goods and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase apple saplings and to harvest barley

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 29 years old and lives in the Gori district with his big family, including his parents. He is married and has two children, 5 and 6 years old, who go to the local school. According to the government's estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category, so they get monthly social assistance. 

The family earns its living from a dairy farm. They have two milk cows and two calves. Simon and Nana produce cheese and yogurt and sell them in their village. Simon also owns a plot of land where he grows cucumbers, tomatoes, potatoes and cabbage and sells them at the local open market. He also works in a railway station and gets a monthly salary. All of the family members work hard, but their income is hardly enough for food and everyday expenses for this big family. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris.

Simon has requested a loan to purchase calves. He plans to raise and sell the calves after several months for a profit. This will help the family improve its living conditions, and Simon will be able to earn his living independently. Simon hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is divorced and has four children. She sells secondhand clothes in Ayensudu, near Elmina, which she has done for one year. Dorcas uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase clothes to resell. With her new profits, Dorcas plans to finance her children's educations.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is taking out another loan of Ksh 50,000 to invest it in her vegetable stall, which she recently established. She stocks a variety of fruits and vegetables including bananas, oranges, tomatoes, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity given. 

Florence says that her previous loan enabled her to accumulate money and now she has been able to open her vegetable stall. Her hope is to own a shop in future. With this requested loan, she plans to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ekua (Agnes)

texts.en: Ekua sells rice, sugar, gari, and other items in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Ekua is single and has three children. She has been selling rice, sugar, and gari for the past ten years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees as well as all other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy raw rice, sugar, and gari in bulk. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy raw rice, sugar, and gari in bulk.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells gari, rice, and sugar in Emissa Krom, near Cape Coast. Aba has gone to school through junior high school.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason. Aba has been selling gari, rice, and sugar for three years. She is responsible for caring for her young children and saving up money to pay for their eventual schooling. Her loan will be used to buy raw rice, sugar, and gari in bulk. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw rice, sugar, and gari in bulk.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells clothes in Ayensudu, near Elmina. Mercy has received education through middle school.  She is widowed and has three children. Mercy has been selling clothes for 27 years. She is responsible for caring for her children and paying household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy buy materials for her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue to support her family and help her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a shop owner who has a general store. She has been making her living running the store for more than 10 years. She is married and has four children. Her husband works as a sales representative.

Fatuma is a very hardworking person. She says that thanks to her store, she can help her husband with the household expenses. Life is very difficult, and if they can meet their expenses together, it's much better. Fatuma says that her goal is to have a large store to be able to continue helping her family.

Fatuma is requesting the loan to purchase beverages, canned goods, meats, baked goods and other basic food items, which is what she sells the most of. She gives her thanks for the opportunity she has been given with the loan; it's very important for her.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, meats, baked goods and other basic food items.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has five children. Ama sells fried fish and banku (fried corn dough) in Ayensudu, near Elmina, which she has done for ten years. Ama uses her income to pay her children's school fees. Ama will use the loan to purchase ingredients. With her new profits, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her fried fish and banku (fried corn dough).

loans.name: Basilio

texts.en:
Basilio is a farmer in the Nkubu area of central Kenya where he lives with his family. He has four children, and their ages are between 11 and 2 years. He has nine successive years in mixed farming, with his farm produce being mainly fruits, vegetables, and poultry.

Basilio has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. He says the water tank and pipes will make the water supply into the farm easier and provide sufficient water both for his dairy cows and vegetables. He believes his farming income will be better and improve his family's living standards.

Basilio says that having a lack of funds is the greatest challenge to smallholder farmers, and Juhudi Kilimo's loans are quite timely with efficient processing. He, however, mentions poor market prices and pests as other challenges after capital sourcing.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame YACINE est une commerçante qui réside au SENEGAL. Elle évolue dans ce domaine depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle sollicite un prêt de 200000FCFA qui lui permettra d’acheter des marchandises provenant d’une des villes  lointaine du SENEGAL qu’elle place auprès de ses clients qui lui remboursent à la fin du mois. Elle a eu à rembourser deux prêts antérieurs à l’U-IMCEC. Son activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et d’épargner de l’argent.  Dans le futur, elle aimerait devenir une commerçante import – EXPORT et ainsi diversifier les produits et services qu’elle commercialise.
texts.en:
Yacine is a retailer who lives in Senegal.  She has been involved in this field for more than five years.  

She is requesting a loan of 200,000 CFA francs which will allow her to buy some merchandise from one of the very far-away cities in Senegal.  She sells her products to her customers who pay her back at the end of the month.

She has already repaid two previous loans with UIMCEC.

Thanks to her professional activity, she is able to meet her personal needs and to save some money.

In the future, she would like to become involved in import-export and diversify the products and services that she offers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, perfumes and other various products.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena sells provisions and yams in Ayensudu, near Elmina. Abena has received an education through a secondary school. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a retired government employee. 

Abena has been selling provisions and yams for five years. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy provisions in bulk to sell in her store. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk.

loans.name: Radik

texts.en:
Radik drives a taxi. Recently he has become a father, and now he has a beautiful daughter! 

Thanks to his business, Radik is able to support his young family. Radik used his previous Kiva loan to repair his car and to buy new tire casings for his car.

Several days ago, Radik sold his old car. Now he is asking for a 290,000 AMD loan to which he will add the money that he got from the sale of his old car and he will buy the car in the photo. This new taxi will allow Radik to serve his clients more safely and comfortably.

loans.use: To buy a new car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Rossemary

texts.es: La Sra. Rossemary tiene 38 años tiene dos hijos de las edades de 16 y 13 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes,  Que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Magisterio este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Rossemary utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de mercadería abarrotes por mayor como arroz y azúcar,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, la Sra. Rossemary enfrenta retos en su negocio que son desbalances en la economía local, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería surtida. Su deseo para su negocio es que su tienda sea más grande y más surtida para así tener muchos clientes e incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rossemary, age 38, has two children, ages 16 and 13.  She sells basic needs products in her grocery store, which is located in the Magisterio area.

This loan is her first cycle with the institution.  Rossemary will use this loan to buy wholesale groceries like rice and sugar.  Her reason for requesting this loan is that she needs to stock her business.

Rossemary faces challenges in her business due to instability in the local economy. She will use the funds to continue to buy merchandise to stock her business. Her goal for her business is to expand her store and her inventory.   This way she will have a lot of customers, increase her income, and thereby improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale groceries like rice and sugar.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна работает в Мелитополе. Она вдова, уже на пенсии. Татьяна торгует женской обувью на нескольких местных рынках Мелитопольского района. Опыт работы у нее составляет около 20 лет. 

Татьяна обратилась в КИВА за кредитом в размере 5 000 гривен, чтобы закупить качественный товар к осеннему сезону. С сентября обязательно возрастет спрос на сезонную обувь и поэтому Татьяна хочет подготовиться и разнообразить свой ассортимент заранее, чтобы удовлетворить запросы покупателей.
texts.en:
Tatyana works in Melitopol. She is a widow and already retired. Tatyana sells women’s shoes at several local markets in the Melitopol Region. She has some 20 years of experience in this business.

Tatyana has applied to KIVA for a loan of 5,000 UAH in order to buy quality goods for the fall season. Starting in September, demand for fall shoes is certainly going to grow. This is why Tatyana wants to get ready and diversify her selection of goods in advance, so as to be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy quality shoes for the fall season.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a dedicated woman who always wants to find business opportunities whenever they arise. Her business of selling gas cylinders is doing very well and her customers are requesting more cylinders. However, her working capital has declined so she is requesting a loan in the amount of KES 35,000 to purchase more gas cylinders to meet her clients' needs. Alice hopes to improve her living standards and provide a better quality of life for her family as well as an education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more gas cylinders.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: El Sr. Lucio  tiene 64 años y es casado con hijos ya todos independientes, el Sr. Lucio  se dedica a la confección de prendas de  vestir tiene su taller de costura en la zona de Munaypata  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Lucio  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de material de construcción para construir muralla en su terreno, la razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de capital, El Sr.  Lucio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia del mercado y la falta de maquinaria para la confección de prendas de vestir y seguirá trabajando duro para  comprar  maquinas que le hacen falta y así de esta manera  incrementar su capital de trabajo, su deseo para su  negocio es tener un taller de costura más grande contratar personal que le ayude a confeccionar sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Lucio, age 64, is married and has children who are now independent.  Lucio makes clothes in his sewing shop in the Munaypata area.

This loan is his first cycle with the institution.  Lucio is going to use the loan to buy construction materials to build a wall on his land.  The reason for requesting this loan is his lack of capital.  Lucio faces challenges in his business due to the competition in the market and his lack of machinery to make clothes.  He will continue working hard in order to buy the machines he needs.  

This way he will increase his working capital.  He wishes for his business are to have a larger sewing shop and to hire people to help him make the clothes.

loans.use: to buy construction material to build a wall on his land.

loans.name: Elosy

texts.en:
Elosy is 37 years old. She has seven years of experience in active farming. She is from the rural town of Nkubu, where she lives with her family of two children, ages 15 and 8. Both children are in school. Her farm currently produces milk and vegetables with the income being used to meet the family's basic needs and improve her farming business.

Elosy has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats. She says the dairy goats will provide her family with milk and additional income. She believes dairy-goat farming is advantageous since goats are not as vulnerable as dairy cows. Additionally, they provide more nutritious milk and consume less feed.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives with her family in the city of Mombasa, Kenya. She owns her own business selling consumer products in her small store. The previous loan enabled her to improve the business as she restocked it. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES to expand on the existing business. With this loan she intends to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice, and other fast-selling products. Rose pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Yehu to open other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice, and other fast-selling products.

loans.name: Ayessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYESSI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Christine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Christine est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à un certain Célestin. Christine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Christine vend depuis dix ans des céréales et de l’huile végétale dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Christine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYESSI, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group AYESSI comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the fourth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Christine, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 51 years old and married to a man named Célestin. She did not attend school. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Christine lives together with  her husband and children. The couple share in covering the different household expenses. 

To help with different family needs, Christine has been selling grains and vegetable oil for ten years in her district. This business enables her to meet her needs without much problem. Christine gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her sales and revenues, Christine, along with the other members of the group AYESSI, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy grains and containers of vegetable oil to sell

loans.name: Darius

texts.en:
Meet Darius, he runs a Mobile money transfer in Mazabuka, a large, tree-lined town, 349 km from Livingstone and 124 km from Lusaka, Zambia. This is Darius's story:

Hello, My name is Darius. I will be 26 years old on the 5th of November. I come from a family of eight. I am the only one who has completed my high school education in my family. I run my own business of sending and receiving money. I am very grateful for this opportunity.

I live in Mazabuka, a town where sugar is produced. There is also fishing as it is very close to the Kafue River. Running my own business is a very good way for me to earn an honest living. Through my business, I get to meet a lot of people in my town. I also get to make some profits, which helps me to support my siblings and my mother back home in Mansa.

I am taking out a loan so that I can increase my working capital. Right now I have a working capital of about $620. This is not enough because Mazabuka is a town that is growing and people have come to know about my business but I cannot serve them all. I have many incidents where a customer comes and they need to send $650 to a relative, I have no choice but to ask them to use another shop because I do not have enough cash and electronic at my shop. 

My hopes and dreams are to expand my business. I am very hopeful that the Kiva loan will give my business the boost that it needs. For my personal life, I hope and wish to be a successful businessman and open up more shops in the future.

loans.use: To add on to his $620 working capital so that he can serve customers sending and receiving larger amounts of money.

loans.name: La Paix 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA PAIX 1 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Appoline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Appoline est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un certain Jean. Appoline a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Appoline est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Appoline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différents besoins du foyer. Pour parvenir aux différents besoins de la famille, Appoline vend depuis une vingtaine d’année, des céréales (riz, maïs) et des conserves dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de ses enfants. Appoline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Appoline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA PAIX 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group LA PAIX 1 comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the third time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Appoline, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 45 years old and married to a man named Jean. She has attended elementary school and is the mother of four children, all in school and in her care. Appoline lives together with  her husband and children, and she jointly ensures, along with her husband, that the different household expenses are covered.

To meet different family needs, Appoline has been selling grains (rice, corn) and canned foods for about twenty years in her district. This business enables her to meet her needs, as well as those of her children, without much problem. Christine gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her sales and revenues, Appoline, along with the other members of the group LA PAIX 1, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy grains (rice, corn) and canned foods

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is applying for a second Kiva loan through Yehu Microfinance. With this new investment she will purchase clothes, accessories, school shoes and carnival items, which are the main requests her customers have made of her during this season when her sales usually increase. 

With her other Kiva loans, she was able to increase her number of customers in Kisauni and towns she travels to so as to make her best sales. She has the following message for her financiers: “I am very grateful to Kiva and Yehu Microfinance. I hope to continue prospering with your financial support.”

loans.use: to purchase clothes, accessories, school shoes and carnival items.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a resident of the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is 27 years old and married with one child, who is eight. She has actively worked for six years as a farmer producing and selling maize, beans, potatoes, vegetables and milk. She also runs a retail shop. Catherine has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy irrigation equipment for her farm, mainly a medium-sized water tank and water pipes. She is optimistic that a good irrigation system is capable of doubling her farm's output and further develop her farming business; fluctuating rain levels has been a major challenge. She adds that Juhudi Kilimo's fast loan disbursement is a great help to farmers.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson lives in Kisauni and is still single. He operates a 'bodaboda' (motorcycle) transport business, his clients being his neighbors and passersby, which is how he earns his daily consumption. 

To further establish his business, he is seeking a Kiva loan and coming to Yehu Microfinance for his second financing. With this loan, he will purchase a new motorcycle to improve his transport business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and four go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market. She sells her products on a wholesale and retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She works six days a week. 

Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and also educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major expenses include rent, power and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Don Rodolfo, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos, vive en una aldea rural del municipio de Nueva Frontera junto a sus esposa e hijos.
Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, hace 20 años que cultiva sus propios cultivos de café, y granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local pues es su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Esta solicitando ya un segundo préstamo a ODEF, y también lo invertirá en darle asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos, comprara fertilizantes y cubrirá gastos de limpieza y siembra de café y granos básicos. Esta inversión le ayuda a sacar mas producción y de calidad. Su meta es ampliar la producción y darle una buena asistencia para sacar buenas cosechas que le ayuden a obtener más ganancias para poder vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, age 53, is married and has five children.  He lives with his wife and children in a rural village in the Nueva Frontera municipality.

He has devoted himself to agriculture his whole life.  He has been cultivating his own coffee crops and basic grains, like corn and beans, for 20 years.  He sells this production at the local market.  It is his only source of income to support his family.

He is now requesting his second loan with ODEF.  He will use it to provide care and maintenance to his crops.  He will buy fertilizers and cover the costs of clearing the land and planting coffee and basic grains.  

This investment will help him get greater production and quality production.  His goal is to increase production and to give good care to the crops in order to get good harvests.  These will help him get more income to be able to live better with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cover the costs of clearing the land and planting coffee, corn, and beans.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Kisauni with her husband. She dreams of a promising future in which she is able to provide her family with the potential for success. Her family is the motivation behind her work of selling lesos (African women's wrap cloth). The business is located in her home and she sells for cash to passersby in her area as well as to neighbors, family members, and friends. They are familiar with the products that Caroline sells and are loyal to her business. 

Caroline's goal is to achieve sustainable growth and, in this way, improve her family's income. Her biggest challenge is to build up enough working capital to be able to grow her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sibeso

texts.en:
In the heart of the copperbelt province of Zambia lies the city of Kitwe. It is the second biggest town in Zambia. This is where Sibeso owns her mobile money transfer business. She is 20 years old and lives alone. 

Sibeso comes from a family of four. She has a high school level of education. Once her business starts to make more profit, she plans to take a banking and finance course because she believes this set of skills will add value to her business. Sibeso has been running her business for three months now. She loves her business because it is able to provide money to customers who urgently need the money and it puts a smile on their faces.

When asked what challenges she faces in her business, Sibeso says that transportation of cash to and from the bank is very difficult because her location is not very secure.  She says once she gets the Kiva loan, she will not have to move cash with her because she will have enough working capital and it will be much easier to go about her day-to-day business.

The Kiva loan will help Sibeso to hire two people to help her in her shop. She says it will also help her to add to her working capital so that she does not have to constantly carry cash to and from the bank.

Sibeso asks Kiva lenders to help her increase her working capital, serve more customers, and earn more profits. She plans to use her profits to study banking and finance in a part-time course.

loans.use: To employ two people in her shop and add to her working capital.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, 33 years old, lives together with his life partner and his five children. He is a teacher by profession and is a person who is very dedicated to offering quality services in teaching. He also manages a charcoal selling business where he has hired a gentleman to operate on his behalf. He has one year of experience in the business and that has brought him great benefits, because he improves his work day by day.  

Omar is a man devoted to his work, motivated, always looking for better alternatives that will lead toward a more prosperous future for him. He trusts that if he doesn’t stop struggling he will achieve great goals. The requested amount will be used to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and lives with her life companion and their four children. Her work is selling cooked food. She has worked in this business for a number of years since it has given her very good results, and at the same time it helped her acquire great experience in preparing food. 

She is very well known in the village where she sells because, as a walking vendor, she sells the most delicious food. She already has an extensive clientele because the food that she makes is of the highest quality, with an exquisite flavor and at affordable prices. In addition, her service is very rapid. 

Elizabeth is a woman with many goals to achieve. She works day after day to have a prosperous future. Since she has increased her clientele, she wants to increase her production to thus obtain better earnings. She needs to invest in ingredients, but it is a question of capital. For this reason she is applying to Yehu Microfinance for a loan that will permit her to buy corn, corn husks, vegetables, firewood, etc. 

Elizabeth is very responsible and has impeccable morals. She guarantees the payment of the debt and at the same time is confident that she will be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn, corn husks, vegetables, firewood.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: «JESUKPEGO» est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Valérie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans. Valérie est mariée à un certain Denis. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre restent à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Valérie mène comme activité la vente des charbons de bois dans son quartier. Valérie exerce cette activité depuis une vingtaine d’années et s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.
